question: How are the metric scores calculated and displayed in the analytics page?
gold_answer:
The metric scores on the analytics page are calculated based on your order and account history within the last 90 days. Five key metrics are used to assess the service and experience you're providing to your customers, which include:

1. Late shipments
2. Canceled orders
3. Missing items
4. Damaged items
5. Late replies

Each metric card on the analytics page displays your metric score, a goal for that metric, and context on how you've performed against these goals over the last 90 days. The performance status for each metric is visually represented by colors and symbols:

- Green status (checkmark): This indicates that you are on track with the metric.
- Yellow status (caution symbol): This indicates that there is room for improvement in that metric.

The document does not mention a red status or any other status indication, so we know only about the green and yellow statuses from the provided text.

question: How does the Insider Free Shipping Partnership Program work for European brands?
gold_answer: The Insider Free Shipping Partnership Program works by allowing European brands to offer free shipping on eligible orders placed by Insider members in the US. This is achieved by splitting the shipping cost between the European brand and Faire. Once a European brand opts into the program, they are responsible for paying 50% of the total shipping cost, while Faire covers the remaining 50%.

question: What is the purpose of the Insider Free Shipping Partnership Program for European brands?
gold_answer: The purpose of the Insider Free Shipping Partnership Program for European brands is to help these brands access the US market by allowing them to offer free shipping on eligible orders placed by Insider members in the US. This is facilitated by splitting the shipping cost with Faire, where the brand pays 50% of the total shipping cost.

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
In the Additional details section, you can add details such as care instructions, fabric content, storage, and more. This information will be available on your product details page to help retailers shop confidently.
In the Attribute tags section, you’ll be able to highlight key attributes such as aesthetic, dietary or production information. These will not be explicitly listed on the product details page but will help your retailers discover your products when searching, using filters, and more.
When adding individual products, make sure you select a Product type that best describes the item. Choosing an accurate product type will ensure you have the ability to add relevant attribute tags.If you’d like to add attributes to your products in bulk, you can add attribute tags using the Bulk Editor.
Adding attributes in bulk
The Bulk Editor makes it easy to add attributes to multiple products at once. To access the Bulk Editor, follow the steps in How do I edit products using the Bulk Editor?
A few additional tips when using the Bulk editor:
Use the editor like a spreadsheet. You can easily apply the same value to multiple cells. To do so, copy a cell (Ctrl+C or ⌘+C), click and drag to select additional cells, and paste (Ctrl+V or ⌘+V).
Add or remove fields in Bulk Editor. Navigate to Add fields in the top left. Remove the checkmark from fields you no longer want visible or checkmark new fields that you’d like to update.
Add attribute tags where available. Tag products in your catalog with descriptive attributes. Note that product options cannot be individually tagged and not all categories have attributes at this time—a grey field indicates that a product or product option cannot be tagged. We’ll be adding attributes in additional categories in the coming months so stay tuned!

question: What are attribute tags and how do they benefit retailers on Faire?
gold_answer: Attribute tags on Faire are descriptive labels that can be added to products to highlight specific features or characteristics. These tags assist retailers in discovering products more effectively by allowing them to see these attributes on product listings, use them in filters, and identify them in featured collections, among other possibilities. The benefit for retailers is that they can more easily find products that meet their specific needs or preferences, which can streamline their search process and potentially lead to better product selections for their stores. The document also notes that Faire is continuously working on adding new attribute tags to further improve product discoverability for retailers.

metadata.subtitle: How do I edit a preorder?
metadata.title: Preorders

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Can I limit who can purchase my preorders?
If you are concerned about who can see and ship your preorder items, you have the ability to sell preorders to qualified retailers only. This setting is the default setting and is already toggled “on'' in your Shop Settings tab. Qualified retailers are those who have met Faire’s wholesale buying requirements or are on your Faire customer list. With this toggle on, only these retailers will be able to view your preorder items. For more info on qualified retailers, see here.
Can I bulk upload preorders?
Yes! If you would like to add preorder products in bulk to your shop, you can add these listings to your shop using the Bulk Upload tool in your portal.
Navigate to the Bulk Upload tab in your portal. Click “Start New Upload” and “Download Template” under Step 1 to get started.
The below sections must be filled out in the Bulk Upload template to create a preorder product:
Preorder (Y/N)
Ship By Date (YYYY-MM-DD)
Ship By End Date (if range, YYYY-MM-DD)
Order By Date (YYYY-MM-DD)
Sell After Order By/Ship Date (Y/N)
For more information about each section that must be filled out to create a preorder, follow these instructions:
When the preorder item is expected to ship
Any date <= 730 days from now

question: What happens if I don't set a deadline for placing an order for a preorder listing?
gold_answer: If you don't set a deadline for placing an order for a preorder listing, the listing will not be deactivated until the ship date has passed. You may leave the "Deadline to place an order" field blank if you do not need to have all orders in by a certain date.

Products containing animal substances
To learn more, visit the Code of Federal Regulations, Title 9.
Plant and seed products
To learn more, visit Importing plants and plant products from the US Customs and Border Protection information center.
Fish and wildlife products
To learn more, visit the Wildlife, fish, amphibians (lizards, snakes, etc.) and animal parts guidance in the US Customs and Border Protection information center.
Pet food products
Regulated by the FDA, to learn more, visit Importing Animal Food
Dangerous goods (DG), are substances that when transported are a risk to health, safety, property or the environment. Certain dangerous goods that pose risks even when not being transported are known as hazardous materials.)
To check if your products are categorized as dangerous goods, we recommend referring to the shipping carrier classification.
If your products are classified as dangerous goods, use Ship on your own.
Please note, this list is non-exhaustive and purely indicative. Faire takes no responsibility in updating these websites, the resources linked are governmental pages only.
If your products fall under these categories, be aware they may be subject to additional controls, or require more specific information fields on the commercial invoice to ensure smooth import into the EU.
If required fields are missing in the Faire generated commercial invoice, or your products require additional tariff code digits (see Updating your product information) we recommend you create your own commercial invoice and provide any additional information, certification, documentation required by the country you are shipping to.
Updating your product information

metadata.subtitle: Selling and importing your products into the US
metadata.title: Selling and importing your products into the US

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
To prevent these situations from arising, we recommend you follow the guidelines outlined in How to determine if your products can be imported and sold in the US, and adjust your selling territories in your shop settings accordingly to your readiness to export.
Shipping methods
When shipping an order to the US, depending on your location and shipping method(s) available, you will have access to:
Ship with Faire
Ship with Faire is currently available to brands in select countries, to learn more visit Ship with Faire
Ship on Your Own
Ship on your Own is not available to all brands
Here are additional resources you can consult to answer shipping related questions:
Ship with Faire Insurance
How do I create a commercial invoice?
How are shipping cost estimates calculated?
Managing shipping options and costs
International shipments can be costly. Here are some important key factors and information to consider when shipping your products internationally:
Faire does not support pallet shipping through Ship with Faire
If your products are heavy and/or bulky, selling internationally will automatically result in higher shipping costs. We recommend lowering your order minimum for intercontinental orders. This will help balance the product value / shipping cost ratio.
We have noticed brands selling heavy and bulky products that have a low to medium price point focus their targeting on more local markets, as the shipping costs associated with selling this type of product internationally does not always allow for margin.
When using Ship with Faire, Faire will be the account holder in relation to the carrier, but you are still the exporter of record. The guidelines and responsibilities detailed in this article still apply.

question: How can I check if my products are classified as dangerous goods and what should I do if they are?
gold_answer: To check if your products are classified as dangerous goods, you should refer to the shipping carrier classification. If your products are indeed classified as dangerous goods, you should use the "Ship on your own" option. It is important to note that dangerous goods are substances that pose a risk to health, safety, property, or the environment, and certain dangerous goods remain hazardous even when not in transport.

gold_docs.page_content:
Update the ship date for the order by clicking the pen icon next to the “Requested Ship Date” section.


   Item details:


Update item quantities by changing the number of units in the “Qty” column.

Add another product to the order by clicking the “Add Product” button then selecting the product you wish to add.

Remove an item from the order by clicking the trash can icon next to that item.

Add preorder products by clicking the “Add Product” button at the bottom of the “Item Details'' section. In the search bar, type in the name of the preorder product you would like to add, then select the product. Please note: You can’t have non-preorder listings and preorder listings in the same order due to different ship dates. Once your edits are complete, click "Update" to save and leave an optional note for the retailer.


   




Add or remove a tester by checking or unchecking the “Include a tester” box beneath the corresponding item. Please note: this will only appear for products with testers enabled.



Promotion:


Apply a promotion or modify a promotion already applied to the order by choosing from the promotions you were running when the order was placed or setting a custom promotion specifically for this order. Custom promotions may consist of a discount ($ or % off) and/or free shipping.

Remove a promotion from the order by selecting the “No Promotion” option.




  Promotion:
gold_docs.fmt_content:
Source: https://www.faire.com/support/articles/360053212551
Title: Can I edit a retailer’s order?
Content:
Update the ship date for the order by clicking the pen icon next to the “Requested Ship Date” section.


   Item details:


Update item quantities by changing the number of units in the “Qty” column.

Add another product to the order by clicking the “Add Product” button then selecting the product you wish to add.

Remove an item from the order by clicking the trash can icon next to that item.

Add preorder products by clicking the “Add Product” button at the bottom of the “Item Details'' section. In the search bar, type in the name of the preorder product you would like to add, then select the product. Please note: You can’t have non-preorder listings and preorder listings in the same order due to different ship dates. Once your edits are complete, click "Update" to save and leave an optional note for the retailer.


   




Add or remove a tester by checking or unchecking the “Include a tester” box beneath the corresponding item. Please note: this will only appear for products with testers enabled.



Promotion:


Apply a promotion or modify a promotion already applied to the order by choosing from the promotions you were running when the order was placed or setting a custom promotion specifically for this order. Custom promotions may consist of a discount ($ or % off) and/or free shipping.

Remove a promotion from the order by selecting the “No Promotion” option.




  Promotion:

metadata.title: Can I edit a retailer’s order?

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Am I able to undo an edit?
There is currently no way to specifically undo an edit, however, you are more than welcome to edit the order again using the steps above to alter changes you had made previously.
Will Faire Protection or Restricted State settings change if I edit the shipping address?
No, editing an order’s shipping address will not affect the retailer’s Faire Protection or Restricted State setting.

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Need to make a change to an order you received on Faire? You can edit your orders anytime prior to shipment by clicking the “Edit Order” button on your order fulfillment page.
You will then have the ability to make the following edits to the order:
Change the shipping address and shipping date
Adjust item quantities
Add or adjust promotions
Add and remove items
At this stage if you are not ready to fulfill the order you can use the “notes” field to make a record of any pending tasks needed to complete the order.
How to edit an order
If you need to make a change to an order you’ve received, follow the steps below:
Select the order that you wish to edit from your Orders page. Once you are on the order fulfillment page, click the “Edit Order” link featured in the top right corner.
On the order editing page, you can make changes to the following sections of an order:
Shipping details:
Update the shipping address for the order by clicking the pen icon next to the “Ship To” section.
Update the ship date for the order by clicking the pen icon next to the “Requested Ship Date” section.
Item details:
Update item quantities by changing the number of units in the “Qty” column.
Add another product to the order by clicking the “Add Product” button then selecting the product you wish to add.
Remove an item from the order by clicking the trash can icon next to that item.

metadata.title: WooCommerce Integration with Faire

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
What is the WooCommerce Integration?
The WooCommerce Integration with Faire will allow you to seamlessly sync information between the two platforms including:
Product Import of new products from WooCommerce to Faire
Ongoing product syncing to allow them to update information on Faire products such as images, descriptions, etc.
Syncing orders from Faire to WooCommerce
Syncing inventory between Faire and WooCommerce
Syncing fulfillment information from WooCommerce back to Faire
How do I install the Faire for WooCommerce Plugin?
Please note:
You need to have a WooCommerce PHP of 7.4 or higher installed to use this integration.
This integration is not compatible if you have WPML installed in WooCommerce.
Are you a visual learner? Check out this walkthrough video to learn how to setup this Plugin!
1. Find the WooCommerce app listing in your Faire Integrations Hub, and generate the API token in bottom right corner.
2. When you're ready to get started, login to your WooCommerce account and navigate to the Plugins page via the left menu bar.
3. Download the zip folder below:
4. Select Upload Plugin and upload the zip file
5. Activate the Plugin, and you should notice the Faire for WooCommerce integration on your Plugins page
6. Navigate to your WooCommerce Settings  page via the left menu bar
7. Select the Integrations tab
8. Select Faire settings

question: How can I link my Faire products to my WooCommerce store?
gold_answer: To link your Faire products to your WooCommerce store, make sure that all products in both Faire and WooCommerce have an SKU associated with the product variants. Then, go to the ‘Product Linking’ section of your WooCommerce settings and click ‘link products now’. This action will link all existing Faire products to a WooCommerce product based on the SKU. After doing so, you can check the ‘Last Linking Results’ to see how many products were successfully linked.

question: What should I do to determine if the products I want to purchase from international brands can be imported and resold in the EU?
gold_answer:
To determine if the products you want to purchase from international brands can be imported and resold in the EU, you should take the following steps:

1. Consult governmental websites to check for any restrictions or specific requirements for importing the products you wish to purchase internationally.

2. Investigate any license requirements or permits you may need as an importer when purchasing certain products. For further information, you can visit the "Guide for import of goods."

3. Look into potential restrictions enforced by your country, based on the country of manufacturing/origin of the products.

4. Consider consulting legal counsel and/or a customs broker to determine your readiness to import given products from a given country.

Make sure to pay attention to documentation and compliance requirements for the import of international products into the EU.

Title: Buying and importing into the EU
Content:
To determine if the products you want to purchase from international brands can be imported, and resold in the EU, we recommend: Consulting governmental websites to check if there are any restrictions or specific requirements for importing the products you wish to purchase internationally.

Look into any license requirements, or permit you may need as an importer when purchasing certain products. To learn more, visit Guide for import of goods

Looking into potential restrictions enforced by your country, based on the country of manufacturing/origin of the products. 

 Consulting legal counsel and/or a customs broker to determine your readiness to import given products from a given country.  Documentation and compliance requirements for the import of international products into the EU

question: Where can I find information about license requirements and permits needed for importing certain products into the EU?
gold_answer: To find information about license requirements and permits needed for importing certain products into the EU, you should look into the "Guide for import of goods." Additionally, consulting governmental websites and seeking advice from legal counsel and/or a customs broker can help you determine your readiness to import given products from a given country and understand the documentation and compliance requirements.

gold_docs.page_content:
Bohemian : A more unconventional style considered to be folk or romani-inspired, with mixed patterns, bright and warm colors, bold paisley and ikat prints, unstructured silhouettes and natural fabrics 
Classic : These pieces rarely mess with original designs and cuts, often featuring neutral or pastel colors, classic prints, structured tailoring, and conventional silhouettes. Emphasis is on smaller unique details and quality. Can have a collegiate or tennis/golf influence to the aesthetic 
Glam : Glamorous and bold that often include ornamental details, sequins, leather, metallics, feathers, bedazzled, cut outs, and cropped tops 
Minimalist : Characterized by simplicity and monochromatic palettes. Minimalist style focuses on closet staples that can mix and match to create multiple outfits for any occasion. Minimalist items are considered timeless 
Retro / vintage : Muted and earthy tones such as yellowed browns, blues, teal, peach; varying textures; retro patterns like paisley, polka dot, plaid, as well as easy and often looser silhouettes 
Romantic / whimsical : Flirty & feminine style, girly, nostalgic 
Streetwear : Fashion-forward, casual clothing worn by followers of popular culture with a wide range of influences including skate and surf culture, hip-hop music, sports, haute couture fashion, and K-Pop. Mixture of oversized and slimmer silhouettes with both brighter and darker colors 
Western : Inspired by the American "Wild West" and cowboys/cowgirls  Fit

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Romantic / whimsical : Flirty & feminine style, girly, nostalgic
Streetwear : Fashion-forward, casual clothing worn by followers of popular culture with a wide range of influences including skate and surf culture, hip-hop music, sports, haute couture fashion, and K-Pop. Mixture of oversized and slimmer silhouettes with both brighter and darker colors
Western : Inspired by the American "Wild West" and cowboys/cowgirls
Fit
Junior : Typically designed for younger customers with fewer curves and a smaller bust
Maternity : For women during pregnancy that will provide comfort and fit to their changing bodies
Missy : Target segment is the mature/average size women with a fuller fit than junior or contemporary
Petite : Petite sizes are designed for women 5'4” and under, regardless of their size. In the petite category, sizes range from extra-small to plus-size. They also have a “P” label to illustrate a smaller and proportioned fit
Plus Size : Generally a women’s size 18 and beyond. “Missy” or “straight” sizes range from XXS–XXL, US: 00–16/18; EU: 28-50, whereas plus sizes range from US: 14W–26W, 0X–4X; EU: 46W-58W and greater
Tall : Clothing designed for people with a taller than average height. These garments typically have longer sleeves, inseams, and torso lengths
Contemporary - Regular fit that falls between classic and slim fits
Unisex : Clothing that does not have a tailored fit for a specific gender - these garments often have loose cuts and fits. Note that Unisex here refers to the fit and not the look of the product or target customer

Occasion
Bridal : Anything that can be worn by a bride or bride-to-be to her bridal events and wedding
Cocktail : In between formal and casual, meant for special occasions and events
Day Party : Clothing suitable for daytime celebrations or parties, such as birthdays, brunch outings, or graduation parties. Clothing options can range from casual to semi-formal depending on the event
Everyday Essentials : Casual clothing for everyday wear
Formal : Fancy attire for important events and occasions such as weddings, galas, and award ceremonies
Holiday : Festivewear for celebrating the winter-time holidays, typically worn November - December; similar to Cocktail but with a holiday flair
Lounging : Comfortable clothing meant for relaxing
Night Out : Clothes for a night out to dinner, drinks, a show
Outdoor Adventures : Clothing suitable for outdoor activities such as hiking, camping, or skiing, often featuring durable and weather-resistant fabrics and functional design features
Resort / Vacation : Clothing suitable for hot-weather vacations or trips, often featuring lightweight and breathable fabrics, relaxed fits, and tropical or beachy colors and prints
Wedding Guest : Anything that can be worn to a wedding as a guest
Work : Professional business attire suitable for offices, meetings, office-job related work
Working Out : Clothing suitable for physical activity or exercise, often made of breathable fabrics and featuring moisture-wicking or compression properties
Season

payout.  How do I get paid as a Canadian brand?

metadata.subtitle: How is my payout calculated?
metadata.title: How much does it cost to sell on Faire if I’m based in North America?

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
It’s free to join Faire, and your costs for each order consist of commission and a payment processing fee. You’ll only pay commission when we connect you with a new retailer through our marketplace.
How much do I pay on orders from my Faire Direct customers?
You'll pay 0% commission on Faire Direct orders from customers you bring to Faire. Send existing or prospective customers your personalized Faire Direct link, and if they shop using your link, you'll pay 0% commission on their orders.They’ll be able to enjoy the benefits of shopping on Faire, like 60-day payment terms for eligible retailers and free returns on first orders. If your customer is new to Faire, they'll also get a sign-up incentive and free shipping with you for one year.
For more information on Faire Direct, check out this guide: What is Faire Direct?
How much do I pay for orders I get through the marketplace?
The standard commission rate for orders from the Faire marketplace is 15%.
When a customer first discovers you on Faire’s marketplace, we charge a one-time new customer fee of $10, on top of the standard commission rate. The $10 new customer fee only applies to the first order from a new customer—future reorders will be at the standard 15% rate.
The commission rate applied to any replacement order will be the same rate applied to the original order. However, we will only charge the new customer fee once, and we will not apply it to replacement orders or split orders.
What’s included in the commission fee and new customer fee?

The commission rate applied to any replacement order will be the same rate applied to the original order. However, we will only charge the new customer fee once, and we will not apply it to replacement orders or split orders.
What’s included in the commission fee and new customer fee?

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
It’s free to join Faire, and your costs for each order consist of commission and a payment processing fee. You’ll only pay commission when we connect you with a new retailer through our marketplace.
How much do I pay on orders from my Faire Direct customers?
You'll pay 0% commission on Faire Direct orders from customers you bring to Faire. Send existing or prospective customers your personalized Faire Direct link, and if they shop using your link, you'll pay 0% commission on their orders.They’ll be able to enjoy the benefits of shopping on Faire, like 60-day payment terms for eligible retailers and free returns on first orders. If your customer is new to Faire, they'll also get a sign-up incentive and free shipping with you for one year.
For more information on Faire Direct, check out this guide: What is Faire Direct?
How much do I pay for orders I get through the marketplace?
The standard commission rate for orders from the Faire marketplace is 15%.
When a customer first discovers you on Faire’s marketplace, we charge a one-time new customer fee of $10, on top of the standard commission rate. The $10 new customer fee only applies to the first order from a new customer—future reorders will be at the standard 15% rate.
The commission rate applied to any replacement order will be the same rate applied to the original order. However, we will only charge the new customer fee once, and we will not apply it to replacement orders or split orders.
What’s included in the commission fee and new customer fee?

question: How can I control who can see and ship my preorder items?
gold_answer: To control who can see and ship your preorder items, you can utilize the default setting in your Shop Settings tab that allows you to sell preorders to qualified retailers only. With this setting toggled on, only retailers who have met Faire’s wholesale buying requirements or those who are on your Faire customer list will be able to view your preorder items.

metadata.subtitle: Can my SEPA balance be adjusted?
metadata.title: How does the SEPA balance work?

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
When you select SEPA as your payment method, you will now have a balance that you can spend using this payment method.
Why is there a SEPA balance?
We are continuously working on ways to increase trust and security on the platform to make it a better experience for you. For this reason, we are implementing a limit on the amount that can be charged through SEPA. This balance can continue to change based on how many successful transactions you make on Faire.
How do I view my SEPA balance?
Once you have linked a SEPA account, you can view your SEPA limit by clicking Account > Payment Method
How does my SEPA balance change when I order on Faire?
When you choose SEPA as your payment method, you will see that you have a certain limit to spend using SEPA. Below is an example of how your limit decreases and gets restored with each transaction:
Retailer chooses SEPA as the payment method: SEPA balance is $1000
Retailer places $400 order: SEPA balance decreases to $600
Retailer's payment is successfully processed within 5-7 days: SEPA balance is restored back to $1000
Can my SEPA balance be adjusted?
As you continue to have your payments for your orders on Faire successfully processed, we will periodically review and increase your balance.
What do I do if my order amount is above my SEPA balance?
If your order amount is above your SEPA balance please choose another payment method, such as a credit or debit card, to complete the transaction. Other payment methods do not have limits.
Why can’t I choose SEPA as my payment method?

gold_answer:

2. Click on "Account".
3. Go to "Payment Method".

Your SEPA limit should be visible there.

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Once the template has been filled in with all of your product details, you can move on to Step 2 in your portal and upload your complete spreadsheet. Once you select Submit you will receive an email confirmation that the upload is complete. To learn more about the Bulk Upload process, you can reference How do I add products using the Bulk Uploader?
Editing preorders in bulk
Once you're in the Bulk Edit tool, follow the steps below:
Select + Add fields
Select Preorder In the Product settings section
Now you’ll be able to view and edit preorder settings using the Bulk Editor:
Enable or disable preorderability
Ship date (required)
Order by date (optional)
To learn more about the Bulk Editor, you can reference How do I edit products using the Bulk Editor?
How will preorders appear in my account?
When a retailer places an order that includes immediates and preorder listings, the orders will be split up depending on the shipment date. You can filter the order type by Immediates or Preorders on the Orders page by selecting on the dropdown menu beside the search bar.
How do I accept or cancel a preorder?
To accept a preorder, follow the same process as accepting an ATS order. To find new preorders, look for the New Wholesale Order email that was sent to you, select View Order or log into your Faire account, go to My Orders, or select the new order.

Once you're in the Bulk Edit tool, follow the steps below:
Select + Add fields
Select Preorder In the Product settings section
Now you’ll be able to view and edit preorder settings using the Bulk Editor:
Enable or disable preorderability
Ship date (required)
Order by date (optional)
To learn more about the Bulk Editor, you can reference How do I edit products using the Bulk Editor?
How will preorders appear in my account?
When a retailer places an order that includes immediates and preorder listings, the orders will be split up depending on the shipment date. You can filter the order type by Immediates or Preorders on the Orders page by selecting on the dropdown menu beside the search bar.
How do I accept or cancel a preorder?
To accept a preorder, follow the same process as accepting an ATS order. To find new preorders, look for the New Wholesale Order email that was sent to you, select View Order or log into your Faire account, go to My Orders, or select the new order.

metadata.title: Selling and importing your products into the US

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
International shipments can be costly. Here are some important key factors and information to consider when shipping your products internationally:
Faire does not support pallet shipping through Ship with Faire

If your products are heavy and/or bulky, selling internationally will automatically result in higher shipping costs. We recommend lowering your order minimum for intercontinental orders. This will help balance the product value / shipping cost ratio. 
We have noticed brands selling heavy and bulky products that have a low to medium price point focus their targeting on more local markets, as the shipping costs associated with selling this type of product internationally does not always allow for margin.
When using Ship with Faire, Faire will be the account holder in relation to the carrier, but you are still the exporter of record. The guidelines and responsibilities detailed in this article still apply.

Title: Can I offer a promotion?
Content:

metadata.subtitle: Can I edit my product specific promotion?
metadata.title: Can I offer a promotion?

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Absolutely! Promotions are a great way to increase conversion and attract new customers to your Faire store.
You can offer shop-wide promotions or product-specific promotions:
Shop-wide promotions
Individual promotion - offering a single promotion for all retailers
Example: 5% off orders over $300
Multiple benefit promotion - offering a price/percentage discount & free shipping at the same time
Example: 5% off and free shipping on orders over $300
Tiered promotion - offering different levels of promotions when certain price points are reached by your retailer
Example: 5% off orders over $300, 10% off orders over $400, 15% off orders over $500 + free shipping
Promo codesYou can create and share custom promo codes that your customers can apply at checkout when ordering with you on Faire. A few ways you can use promo codes to support your business and success on Faire are:
Increase first-time purchases
Drive reorders
Limit promotions to specific buyer lists
Create lifelong customers
Celebrate special occasions
Elevate your customer service
Product-specific promotions
Run promotions on specific products within your shop: You can use these to showcase seasonal products or make room for new products with promotions on excess inventory
Please note that you can only have up to one active shop-wide promotion running at the same time, and there is no limit to how many product-specific promotions you can run concurrently. You can set and schedule the timeframe for your promotion under your Promotions tab. On the last scheduled day of your promotion, the deal will expire at 11:59 pm in your time zone, regardless of where the retailer is based.

metadata.subtitle: Can I offer a promotion?
metadata.title: Can I offer a promotion?

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
After the promotion has been activated, you can deactivate your promotion any time prior to the end date. You can also extend the window of existing promotions as long as your additional promotions lined up do not overlap.
Once a promotion has ended, it cannot be reactivated. You’ll need to create a new promotion. Additionally, each promotion code can only be used once.
How to create a shop-wide promotion
Follow these steps to get your promotion up and running:
Click on the Promotions section listed under your “Marketing” tab
Click on the “Create Promotion” button
Fill out the required fields with all of your promotion details:
Promotion name: this code will automatically apply for customers at checkout
Promotion dates: the timeframe your promotion will be active (start and end date)
Promotion eligibility: Type of customer that is able to use the promo (all customers, new customers, returning customers), as well as the customer location for the promo.
Please keep in mind that you will only be able to create promotions for retailers in locations that you have toggled on in your portal. For more information on this, please see here.
Promotion tiers: Max of 3 tiers that allow you to create "buy more, save more" promotions
Promotion details: Choose % off, $ off, or free shipping
Promotion eligibility: Type of customer that is able to use the promo (all customers, new customers, returning customers), as well as the customer location for the promo.
Please keep in mind that you will only be able to create promotions for retailers in locations that you have toggled on in your portal. For more information on this, please see here.

question: Can I run a product-specific promotion while running a shop-wide promotion?
gold_answer: The document does not provide specific information regarding whether you can run a product-specific promotion while running a shop-wide promotion. It only confirms that you can offer a promotion and edit the end date of an active promotion, with additional functionality for adding/editing products to active promotions being worked on for a future release. For details on running concurrent promotions, you would need to refer to additional documentation or contact support directly.

metadata.title: Creating a campaign

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
After the email has been sent, you’ll see the status update to “Sent” along with the analytics on the left hand side. These will include the Open %, Clicked %, $ Revenue, and Orders placed through the campaign email links.
For more information about your recipients, feel free to click into the campaign. Here you’ll be able to export your recipient list to view which contacts received it successfully, unsubscribed, or bounced. You’ll also see which customers have viewed and clicked on your campaign within the exported file.
If your campaign analytics are showing that 0 emails were delivered, we recommend making sure all the information has had time to properly load. Please allow up to 24 hours for all campaign analytics to fully load in the Faire portal.
Why do my campaign emails say 'unsent'?
In order to preserve the experience of retailers, our system limits the amount of marketing campaign emails that retailers can receive in a day.
Here are the details of our emailing system for faire.com domains:
Each retailer can receive up to 2 campaign emails from brands on Faire across a 24 hour period
Each brand can email a retailer once every 24 hours
Ex: If you haven't emailed your retailer in the past 24 hours and the retailer hasn't been emailed by 2 other brands in the past 24 hours, your email will be sent!

metadata.subtitle: How long will you hold these funds?
metadata.title: Why am I seeing a pending charge from Faire?

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
When you place an order on Faire using Payment on Shipment, we may place a temporary authorization hold on your debit or credit card statement. This allows us to verify your payment method. This hold is not a charge, and will drop as soon as your order ships.
How long will you hold these funds?
The hold will drop once the order is shipped, and payment for the order will be processed. If the order does not ship within 7 days, though, the hold will be dropped.
Why was my card charged twice?
In some cases, the authorization hold may not be processed as quickly as the payment, once the order is shipped. Depending on your bank’s processing times, this hold should be dropped within 1-2 business days.
What happens if the authorization hold fails?
If the authorization hold fails and the order does not go through successfully, you will need to update your payment method until the order is successfully placed.

question: How can I ensure that my payment method is successfully updated?
gold_answer: To ensure that your payment method is successfully updated, you will need to provide a new payment method that can be authorized successfully. This typically involves entering the details of a different credit card or updating the information for your current payment method if it has changed or was entered incorrectly. Make sure that all details are accurate and that the payment method has sufficient funds or credit available for the transaction. Once you have updated your payment method, you can attempt to place your order again. If the update is successful and the order goes through, you should not see a pending charge from Faire related to an authorization hold failure.

gold_docs.page_content: Your payout for an order on Faire is calculated using the following formula: Payout amount = (order subtotal) + (shipping reimbursement) - (commission) - (payout fee) Order subtotal: (cumulative wholesale cost of the items in your order, minus any brand-funded promotions) Shipping reimbursement: The cost of shipping (only applies when the order is fulfilled on your own, not using Ship with Faire) Commission: Order subtotal x commission rate for given order type

metadata.subtitle: How much do I pay on orders from my Faire Direct customers?
metadata.title: How much does it cost to sell on Faire if I’m based outside of North America?

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
It’s free to join Faire, and you’ll only pay commission when we connect you with a new retailer through our marketplace.
Are you a brand based in North America? If so, read about the cost to sell on Faire in North America here.
How much do I pay on orders from my Faire Direct customers?
You'll pay 0% commission on Faire Direct orders from customers you bring to Faire. Send existing or prospective customers your personalized Faire Direct link, and if they shop using your link, you'll pay 0% commission on their orders.They’ll be able to enjoy the benefits of shopping on Faire, like 60-day payment terms for eligible retailers and free returns on first orders. If your customer is new to Faire, they'll also get a sign-up incentive and free shipping with you for one year.
For more information on Faire Direct, check out this guide: What is Faire Direct?
How much do I pay for orders I get through the marketplace?
The standard commission rate for reorders orders from the Faire marketplace is 15%.
When a customer first discovers you on Faire’s marketplace, we charge brands outside of North America a one-time referral fee of 10%, on top of the standard 15% commission rate. This means that the opening order rate of 25% only applies to the first order from a new customer—future reorders will be at the 15% rate.
An order is considered a reorder if it is placed at least 24 hours after the first order. If a second order is placed by a new customer within 24 hours of the first order, the 25% commission will apply to both orders.

question: How is the payout amount for an order on Faire calculated?
gold_answer:
The payout amount for an order on Faire is calculated using the formula:

Payout amount = (order subtotal) + (shipping reimbursement) - (commission) - (payout fee)

Where:

- Order subtotal is the cumulative wholesale cost of the items in your order, minus any brand-funded promotions.
- Shipping reimbursement is the cost of shipping, which only applies when the order is fulfilled on your own, not using Ship with Faire.
- Commission is the order subtotal multiplied by the commission rate for the given order type.

If your account has been compromised, follow the steps below:
Log into the email account you use with Faire and change the password.
Log into your Faire account and change the password. If you are unable to log in, reset your password. If you do not receive a password reset email, contact Faire support.
Check your recent orders (including the addresses) and update or cancel them if necessary.
Review your account details and settings to make sure all the information is correct.
Contact our Faire support team here if you need any help resolving issues on your account.

Title: Faire account security best practices
Content:
Only enter sensitive information on websites that are secured by HTTPS. Those websites will have a lock icon in the address bar.
You can find more information on protecting yourself from phishing emails here.
What to do when your account is compromised
If your account has been compromised, follow the steps below:
Log into the email account you use with Faire and change the password.
Log into your Faire account and change the password. If you are unable to log in, reset your password. If you do not receive a password reset email, contact Faire support.
Check your recent orders (including the addresses) and update or cancel them if necessary.
Review your account details and settings to make sure all the information is correct.
Contact our Faire support team here if you need any help resolving issues on your account.
Protect your private and sensitive information by following these government guides.
Canada: RCMP - Anti-Fraud Center
US: FTC - Identity theft recovery plan, FTC - Identity theft steps
Europe: Europol - Identity theft prevention guide

metadata.subtitle: Faire account security best practices
metadata.title: Faire account security best practices

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Follow these tips to protect yourself against phishing emails: Always verify the source of emails by checking who sent you the email, and be careful to only open emails from trusted sources. Only open links and attachments in emails from sources you trust and know. Make sure to check the URL (address bar) on any links you open and only enter sensitive information if you recognize the URL. Only enter sensitive information on websites that are secured by HTTPS. Those websites will have a lock icon in the address bar.
   You can find more information on protecting yourself from phishing emails here.  What to do when your account is compromised

question: What should I do if my Faire account has been compromised?
gold_answer:
If your Faire account has been compromised, you should take the following steps:

1. Log into the email account you use with Faire and change the password.
2. Log into your Faire account and change the password. If you are unable to log in, reset your password. If you do not receive a password reset email, contact Faire support.
3. Check your recent orders, including the addresses, and update or cancel them if necessary.
4. Review your account details and settings to make sure all the information is correct.
5. Contact the Faire support team if you need any help resolving issues on your account.
6. Protect your private and sensitive information by following the government guides provided for your region:

   - Canada: RCMP - Anti-Fraud Center
   - US: FTC - Identity theft recovery plan, FTC - Identity theft steps
   - Europe: Europol - Identity theft prevention guide

Title: I can't fulfill an order
Content:
If, for some reason, you cannot fulfill any of the order that you have received: Click into the order from your Orders tab Click the "Cancel Order" button A window will appear requesting you to provide the reason why you aren't able to fulfill the order - this will help us manage the retailer's expectations Then press "Submit" Both you and the retailer will receive an email confirmation of the cancelation     If you can

metadata.subtitle: If you cannot fulfill any of the order
metadata.title: I can't fulfill an order

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
We're sorry to hear that you can't fulfill a newly received order. However, we understand things happen:
Your buyer is too close to one of your other stockists and fulfilling the order would break your exclusivity agreement
You are unable to fulfill orders for "Online-only" retailers
You are unable to fulfill the order in a reasonable time due to other circumstances
If you cannot fulfill any of the order
If, for some reason, you cannot fulfill any of the order that you have received:
Click into the order from your Orders tab
Click the "Cancel Order" button
A window will appear requesting you to provide the reason why you aren't able to fulfill the order - this will help us manage the retailer's expectations
Then press "Submit"
Both you and the retailer will receive an email confirmation of the cancelation
If you can fulfill part of the order
If you can't fulfill some of the order, please place the items as out-of-stock or discontinued by clicking "Edit Item Availability".
This will notify the retailer of the change in their order. You can then proceed in fulfilling the remainder of the order.
Check out this article to read more about editing item availability.
Have questions? Feel free to contact us using the form below!

question: How can I cancel an order that I am unable to fulfill?
gold_answer:
To cancel an order that you are unable to fulfill, follow these steps:

1. Click into the order from your Orders tab.
2. Click the "Cancel Order" button.
3. A window will appear requesting you to provide the reason why you aren't able to fulfill the order - this will help manage the retailer's expectations.
4. Then press "Submit".

After you submit the cancellation, both you and the retailer will receive an email confirmation of the cancellation.

question: What happens after I submit a cancellation request for an order?
gold_answer: After you submit a cancellation request for an order, both you and the retailer will receive an email confirmation of the cancellation.

gold_docs.page_content:
Shipping methods
When shipping an order to the EU, depending on your location and shipping method(s) available, you will have access to:
Ship with Faire
Ship with Faire is currently available to brands in select countries, to learn more visit Ship with Faire
Ship on Your Own
Ship on your Own is not available to all brands
Here are additional resources you can consult to answer shipping related questions:
Ship with Faire Insurance
How do I create a commercial invoice?
How are shipping cost estimates calculated?
Managing shipping options and costs
International shipments can be costly. Here are some important key factors and information to consider when shipping your products internationally:
Faire does not support pallet shipping through Ship with Faire
If your products are heavy and/or bulky, selling internationally will automatically result in higher shipping costs. We recommend lowering your order minimum for intercontinental orders. This will help balance the product value / shipping cost ratio.
We have noticed brands selling heavy and bulky products that have a low to medium price point focus their targeting on more local markets, as the shipping costs associated with selling this type of product internationally does not always allow for margin.
When using Ship with Faire, Faire will be the account holder in relation to the carrier, but you are still the exporter of record. The guidelines and responsibilities detailed in this article still apply.

Source: https://www.faire.com/support/articles/12993868647707

metadata.title: Selling and importing your products into the EU

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
The most common categories we have noticed are: 
Food and drinks, Food supplements: to learn more, visit the resources in the European Commission Food Safety  
 
Products containing animal substances: to learn more, visit Animal products: movements within the Union and entry into the EU
 
Cosmetics and skin products : to import cosmetics into the EU, you must register your products with the EU CPNP portal, to learn more, visit the Cosmetics Product Notification Portal
 
Textile products and clothing: to learn more, search for specific information using My Trade Assistant
 
Plant and seed products: to learn more, visit Trade in plants & plant products from non-EU countries and My Trade Assistant
 
Pet products :  to learn more, visit Health and consumer protection for animal and plant product. Extra requirements may apply depending on the destination EU country. Please refer to My Trade Assistant for full details. 
Gemstones and stones:  Please refer to My Trade Assistant for full details, we recommend searching your product with the tariff code. 
Toys:  Please visit CE marking for more information on how to obtain the CE mark.
 
Jewellery: Please refer to My Trade Assistant for full details, we recommend searching your product with the tariff code. 
Dangerous goods: (DG) are substances that when transported are a risk to health, safety, property or the environment. Certain dangerous goods that pose risks even when not being transported are known as hazardous materials.)

To check if your products are categorized as dangerous goods, we recommend referring to the shipping carrier classification.
If your products are classified as dangerous goods, use Ship on your own.

question: How can I manage shipping options and costs when shipping products internationally?
gold_answer:
To manage shipping options and costs when shipping products internationally, consider the following key factors and information based on the provided document:

1. Choose your shipping method: You can either use the "Ship with Faire" option if it's available in your country or "Ship on Your Own" if that option is not available to all brands.

2. Consult additional resources: The document recommends consulting additional resources for specific queries such as Ship with Faire Insurance, creating a commercial invoice, and understanding how shipping cost estimates are calculated.

3. Be mindful of product size and weight: Since Faire does not support pallet shipping through "Ship with Faire," heavy and/or bulky products will result in higher shipping costs.

4. Adjust order minimums: Consider lowering your order minimum for intercontinental orders to help balance the product value with the shipping cost ratio.

5. Target local markets for heavy and bulky items: For heavy and bulky products with a low to medium price point, it may be more cost-effective to focus on local markets where the shipping costs won't significantly impact the margin.

6. Understand your responsibilities: When using "Ship with Faire," Faire will act as the account holder in relation to the carrier, but you, as the brand, are still the exporter of record

Cosmetics and skin products : to import cosmetics into the EU, you must register your products with the EU CPNP portal, to learn more, visit the Cosmetics Product Notification Portal
 
Textile products and clothing: to learn more, search for specific information using My Trade Assistant
 
Plant and seed products: to learn more, visit Trade in plants & plant products from non-EU countries and My Trade Assistant
 
Pet products :  to learn more, visit Health and consumer protection for animal and plant product. Extra requirements may apply depending on the destination EU country. Please refer to My Trade Assistant for full details. 
Gemstones and stones:  Please refer to My Trade Assistant for full details, we recommend searching your product with the tariff code. 
Toys:  Please visit CE marking for more information on how to obtain the CE mark.
 
Jewellery: Please refer to My Trade Assistant for full details, we recommend searching your product with the tariff code. 
Dangerous goods: (DG) are substances that when transported are a risk to health, safety, property or the environment. Certain dangerous goods that pose risks even when not being transported are known as hazardous materials.)

To check if your products are categorized as dangerous goods, we recommend referring to the shipping carrier classification.
If your products are classified as dangerous goods, use Ship on your own.

question: What are the available shipping methods when selling products to the EU?
gold_answer:
The available shipping methods when selling products to the EU, as mentioned in the document, are:

1. Ship with Faire - This method is currently available to brands in select countries, and more information can be found by visiting the 'Ship with Faire' section within their support articles.
2. Ship on Your Own - This method is not available to all brands, indicating that it may be limited to certain sellers or under certain conditions.

For additional shipping-related information, the document also suggests consulting other resources such as 'Ship with Faire Insurance', 'How do I create a commercial invoice?', and 'How are shipping cost estimates calculated?'.

metadata.subtitle: How is my brand discovered on the Faire platform?
metadata.title: How can I increase traffic to my shop page?

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
At Faire, our goal is to empower your brand to be discovered and to build relationships with retailers that are the best fit for your line. We understand you might have some questions about what you can do to help make that goal a reality. Whether you’re new to our platform or looking for increased exposure during a busy season, there are several steps you can take to attract more retailers who are looking for products like yours. We’ve put together some best practices and answers to frequently asked questions about driving visitors to your brand’s shop page.
How is my brand discovered on the Faire platform?
There are a few ways that a brand can be discovered when selling wholesale on Faire’s marketplace, including retailer recommendations and a search and ranking algorithm that highlights brands to the most appropriate buyers.
Retailer recommendations on Faire
Faire offers data-driven, personalized recommendations to retailers, so buyers who are most likely to order your products will see them. Here’s how it works:
Retailers see recommended brands based on the products they’ve searched for, purchased, and clicked on.
We offer quizzes to retailers so they can tell us more about their business. We then recommend products to them that similar retailers have purchased.
Faire sends marketing emails to retailers that are customized based on a unique algorithm to highlight brands to the right buyers.
Search & ranking on Faire

question: How can I make my products stand out on my shop page?

gold_docs.page_content:
In order to preserve the experience of retailers, our system limits the amount of marketing campaign emails that retailers can receive in a day. Here are the details of our emailing system for faire.com domains: Each retailer can receive up to 2 campaign emails from brands on Faire across a 24 hour period Each brand can email a retailer once every 24 hours

Ex: If you haven't emailed your retailer in the past 24 hours and the retailer hasn't been emailed by 2 other brands in the past 24 hours, your email will be sent!

 If your retailer recipient has already reached their email limit, any campaign you try to send them that day will say "unsent" and the email will not send to the recipient. Please also keep in mind that if a retailer reports a campaign as spam, bounced, or unsubscribed from your marketing list, they will not receive your future campaigns. Read more about our Spam and Bounce requirements here. Note that you do have the option to send campaigns from your business email address domain instead of the faire.com domain, which means you will not be subject to the limits above that result in unsent emails. However, please note that brands may notice a drop in campaign open rate after switching, depending on how strong of a reputation you've already built with your email domain.   Email Marketing campaign limits during Faire Markets

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
After the email has been sent, you’ll see the status update to “Sent” along with the analytics on the left hand side. These will include the Open %, Clicked %, $ Revenue, and Orders placed through the campaign email links.
For more information about your recipients, feel free to click into the campaign. Here you’ll be able to export your recipient list to view which contacts received it successfully, unsubscribed, or bounced. You’ll also see which customers have viewed and clicked on your campaign within the exported file.
If your campaign analytics are showing that 0 emails were delivered, we recommend making sure all the information has had time to properly load. Please allow up to 24 hours for all campaign analytics to fully load in the Faire portal.

The report includes relevant information (if applicable) such as: Payout Amount Type Order Number Retailer Name Order Date Order Total ($) Damaged Or Missing ($) Promotion Promotions ($) Commission (%) Commission ($) Placement Fee ($) Taxes ($) Shipping Costs ($) ACH Next Day Fee (%) ACH Next Day Fee ($) Insider Free Shipping Insider Shipping Charge ($)  How can I match up my payouts with my bank statements using the order number?

question: How can I sort my payouts by ship date?
gold_answer: To sort your payouts by ship date, you can click the "Ship Date" header on the Payouts page. You have the option to sort them in either ascending or descending order.

question: How can I create a preorder product listing in my company's portal?
gold_answer:
To create a preorder product listing in your company's portal, follow these steps:

1. Navigate to the Products tab in your portal.
2. If you are adding a new product, select the Add Products button in the top right-hand corner and then select Add Single Product. You will need to add a product name and product type.
3. If you want to edit an existing product to make it a preorder, simply select the product you wish to change.
4. For bulk editing multiple product listings to preorder, select the products you want to convert to preorder and click on the Bulk Edit link. Then, click the Add Fields button and select Preorder.

question: How do I add multiple versions of a product with different sizes and colors?
gold_answer: To add multiple versions of a product with different sizes and colors, first, you should select 'Yes' under the prompt "Does this product come in multiple options, like different sizes or colors?" After selecting 'Yes,' a window will appear where you can add the option information. You are allowed to add up to three product options within each listing. For sizes and colors, you can choose these options from the provided list, which includes Size, Color, Material, Style, and Scent. After selecting Size and Color, you can specify the particular sizes and colors available for your product.

gold_docs.page_content:
Country of origin of your products
We strongly recommend you set Made in country on a product level if you list products made in different countries. This will ensure the right country of origin is surfaced for each product on the commercial invoice, and will prevent customs complications. To learn how to edit this in your product page, visit How do I add or edit products?
What if customs agencies or carriers require additional information to clear my shipments?
If you ship products internationally, and additional information or documentation is required by the country of import for your products, you might be contacted by a customs agent, carrier, or your retailer to provide the necessary information to help clear customs.
Here are a few things to keep in mind :
You are the exporter. Ensuring your products can be exported, sold and imported for B2B purposes in other countries falls under your responsibility.
The retailer is the importer and is responsible for complying with all import rules and regulations when importing goods into their country.
The customs agent and/or carrier may reach out to you via phone, or via Faire support on an email thread if you are using Ship with Faire.
Faire cannot provide information or certificates for your products to be exported and imported smoothly.
Orders can typically be stalled at a border for a limited time, (this tends to vary between 3 and 5 days)
If you are unresponsive, or fail to provide the required information/documentation/certification, the customs agency may decide to abandon, destroy, or return the shipment to sender. This decision is outside of Faire’s control, and is informed by local regulations, depending on the product types and the ability of a carrier to proceed to Return to Sender.

Source: https://www.faire.com/support/articles/360034495851

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
As the exporter of record, any brand selling on Faire is responsible for complying with all laws, rules, and regulations in all countries/regions they choose to sell their products to on the platform. This includes but is not limited to: product safety, labelling requirements, testing, warnings, copyright, import/export regulations, and other consumer protection law requirements. (The retailer is the importer, and is responsible for covering any applicable import duties and taxes at import) 

Document type
Faire provided
Brand provided

 Faire does not provide documentation specific to your products, your company, manufacturing practices or information. This type of documentation has to be provided by yourself as the exporter of record.  For every international order, Faire generates a commercial invoice, populated with the product information in your account.  Please note, depending on the products, additional fields might be required on the commercial invoice; or longer tariff codes (visit Updating your product information) in this case, we recommend you create your own commercial invoice.   How to determine if your products can be imported and sold in Canada

question: What should I do if customs agencies or carriers require additional information for my shipments?
gold_answer: If customs agencies or carriers require additional information for your shipments, you might be contacted to provide the necessary information to help clear customs. As the exporter, it is your responsibility to ensure your products can be exported, sold, and imported for B2B purposes in other countries. If contacted, you should respond promptly with the requested information or documentation as the retailer, acting as the importer, is responsible for complying with all import rules and regulations when importing goods into their country. If you are using Ship with Faire, the customs agent and/or carrier may reach out to you via phone, or via Faire support on an email thread. It is important to note that Faire cannot provide information or certificates for your products. If you are unresponsive or fail to provide the necessary information or documentation, customs may decide to abandon, destroy, or return the shipment, which is a decision outside of Faire’s control and is informed by local regulations.

What if customs agencies or carriers require additional information to clear my shipments?

Here are a few things to keep in mind :
You are the exporter. Ensuring your products can be exported, sold and imported for B2B purposes in other countries falls under your responsibility.
The retailer is the importer and is responsible for complying with all import rules and regulations when importing goods into their country.
The customs agent and/or carrier may reach out to you via phone, or via Faire support on an email thread if you are using Ship with Faire.
Faire cannot provide information or certificates for your products to be exported and imported smoothly.
Orders can typically be stalled at a border for a limited time, (this tends to vary between 3 and 5 days)
If you are unresponsive, or fail to provide the required information/documentation/certification, the customs agency may decide to abandon, destroy, or return the shipment to sender. This decision is outside of Faire’s control, and is informed by local regulations, depending on the product types and the ability of a carrier to proceed to Return to Sender.

Content:
If you are unresponsive, or fail to provide the required information/documentation/certification, the customs agency may decide to abandon, destroy, or return the shipment to sender. This decision is outside of Faire’s control, and is informed by local regulations, depending on the product types and the ability of a carrier to proceed to Return to Sender. 
To prevent these situations from arising, we recommend you follow the guidelines outlined in How to determine if your products can be imported and sold in Canada, and adjust your selling territories in your shop settings accordingly to your readiness to export. 

Shipping methods 
When shipping an order to Canada, depending on your location and shipping method(s) available, you will have access to: 


Ship with Faire

Ship with Faire is currently available to brands in select countries, to learn more visit Ship with Faire




Ship on Your Own

Ship on your Own is not available to all brands



 Here are additional resources you can consult to answer shipping related questions:

Ship with Faire Insurance 
How do I create a commercial invoice?
How are shipping cost estimates calculated?


Managing shipping options and costs 
International shipments can be costly. Here are some important key factors and information to consider when shipping your products internationally:

Faire does not support pallet shipping through Ship with Faire

metadata.title: Selling and importing your products into Canada

question: Who is responsible for ensuring that products can be exported, sold, and imported for B2B purposes in other countries?
gold_answer: The exporter is responsible for ensuring that products can be exported, sold, and imported for B2B purposes in other countries.

Note: Our system will automatically filter out any duplicates in your file, so if you have already uploaded a customer contact in your portal, it will be filtered out of future uploads. hard_neg_docs.page_content:
In order to use specific features of Faire Direct, you may be asked to upload data of others (such as your customers or leads). In addition to crafting personalized, quality content, consider the audience you are reaching out to, and make sure that the communications you’re sending are not unwanted or unwarranted. It’s essential that you are only reaching out to legitimate business email addresses that have given consent to be contacted by your brand.
Here are some helpful guidelines to follow:
Review lists before uploading to Faire or emailing a list of individuals:

Make sure that the communication is relevant to them (e.g., they are a retailer, they are still in business, you have an existing business relationship with them or have interacted with them before, or––in the case of new leads––you don’t have any reason to believe they wouldn’t want to hear from you).
Never upload purchased or scraped email lists as these tend to include email addresses designed to catch spam senders. This will negatively impact your campaign performance, and in some cases may result in temporary or permanent email privilege suspension. This is also strictly prohibited in regions that adhere to GDPR compliance, and is enforced by our email delivery service. If you are suspended or banned, it is at the discretion of our third-party email delivery service and not in Faire’s control.

Compare the list you are providing to Faire Direct against your own “unsubscribe” list to make sure the retailers you are reaching out to through Faire haven’t already asked you not to contact them.
Purge any irrelevant data (or unsubscribed email addresses) from the list before uploading to your Customers list.

metadata.title: Getting started as a Canadian retailer

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Welcome to Faire! Here are some important aspects of the experience to keep in mind as you get started on Faire.
Eligibility
Please sign up for a free retailer account here. Retailers must purchase with the intent to resell at MSRP and must operate their own commercial brick and mortar store, unique online store, or consistent pop-up shop.Please be prepared to share the following information: First and Last Name, Store Type, Email Address, Store Name, Years in Business, Annual Sales, business registration info like GST/HST/BN number, etc. Our Accounts team will reach out for any clarifications needed!Brands can elect to restrict certain provinces on Faire depending on their business model. We also offer brands an opt-out program called Faire Protection to protect their stockist regions by postal code. Should you be unable to purchase from a desired brand, it could be due to one of these reasons.
Navigating the marketplace
Learning to navigate the Faire marketplace will help you find brands that are the best fit for you and your customers. You can view brands from each category by selecting the category tab from the top of your account. Once you have chosen a category, you can continue to filter the results until you find what you are looking for. We encourage you to filter by brands that Ship from Canada or are Made in Canada to support your local brand communities.
Currency
New retailers joining Faire will be charged in CAD. If you were previously paying your invoices in USD, your account will be converted to CAD currency in the near future. When your account is converted, you will see all of your invoices in CAD. Any invoices that were paid in USD will also show as CAD. We will show the conversion rate used on those orders to help reconcile your invoices.

question: How can I find brands that are the best fit for my store on the Faire marketplace?
gold_answer: To find brands that are the best fit for your store on the Faire marketplace, you should start by navigating the marketplace to explore the various brands available. Once you are logged into your account, you can view brands from each category by selecting the desired category tab from the top of your account page. After choosing a category, you can continue to refine your search by using filters to narrow down the results. For a focus on local products, you may filter by brands that either "Ship from Canada" or are "Made in Canada" to support local businesses. This filtering process will help you in selecting brands that align with your store's needs and preferences, as well as those of your customers.

question: How can I filter the search results on the Faire marketplace to find brands that ship from Canada or are made in Canada?
gold_answer: To filter search results on the Faire marketplace to find brands that ship from Canada or are made in Canada, you should select a category tab from the top of your account. Once you are in the chosen category, continue to filter the results by selecting options that indicate brands that "Ship from Canada" or are "Made in Canada." This will help you support local businesses and find the best fit for you and your customers.

gold_docs.page_content:
Click “Save Changes” to save your updates
You will now be able to see the up-to-date inventory levels in your product catalog under the “Inventory” column
Managing my inventory
Your inventory counts will automatically update when retailers purchase your products. When the available inventory for a product falls below the designated minimum order quantity, the product will be listed as “Out of Stock” and will no longer be purchasable on your shop page. It will remain “Out of Stock” until you update your available inventory count for that product in your product editor.If you would like your retailers to have the ability to continue to order an item when it is out of stock, you can select the “Continue to sell when product is out of stock” option when editing your product (see details above).We encourage you to set inventory levels for your products when possible, as this helps prevent your buyers from accidentally purchasing more of your products than you can fulfill. You can stop tracking inventory levels for a given product at any time.
If you have any additional questions, feel free to reach out using the “Contact Us” link below.

Source: https://www.faire.com/support/articles/360045187791
Title: Setting my product inventory levels
Content:
Click “Save Changes” to save your updates
You will now be able to see the up-to-date inventory levels in your product catalog under the “Inventory” column
Managing my inventory
Your inventory counts will automatically update when retailers purchase your products. When the available inventory for a product falls below the designated minimum order quantity, the product will be listed as “Out of Stock” and will no longer be purchasable on your shop page. It will remain “Out of Stock” until you update your available inventory count for that product in your product editor.If you would like your retailers to have the ability to continue to order an item when it is out of stock, you can select the “Continue to sell when product is out of stock” option when editing your product (see details above).We encourage you to set inventory levels for your products when possible, as this helps prevent your buyers from accidentally purchasing more of your products than you can fulfill. You can stop tracking inventory levels for a given product at any time.
If you have any additional questions, feel free to reach out using the “Contact Us” link below.

metadata.subtitle: Setting my product inventory levels
metadata.title: Setting my product inventory levels

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
To help easily manage your inventory, you have the ability to manually enter inventory levels in the Faire portal for each product listing and variant
How to set my inventory
There are two ways to set your inventory levels for any product or product variant
In your Inventory Tab under Products in your brand portal
In your Products Tab
Setting my inventory from the Inventory Tab
You can set the Units Available for each individual product:Or you can upload a file to set the inventory for multiple products:To upload a spreadsheet, you can download our template or upload your own, but make sure it follows the formatting guidelines and is a CSV file. Upload your completed file by clicking Select File or drag and drop the file into the pop-up window. Note: do not close the pop-up window until the file is done loading. Once it’s loaded, you’ll receive a confirmation message with a report.
Setting my inventory from the Products Tab
Click on the item you would like to set with inventory levels
Under “Shipping Details,” enter the number of units available in the “Inventory” field
If you have multiple variants for a product, inventory levels can also be set per product variant by entering your quantity under the “Inventory” column
As a default, once an inventory level reaches 0 units, the product will automatically be marked as “Out of Stock” and will no longer be purchasable on your shop page.
If you would like your retailers to have the ability to continue to order when an item is out of stock, you can select the “Continue to sell when product is out of stock” option in your product settings.
Click “Save Changes” to save your updates
