There are two ways to set your inventory levels for any product or product variant
In your Inventory Tab under Products in your brand portal
In your Products Tab
Setting my inventory from the Inventory Tab
You can set the Units Available for each individual product:Or you can upload a file to set the inventory for multiple products:To upload a spreadsheet, you can download our template or upload your own, but make sure it follows the formatting guidelines and is a CSV file. Upload your completed file by clicking Select File or drag and drop the file into the pop-up window. Note: do not close the pop-up window until the file is done loading. Once it’s loaded, you’ll receive a confirmation message with a report.
Setting my inventory from the Products Tab
Click on the item you would like to set with inventory levels
Under “Shipping Details,” enter the number of units available in the “Inventory” field
If you have multiple variants for a product, inventory levels can also be set per product variant by entering your quantity under the “Inventory” column
As a default, once an inventory level reaches 0 units, the product will automatically be marked as “Out of Stock” and will no longer be purchasable on your shop page.
If you would like your retailers to have the ability to continue to order when an item is out of stock, you can select the “Continue to sell when product is out of stock” option in your product settings.
Click “Save Changes” to save your updates

question: How can I update my product inventory levels?
gold_answer: To update your product inventory levels, you need to navigate to your product catalog and find the product you want to update. Once there, you will make the necessary adjustments to the inventory counts. After you have made the updates, click the "Save Changes" button to save your updates. The up-to-date inventory levels will then be visible in your product catalog under the "Inventory" column.

gold_docs.page_content:
Click “Save Changes” to save your updates
You will now be able to see the up-to-date inventory levels in your product catalog under the “Inventory” column
Managing my inventory
Your inventory counts will automatically update when retailers purchase your products. When the available inventory for a product falls below the designated minimum order quantity, the product will be listed as “Out of Stock” and will no longer be purchasable on your shop page. It will remain “Out of Stock” until you update your available inventory count for that product in your product editor.If you would like your retailers to have the ability to continue to order an item when it is out of stock, you can select the “Continue to sell when product is out of stock” option when editing your product (see details above).We encourage you to set inventory levels for your products when possible, as this helps prevent your buyers from accidentally purchasing more of your products than you can fulfill. You can stop tracking inventory levels for a given product at any time.
If you have any additional questions, feel free to reach out using the “Contact Us” link below.

question: What happens if a product's inventory falls below the minimum order quantity?
gold_answer: If a product's inventory falls below the minimum order quantity, the product will be listed as "Out of Stock" and will no longer be purchasable on your shop page. It will remain "Out of Stock" until you update your available inventory count for that product in your product editor.

gold_docs.page_content:
Can I limit who can purchase my preorders?
If you are concerned about who can see and ship your preorder items, you have the ability to sell preorders to qualified retailers only. This setting is the default setting and is already toggled “on'' in your Shop Settings tab. Qualified retailers are those who have met Faire’s wholesale buying requirements or are on your Faire customer list. With this toggle on, only these retailers will be able to view your preorder items. For more info on qualified retailers, see here.
Can I bulk upload preorders?
Yes! If you would like to add preorder products in bulk to your shop, you can add these listings to your shop using the Bulk Upload tool in your portal.
Navigate to the Bulk Upload tab in your portal. Click “Start New Upload” and “Download Template” under Step 1 to get started.
The below sections must be filled out in the Bulk Upload template to create a preorder product:
Preorder (Y/N)
Ship By Date (YYYY-MM-DD)
Ship By End Date (if range, YYYY-MM-DD)
Order By Date (YYYY-MM-DD)
Sell After Order By/Ship Date (Y/N)
For more information about each section that must be filled out to create a preorder, follow these instructions:
When the preorder item is expected to ship
Any date <= 730 days from now

metadata.title: Preorders

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
For more information on how to write orders and preorders through Faire, click here.
How do I split a preorder?
Splitting a preorder allows you to partition an existing preorder into two orders to easily account for changes on some of the preorder products in an unfulfilled order. When you “split” a preorder, you specify the quantities of product you’d like to move from the original preorder into a new preorder.
To learn more about how to split a preorder, please click here.
How will preorders appear in my account?
When a retailer places an order that includes immediates and preorder listings, the orders will be split up depending on the shipment date. You can filter the order type by Immediates or Preorders on the “Orders” page by clicking on the dropdown menu beside the search bar.
When will I be paid for preorders?
Payouts work the same as regular payouts. You will be paid with your normal terms of payout based on the day of shipment. Meaning you will be paid out either on ACH Next Day or ACH Net 30 payout terms based on the payout terms you have selected.
If you would like to switch payout methods, feel free to reach out to us using the "Contact Us" button below.

question: Can I bulk upload preorder products to my shop? If so, what information do I need to provide in the bulk upload template?
gold_answer:
Yes, you can bulk upload preorder products to your shop. In the Bulk Upload template, you need to provide the following information to create a preorder product:

1. Preorder (Y/N)
2. Ship By Date (YYYY-MM-DD)
3. Ship By End Date (if range, YYYY-MM-DD)
4. Order By Date (YYYY-MM-DD)
5. Sell After Order By/Ship Date (Y/N)

It is important that you follow the instructions and fill out these sections correctly for the preorder items.

metadata.title: How do I edit products using the Bulk Editor?

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
The Bulk Editor tool allows you to easily edit your products in bulk directly in your brand portal. Brands use it to update their prices, preorder ship windows, and more.
How to access the Bulk Editor
To access the Bulk Editor:
Select 1+ products from any tab on the products table in your Products tab or use the Filter by option to filter products by: Product Name, Product Type, Inventory Count, Date Added, First Ship Date, Preorder. Once you’ve made your selections, click Bulk Edit in the top toolbar of the products table to be taken to the Bulk Editor.
Import products from Shopify (you will be taken directly to the editor)
Click the "View Import" link in the widget that appears after a Shopify import
Click the banner in your Products tab alerting you that you have products left in draft that were imported less than 7 days ago
Editing products in the Bulk Editor
Using the Bulk Editor is easy! Similar to how you would use a spreadsheet, you can drag and drop multiple rows and columns, hold Shift to select multiple cells, and copy and paste a cell value into other cells.
To publish a product, there are some required fields that must be filled in. This includes:
Product name
Product type
Case size
Wholesale price
Retailer price
If all required fields are populated, the product status will show a green dot indicating that it’s ready to publish. Published products will display a green check in the status column. Otherwise, you’ll see an error message. Products cannot be unpublished using the editor.
There are some product details that cannot be edited in the Bulk Editor. This includes:

metadata.subtitle: How do I edit products using the Bulk Editor?
metadata.title: How do I edit products using the Bulk Editor?

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
There are some product details that cannot be edited in the Bulk Editor. This includes:
Unpublished product options
Product photos or videos
Instore testers
Customization/and or special requests
To edit any of these fields, you will need to edit each product individually in the Products tab or use the Bulk Upload tool.
Click Save Edits to save your edits. If products are ready to publish, a modal will appear that prompts you to either click Publish Products to publish your products or Continue without Publishing to keep products in draft state. Use the Undo button to undo your most recent save or publish. If you have multiple pages of products, you will need to save edits, publish the product, or clear changes on your current page before moving to a different page.
We're launching updates and improvements to the Bulk Editor in phases. If you do not have the option to edit active products or perform any of the other functions described in this article, please know this will be available in the next couple of weeks.

question: How can I access the Bulk Editor to edit multiple products at once?
gold_answer:
To access the Bulk Editor to edit multiple products at once, follow these steps:

1. Go to your Products tab.
2. Select one or more products from any tab on the products table, or use the "Filter by" option to filter products by attributes such as Product Name, Product Type, Inventory Count, Date Added, First Ship Date, Preorder.
3. After making your selections, click on "Bulk Edit" in the top toolbar of the products table. This will take you to the Bulk Editor.

Additionally, you can access the Bulk Editor after importing products from Shopify by either clicking the "View Import" link in the widget that appears post-import or by clicking the banner in your Products tab that notifies you of products left in draft if they were imported less than 7 days ago.

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
The Bulk Editor tool allows you to easily edit your products in bulk directly in your brand portal. Brands use it to update their prices, preorder ship windows, and more.
How to access the Bulk Editor
To access the Bulk Editor:
Select 1+ products from any tab on the products table in your Products tab or use the Filter by option to filter products by: Product Name, Product Type, Inventory Count, Date Added, First Ship Date, Preorder. Once you’ve made your selections, click Bulk Edit in the top toolbar of the products table to be taken to the Bulk Editor.
Import products from Shopify (you will be taken directly to the editor)
Click the "View Import" link in the widget that appears after a Shopify import
Click the banner in your Products tab alerting you that you have products left in draft that were imported less than 7 days ago
Editing products in the Bulk Editor
Using the Bulk Editor is easy! Similar to how you would use a spreadsheet, you can drag and drop multiple rows and columns, hold Shift to select multiple cells, and copy and paste a cell value into other cells.
To publish a product, there are some required fields that must be filled in. This includes:
Product name
Product type
Case size
Wholesale price
Retailer price
If all required fields are populated, the product status will show a green dot indicating that it’s ready to publish. Published products will display a green check in the status column. Otherwise, you’ll see an error message. Products cannot be unpublished using the editor.
There are some product details that cannot be edited in the Bulk Editor. This includes:

metadata.subtitle: How do I edit products using the Bulk Editor?
metadata.title: How do I edit products using the Bulk Editor?

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
There are some product details that cannot be edited in the Bulk Editor. This includes:
Unpublished product options
Product photos or videos
Instore testers
Customization/and or special requests
To edit any of these fields, you will need to edit each product individually in the Products tab or use the Bulk Upload tool.
Click Save Edits to save your edits. If products are ready to publish, a modal will appear that prompts you to either click Publish Products to publish your products or Continue without Publishing to keep products in draft state. Use the Undo button to undo your most recent save or publish. If you have multiple pages of products, you will need to save edits, publish the product, or clear changes on your current page before moving to a different page.
We're launching updates and improvements to the Bulk Editor in phases. If you do not have the option to edit active products or perform any of the other functions described in this article, please know this will be available in the next couple of weeks.

metadata.title: How do I edit products using the Bulk Editor?

question: How do I import products from Shopify and edit them in the Bulk Editor?
gold_answer:
To import products from Shopify and edit them in the Bulk Editor, follow these steps:

1. Import products from your Shopify store into the Faire platform. The process for this is not described in the provided documentation, but it typically involves a specific import function or synchronization feature within the Faire platform that connects to your Shopify account.

2. After completing the Shopify import, you will be taken directly to the Bulk Editor.

3. Alternatively, if you have a widget that appears post-import, click the "View Import" link in that widget to access the Bulk Editor.

4. If you have previously imported products that are still in draft status and were imported less than 7 days ago, you can click the banner in your Products tab that alerts you about these products to access the Bulk Editor.

Once in the Bulk Editor, you can then proceed to make the desired changes to your products.

question: What are the terms and conditions for using the Faire Direct sign up offer provided by a brand?
gold_answer:
The terms and conditions for using the Faire Direct sign up offer provided by a brand include:

1. The discount you receive on your first order will be applied to future orders with the brand.
2. If the offer includes a percent off discount with a maximum cap, this discount will only apply to your first order with that specific brand.
3. You can combine the sign up offer with certain additional promotions.
4. All available promotions will be visible and applied to your cart before checkout.
5. Both the discount and 1 year of free shipping that come with the offer will expire 7 days after your sign-up date.

gold_docs.page_content:
Orders can typically be “stalled” at a border for a limited time, (this tends to vary between 3 and 5 days maximum)
As the importer, it is your responsibility to accept the order, and to facilitate import, providing any information required.
If you are unresponsive, or fail to provide the required information/documentation/license, the customs agency may decide to return the shipment. (Return to Sender). This decision is outside of Faire’s control.
Please note, Faire keeps record of failures to import international orders, as well as the cost associated with shipping these products back to the brands. Faire reserves the right to review your account as well as ability to order on the platform in accordance with our Terms of Service.

metadata.subtitle: How to buy internationally on Faire
metadata.title: How to buy internationally on Faire

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
We understand that buying and importing products internationally can be challenging, rules and documentation requirements vary, depending on:
Your country, its laws and regulations.
The products you are importing
The country of origin of these products
As a retailer on Faire, you are the importer of record. Ensuring you have the right to resell the products you purchase on Faire is your responsibility.
We want to help you feel confident buying from international brands. Below, we have provided guidance on the most common questions we receive from our retailers.
You will also find links to more detailed information and guidance for importing products into your country or region.
Please note, this resource is non-exhaustive and purely indicative.
How to determine your import requirements
As the importer of record, any retailer buying on Faire internationally is responsible for complying with all laws, rules, and regulations in their country/region for importing the products they choose to purchase from international brands on the platform. This includes but is not limited to: compliance with import rules and regulations, permit and licenses requirements, and other consumer protection law requirements.
To determine if you can import and resell products purchased internationally into your country, we recommend:
Consulting governmental websites to check if there are any restrictions or specific requirements for importing the products you wish to purchase internationally.
Look into any license requirements, or permit you may need as an importer when purchasing certain products.
Consulting legal counsel and/or a customs broker to determine your readiness to import given products from a given country.
Looking into potential restrictions enforced by your country, based on the country of manufacturing/origin of the products.

question: What happens if I don't provide the required information for import?
gold_answer: If you do not provide the required information for import, the customs agency may decide to return the shipment (marked as "Return to Sender"). This decision is outside of Faire's control. Additionally, Faire keeps a record of failures to import international orders and the costs associated with shipping these products back to the brands. Faire reserves the right to review your account and your ability to order on the platform in accordance with their Terms of Service.

gold_docs.page_content:
A few things to note:

Orders must still be accepted in Faire by entering an expected ship date before the order can flow into Shopify.
At this time, order syncing will not push back fulfillment information from Shopify - this will still need to be entered in Faire.

 Once you have enabled Order Syncing, you will be able to see the status of the sync of each order from your orders page.


Light Grey: This order will be synced once accepted

Dark Grey: This order has been synced

Red: This order has issues preventing it from syncing. There is a red button located in the top right corner that will help you navigate to your Integrations Page to fix any syncing issues

 If you have any questions or concerns, please reach out to integrations.support@faire.com and we would be more than happy to assist. Settings

metadata.subtitle: How do I set up the Shopify integration?
metadata.title: Can I integrate with Shopify?

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
As customers purchase your products elsewhere and your inventory counts on Shopify are reduced, we will update your inventory counts on Faire accordingly.
The inventory sync component of the integration only ensures inventory changes in Shopify get reflected on Faire, not the other way around. If you want inventory levels in Shopify and your other system(s) to update every time a Faire order is placed, you will also need to utilize the order sync component of this integration.
Inventory syncing allows you to sync your Shopify inventory with Faire based on your inventory locations. You can find this in the 'settings' section of your Shopify Integration.
to learn more about inventory tracking, visit Setting my product inventory levels.
How does order syncing work?
When you accept a new Faire order, it will automatically sync that order to Shopify.
The order sent to Shopify will contain:
Full information about each line item
The promotion applied to the order (if you were running one)
Commission charged (if applicable)
The Faire order number and expected ship date
Customer information and shipping address
Tags for “Faire” and “Wholesale”
Relevant VAT information for European brands
If you track inventory counts in Shopify, inventory will automatically be deducted in Shopify for Faire products that are matched with a corresponding Shopify listing.
At this time, the integration will not retrieve fulfillment information from Shopify and pull it into Faire. You will still need to enter that information on Faire.

gold_answer: The red button in the top right corner helps you navigate to your Integrations Page to fix any syncing issues that are preventing an order from syncing.

gold_docs.page_content:
A few things to note:

Orders must still be accepted in Faire by entering an expected ship date before the order can flow into Shopify.
At this time, order syncing will not push back fulfillment information from Shopify - this will still need to be entered in Faire.

 Once you have enabled Order Syncing, you will be able to see the status of the sync of each order from your orders page.


Light Grey: This order will be synced once accepted

Dark Grey: This order has been synced

Red: This order has issues preventing it from syncing. There is a red button located in the top right corner that will help you navigate to your Integrations Page to fix any syncing issues

 If you have any questions or concerns, please reach out to integrations.support@faire.com and we would be more than happy to assist. Settings

metadata.subtitle: How do I set up the Shopify integration?
metadata.title: Can I integrate with Shopify?

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
As customers purchase your products elsewhere and your inventory counts on Shopify are reduced, we will update your inventory counts on Faire accordingly.
The inventory sync component of the integration only ensures inventory changes in Shopify get reflected on Faire, not the other way around. If you want inventory levels in Shopify and your other system(s) to update every time a Faire order is placed, you will also need to utilize the order sync component of this integration.
Inventory syncing allows you to sync your Shopify inventory with Faire based on your inventory locations. You can find this in the 'settings' section of your Shopify Integration.
to learn more about inventory tracking, visit Setting my product inventory levels.
How does order syncing work?
When you accept a new Faire order, it will automatically sync that order to Shopify.
The order sent to Shopify will contain:
Full information about each line item
The promotion applied to the order (if you were running one)
Commission charged (if applicable)
The Faire order number and expected ship date
Customer information and shipping address
Tags for “Faire” and “Wholesale”
Relevant VAT information for European brands
If you track inventory counts in Shopify, inventory will automatically be deducted in Shopify for Faire products that are matched with a corresponding Shopify listing.
At this time, the integration will not retrieve fulfillment information from Shopify and pull it into Faire. You will still need to enter that information on Faire.

Fragrance Family
Perfume-specific fragrance family.
Citrus : The citrus fragrance family is characterized by fresh, zesty, and bright scents that are reminiscent of citrus fruits such as lemons, oranges, grapefruits, and bergamots.
Earthy & Woody : Earthy & Woody fragrances are characterized by their warm, rich, and natural aromas that evoke the smells of the forest, the earth, and the outdoors. Common notes found in earthy and woody fragrances include cedarwood, sandalwood, patchouli, vetiver, oakmoss, and musk, as well as spices and herbs such as cinnamon, cloves, and sage.
Floral : The floral fragrance family is characterized by floral and botanical notes, which evoke the smells of various flowers such as rose, jasmine, lily, and violet.
Fresh : The fresh fragrance family is characterized by clean, crisp, and invigorating qualities, which evoke the smell of fresh air, water, and nature. Common notes found in fresh fragrances include lemon, lime, bergamot, grapefruit, mint, lavender, and marine notes, as well as green and earthy notes.

metadata.subtitle: Beauty and wellness product attribute tags
metadata.title: Beauty and wellness product attribute tags

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Attribute tags allow you to highlight key features of your products on Faire.
In this resource, you will find detailed information about Beauty and wellness attributes on Faire.
To learn more about how to add product attributes as well as frequently asked questions, visit Product attributes
Please note that maintaining a high-quality marketplace is of the utmost importance to us. If we identify any inaccurate attribute tags, we may remove or modify such tags accordingly.
Beauty Concerns
Detailed beauty & wellness related concerns addressed by this product.
Skincare Concerns
Anti-Acne : Anti-acne products help prevent or reduce acne
Anti-Aging : Anti-aging products are designed to reduce the appearance of fine lines, wrinkles, and other signs of aging
Blemish Reducing : Blemish reducing products are designed to reduce the appearance of blemishes such as acne, pimples, and blackheads
Brightening : Brightening products are designed to improve the skin's tone, texture, and radiance by reducing the appearance of dark spots, hyperpigmentation, and uneven skin tone
Exfoliating : Exfoliating products are designed to remove dead skin cells and impurities from the surface of the skin
Hydrating : Hydrating skincare products are designed to provide moisture and nourishment to the skin to help maintain its natural hydration levels, improve skin texture, and prevent dryness
pH Balancing : pH balancing products are designed to balance the skin's pH level
Pore Reduction : Pore reduction products are designed to minimize the appearance of pores

question: What are some fragrance families and their characteristics?
gold_answer:
Some fragrance families and their characteristics as mentioned in the document are:

- Citrus: Characterized by fresh, zesty, and bright scents reminiscent of citrus fruits like lemons, oranges, grapefruits, and bergamots.

- Earthy & Woody: Characterized by warm, rich, and natural aromas that evoke the smells of the forest, earth, and outdoors. Common notes include cedarwood, sandalwood, patchouli, vetiver, oakmoss, musk, and spices and herbs like cinnamon, cloves, and sage.

- Floral: Characterized by floral and botanical notes, evoking the smells of various flowers such as rose, jasmine, lily, and violet.

- Fresh: Characterized by clean, crisp, and invigorating qualities that evoke the smell of fresh air, water, and nature. Common notes include lemon, lime, bergamot, grapefruit, mint, lavender, and marine notes, as well as green and earthy notes.

gold_docs.page_content:
Make sure your connection to a website uses https://:  When you connect to any website where you could be asked to enter a username and password or other sensitive data, check that a lock icon appears beside the URL in your browser.
URL's that don't look quite right: Phishing attempts can include URLs that appear legitimate if you don't look too closely. Many phishing attempts use URLs that have been deliberately chosen to resemble a URL that you're already familiar with. For example:
Legitimate URL: example-wholesale.com/apparel/tops
Phony URL: example-wholesale.com-apparel.net/tops
Business messages from personal accounts: Attackers can gather enough information from your online presence to create a message that could plausibly come from a real contact.
Misspellings, poor grammar, and style variations: Criminals don't take content style guides as seriously as professional web content writers. As well as typos and grammar errors, variations in the following categories within a single page can show that a website is fraudulent.
Alarmist or overexcited tone: Watch for time-sensitive requests that try to scare you into acting without thinking.
Open only attachments or links you expect: Don’t interact with attachments, links, or forms unless you are expecting them and know what they contain. Not only can they redirect you to a malicious site designed to steal your information, but they can also infect your device with malware.
Be careful with public wi-fi: Public wi-fi is convenient when you're on the go, but it provides many different ways for criminals to gain access to your information. You can reduce your risks by taking steps to protect yourself and your data by:

metadata.subtitle: Are my payments and information secure?
metadata.title: Are my payments and information secure?

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
At Faire, we take your security very seriously and it is our top priority to protect your information. Faire utilizes a variety of safety features to process payments and ensure the protection of our customers.
We use the third-party payment processors, Stripe, Square, and Adyen to house all of our customer's payment card information, and Plaid and Adyen to house your bank account information. We do not hold any payment information on Faire servers, as they are stored securely with these processors. As a result, this sensitive information is encrypted on our site, so that we only have access to the last few digits of your card information. These processors are also used by some of the world's largest companies including Salesforce, Shopify, and Amazon.
In order to protect your information online, please read the internet security tips below.
Internet security tips
We know that you try to protect yourself from fraud on the internet. Phishing is the term used for internet theft scams involving phony websites, emails or other messages, allowing the attacker can gain access to your account and sensitive information.
The following information will help you identify and avoid internet scams and phishing attempts:
Know the warning signs
Understanding the warning signs will help you protect yourself against phishing. Keep an eye out for these signs when reading messages and reviewing websites:
Overly general language: Although phishing can be well researched and tailored to you and your business, general language is a hallmark of phishing scams. Be wary of messages that seem to come from an organization you trust but that open with vague statements.

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Verifying hotspot names: Before connecting, make sure that the hotspot you plan to use is legitimate. If you can't see the hotspot name posted in an obvious place, then ask an employee.
Disable access points to your device: Public wi-fi networks are much less secure than private networks like the one at your home or office. Protect yourself by turning off file sharing within your network and enabling your firewall before connecting. Even with these precautions, it's still not a good idea to send or receive any sensitive content using a public wi-fi network.
If you feel you have received any phishing messages, please reach out to us using the "Contact Us" button below and we will help address your questions or concerns.

question: What precautions should I take when using public wi-fi to protect my information from being accessed by criminals?
gold_answer:
To protect your information from being accessed by criminals while using public wi-fi, you can reduce your risks by taking the following precautions:

1. Ensure that the website you are connecting to uses HTTPS. Check for the presence of a lock icon beside the URL in your browser.
2. Avoid interacting with attachments, links, or forms unless you are expecting them and know what they contain, as these could redirect you to malicious sites or infect your device with malware.
3. Be cautious and protect yourself and your data by following additional steps not detailed in the provided excerpt. (Note: The document does not specify what these additional steps are, but common recommendations include using a VPN to secure your connection, avoiding sensitive transactions, keeping your software updated, and being wary of connecting to unknown networks.)

Alarmist or overexcited tone: Watch for time-sensitive requests that try to scare you into acting without thinking.
Open only attachments or links you expect: Don’t interact with attachments, links, or forms unless you are expecting them and know what they contain. Not only can they redirect you to a malicious site designed to steal your information, but they can also infect your device with malware.
Be careful with public wi-fi: Public wi-fi is convenient when you're on the go, but it provides many different ways for criminals to gain access to your information. You can reduce your risks by taking steps to protect yourself and your data by:

metadata.subtitle: Are my payments and information secure?
metadata.title: Are my payments and information secure?

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
At Faire, we take your security very seriously and it is our top priority to protect your information. Faire utilizes a variety of safety features to process payments and ensure the protection of our customers.
We use the third-party payment processors, Stripe, Square, and Adyen to house all of our customer's payment card information, and Plaid and Adyen to house your bank account information. We do not hold any payment information on Faire servers, as they are stored securely with these processors. As a result, this sensitive information is encrypted on our site, so that we only have access to the last few digits of your card information. These processors are also used by some of the world's largest companies including Salesforce, Shopify, and Amazon.
In order to protect your information online, please read the internet security tips below.
Internet security tips
We know that you try to protect yourself from fraud on the internet. Phishing is the term used for internet theft scams involving phony websites, emails or other messages, allowing the attacker can gain access to your account and sensitive information.
The following information will help you identify and avoid internet scams and phishing attempts:
Know the warning signs
Understanding the warning signs will help you protect yourself against phishing. Keep an eye out for these signs when reading messages and reviewing websites:
Overly general language: Although phishing can be well researched and tailored to you and your business, general language is a hallmark of phishing scams. Be wary of messages that seem to come from an organization you trust but that open with vague statements.

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Verifying hotspot names: Before connecting, make sure that the hotspot you plan to use is legitimate. If you can't see the hotspot name posted in an obvious place, then ask an employee.
Disable access points to your device: Public wi-fi networks are much less secure than private networks like the one at your home or office. Protect yourself by turning off file sharing within your network and enabling your firewall before connecting. Even with these precautions, it's still not a good idea to send or receive any sensitive content using a public wi-fi network.
If you feel you have received any phishing messages, please reach out to us using the "Contact Us" button below and we will help address your questions or concerns.

question: How can I ensure that my payments and information are secure when making online transactions?
gold_answer:
To ensure that your payments and information are secure when making online transactions, you should take the following steps as outlined in the provided document:

1. Use a secure connection: Make sure that the website you are using for the transaction starts with "https://" and not just "http://". Also, check for a lock icon beside the URL in your browser which indicates a secure connection.

2. Verify the website's URL: Be cautious of URLs that look slightly off from what you expect. Phishing attempts often use URLs that mimic legitimate ones to trick you. For example, compare "example-wholesale.com/apparel/tops" with a phony one like "example-wholesale.com-apparel.net/tops."

3. Beware of business messages from personal accounts: Be suspicious if you receive a business-related message from a personal email account, as this can be a tactic used by attackers.

4. Look out for red flags in content: Pay attention to misspellings, poor grammar, and inconsistent style within the website, as these can be indicators that the site is fraudulent.

5. Avoid alarmist tones: Be wary of messages or websites that use an alarmist or overly excited tone, especially if they pressure you to act quickly without giving you time to think.

question: What is the significance of the date July 1, 2021 in relation to VAT calculation for non-VAT registered retailers in another EU member state?
gold_answer: The significance of the date July 1, 2021, in relation to VAT calculation for non-VAT registered retailers in another EU member state is that it marks the change in how VAT is collected by EU brands on distance sales. As of this date, EU brands with distance sales of EUR 10,000 or more are required to collect VAT based on the VAT rate in the country where the retailer is located. This change came into effect as a result of new regulations; prior to this date, each EU country had its own threshold for sales to non-VAT registered businesses within that country. The details of these changes are outlined in Articles 33 and 59c (1) (c) of the EU VAT Directive.

metadata.title: Food and drink product attribute tags

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Attribute tags allow you to highlight key features of your products on Faire.
In this resource, you will find detailed information about food and drink attributes on Faire.
To learn more about how to add product attributes, as well as frequently asked questions, visit Product attributes
Please note that maintaining a high-quality marketplace is of the utmost importance to us. If we identify any inaccurate attribute tags, we may remove or modify such tags accordingly.
Can I list Allergens?
Yes! To add allergens that apply to your product, follow the same process as adding attributes. Navigate to the Additional Details section in the product listing and choose allergens from the Contains multi-select dropdown. You can also add allergens using the Bulk Editor.
Can I add the product shelf life?
Yes! To add shelf life and storage guidance, navigate to the Additional Details section in the product listing or the Bulk Editor and fill out the choose from the drop-downs for Storage and Shelf life.
Can I add certifications?
We currently do not have a set section for certifications, but we encourage you to add certifications to your product description or feature it in your product images, as this may be valuable information to your retailers.
Attribute Definitions
Diet
Alcohol-free : Does not contain alcohol
Dairy-free : Does not contain dairy (ex. milk, yogurt, cheese)
Gluten-free : Does not contain gluten (typically found in beer, breads, pastas, cakes, cereals)
Grain-free : Does not contain grains

metadata.title: Prestashop Integration with Faire

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
If you do not currently have any products on Faire, you can choose to ‘skip this step’, as there will not be any products to match and we can begin the import of products from Prestashop.
Matching Automatically:
We recommend choosing this step if the SKUs on your existing Faire products match the SKUs on your Prestashop products, as we will match products based on SKUs. When matching, product structure is also important - make sure they are the same in PrestaShop and Faire before moving forward.After you’ve selected this option, we will indicate how many products were perfect matches and how many need your review. If there are any products still needing review, you will be able to do so on the next screen, by searching the Prestashop product that will be linked.
Matching Manually:
We recommend choosing this step if you know that your products do not have matching SKUs, or if there may be more than one possible match for the product. This will give you the opportunity to match each product yourself.
After you’ve selected this option, you will be able to review and link products on the next screen, by searching the Prestashop product that will be linked.
Once you’ve completed the linking process, you can synchronize the catalog, which will create new products in Faire if applicable and sync all inventory information.
Once this synchronization is complete, you will see the status of the sync and also be able to view the logs for any errors that may have occurred. If you do see errors occurring, please share those logs with our support team at integrations.support@faire.com for assistance.
Order Synchronization

If you do not currently have any products on Faire, you can choose to ‘skip this step’, as there will not be any products to match and we can begin the import of products from Prestashop.
Matching Automatically:
We recommend choosing this step if the SKUs on your existing Faire products match the SKUs on your Prestashop products, as we will match products based on SKUs. When matching, product structure is also important - make sure they are the same in PrestaShop and Faire before moving forward.After you’ve selected this option, we will indicate how many products were perfect matches and how many need your review. If there are any products still needing review, you will be able to do so on the next screen, by searching the Prestashop product that will be linked.
Matching Manually:
We recommend choosing this step if you know that your products do not have matching SKUs, or if there may be more than one possible match for the product. This will give you the opportunity to match each product yourself.
After you’ve selected this option, you will be able to review and link products on the next screen, by searching the Prestashop product that will be linked.
Once you’ve completed the linking process, you can synchronize the catalog, which will create new products in Faire if applicable and sync all inventory information.
Once this synchronization is complete, you will see the status of the sync and also be able to view the logs for any errors that may have occurred. If you do see errors occurring, please share those logs with our support team at integrations.support@faire.com for assistance.
Order Synchronization

question: How can I obtain the API token for the Prestashop integration with Faire?
gold_answer: To obtain the API token for the Prestashop integration with Faire, you can respond to the Faire launch email to indicate your interest, and Faire will provide you with the details you need, including your API token. Alternatively, you can send an email to integrations.support@faire.com to request the API token.

gold_docs.page_content:
How to manage your inventory in the app
Tap the Menu icon at the bottom of the screen and tap Inventory.
Searching for products
You’re able to view all of your products from this page. You’re able to search for individual variants by searching the product name or SKU.
Updating inventory
To edit the inventory level, tap the number of units available and select Update to save your changes.
Star messages that you want to mark for follow-up in one of  two ways:
Within a thread: Tap the ⭐ symbol at the top right corner
From the messages page: swipe the individual thread from right to left
Unstar conversations using the same steps

metadata.title: What is the Faire app for brands?

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
The Faire app for brands was designed to help you provide next-level customer service - even when you’re on-the-go. With this app, you can keep in touch with your customers and manage orders and inventory from anywhere. It’s specific functionality includes:
Messaging
Respond to customer messages
Send photos
Mark conversations for follow-up
View relevant customer orders directly from your message thread
Order management
Review order details including relevant customer and shipping details
View products included in orders
Approve or cancel orders
Inventory management
View inventory levels
Update the number of units available
Push notifications
Receive real time notifications for new orders and messages on your phone or watch
Learn more about this functionality below, and stay tuned as we continue updating the app with new features to help you grow and run your business!
How to send messages in the app
Tap the Messages icon at the bottom of the screen to access your messages.
Searching for messages
You’re able to view all of your messages from this page. We’ve also built tools to help you filter, find, and follow up on your messages:
Filter by the message status (unread or starred) using the pills below the search bar
Search by the customer business name
Star messages that you want to mark for follow-up in one of  two ways:
Within a thread: Tap the ⭐ symbol at the top right corner
From the messages page: swipe the individual thread from right to left
Unstar conversations using the same steps
Responding to messages

question: How do I update the inventory level of my products in the app?
gold_answer:
To update the inventory level of your products in the Faire app, you should:

1. Tap the Menu icon at the bottom of the screen.
2. Tap Inventory.
3. Tap the number of units available for the product you want to update.
4. Select Update to save your changes.

gold_docs.page_content:
How does Faire calculate VAT on distance sales?
As a B2B (business-to-business) platform, the majority of brands on Faire exceed or are expected to exceed the EUR10,000 threshold. Therefore Faire assumes that all brands are registered for the OSS scheme and are required to collect VAT based on the “ship to” location for orders with non-VAT registered retailers in other EU member states. For sales to non-VAT registered retailers in other EU member states, Faire applies VAT at the standard rate applicable in the retailer’s country. Faire will then include the VAT collected on distance sales of goods in the brand payout, so that the brands may pay this over to the Tax Authorities via the OSS scheme. For the most current VAT rates in each country, please see here.

Source: https://www.faire.com/support/articles/5930329425947

question: How does Faire calculate VAT for non-VAT registered retailers in another EU member state?
gold_answer: Faire calculates VAT for non-VAT registered retailers in another EU member state by applying VAT at the standard rate applicable in the retailer's country. This is based on the assumption that all brands on Faire are registered for the One-Stop Shop (OSS) scheme and are required to collect VAT based on the "ship to" location for orders with such retailers. The VAT collected on these distance sales of goods is then included in the brand payout, so that the brands can pay it over to the Tax Authorities via the OSS scheme.

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Can I limit who can purchase my preorders?
If you are concerned about who can see and ship your preorder items, you have the ability to sell preorders to qualified retailers only. This setting is the default setting and is already toggled “on'' in your Shop Settings tab. Qualified retailers are those who have met Faire’s wholesale buying requirements or are on your Faire customer list. With this toggle on, only these retailers will be able to view your preorder items. For more info on qualified retailers, see here.
Can I bulk upload preorders?
Yes! If you would like to add preorder products in bulk to your shop, you can add these listings to your shop using the Bulk Upload tool in your portal.
Navigate to the Bulk Upload tab in your portal. Click “Start New Upload” and “Download Template” under Step 1 to get started.
The below sections must be filled out in the Bulk Upload template to create a preorder product:
Preorder (Y/N)
Ship By Date (YYYY-MM-DD)
Ship By End Date (if range, YYYY-MM-DD)
Order By Date (YYYY-MM-DD)
Sell After Order By/Ship Date (Y/N)
For more information about each section that must be filled out to create a preorder, follow these instructions:
When the preorder item is expected to ship
Any date <= 730 days from now

question: How can I update the estimated ship date for a pre-order?
gold_answer: You can update the estimated ship date for a pre-order on the order page.

gold_docs.page_content:
There is a flag to list something as a preorder
If you mark it as a preorder using the "Y" notation, you must provide a "Ship By Date"
The other columns are optional, but provide customizations to your preorder
You can only list a product as either a preorder or not; you cannot have it be both at the same time. To create both, you must create a new product or row, and it will be listed separately.
We only support xlsx format which can be opened and saved in Excel or Google Sheets (note: this sheet won't work in Numbers). We do not accept CSVs
Bulk uploading images
There are two ways you can upload images to your new products
Uploading images using URL links
Uploading images by attaching image files (JPEGs, PNGs)
Paste the URL of the image you are uploading in the "Image" column.
You must attach at least 1 image to all products with a Product Status of "Active". Any "Active" products with 0 images will be rejected. You can upload "Draft" products without images.
The bulk upload tool will only accept public URLs. If a URL requires a password to view, we will not be able to upload it.
Each URL must link to a single image. We cannot accept URLs to folders of images. This will result in an error.
Make sure the URL is public and accessible to Faire or people outside your organization.
Uploading images using File Upload

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Customizations
Under the "Customizable" column, enter "Yes" if you would like to offer customization for the corresponding product
Under the "Customizable Instructions" column, provide instructions to your retailer for how to add customization text to the selected product. A maximum of 70 characters is allowed for this cell.
Under the "Customization Retailer Input Limit" column, enter the maximum number of characters (in numerical format) for your customizations (ex: entering 50 would mean that a retailer's customization text cannot contain more than 50 characters)
Under the "Customization Minimum Order Quantity" column, enter the minimum order quantity (MOQ) for your customization. Your customization MOQ is the minimum number of items a retailer must order when they purchase your customization. Remember that the minimum order quantity must be greater than or equal to your product's MOQ and must be a multiple of your case size
Under the "Customization Charge Per Unit" column(s), enter the customization price(s) for each currency that you would like to offer your customization to. You may choose to enter customization prices for as many of the available currency columns as you would like

question: How can I upload images for my products and what are the requirements for the images?
gold_answer:
You can upload images for your products using two methods:

1. Uploading images using URL links:
   - Paste the public URL of the image you want to upload into the "Image" column.
   - The image URL must be public and accessible to Faire and people outside your organization. The bulk upload tool will only accept public URLs, and it cannot upload images if a URL requires a password to view.
   - Each URL must link directly to a single image, not to folders or collections of images.
   - Any "Active" products must have at least one image attached. Products with a status of "Active" that have 0 images will be rejected. However, you can upload "Draft" products without images.

2. Uploading images by attaching image files (JPEGs, PNGs):
   - The documentation does not provide specific instructions for this method within the excerpt provided. However, it implies that you can attach image files directly, likely within the bulk upload tool.

Requirements for the images:
- You must attach at least one image to all products with a Product Status of "Active".
- The URLs used for uploading images must be public and should not require a password to access.
- Each URL must link to a single image file; URLs to folders

question: How do I mark a product as a preorder and what information is required for preorders?
gold_answer: To mark a product as a preorder, you must use the "Y" notation in the relevant column of the bulk uploader sheet. Additionally, when you mark an item as a preorder, you must provide a "Ship By Date". The other columns related to preorders are optional and allow you to customize your preorder further.

gold_docs.page_content:
Custom item: There is also the option to add items that are custom, or not on Faire, such as displays. To add a custom item, click the ‘+ Custom Item’ link next to the product search field. You will then be able to name the item and set the price and quantity that will be added to the order. This is useful for samples, testers or any products you have not listed on Faire.
Ship date: Once all the items have been added to the order, select the shipping timeline for the order: ASAP, Scheduled, or Preorder. If it’s a scheduled order, a calendar field will appear for you to choose a date. If Preorder is selected, all products added must be preorders with the same shipping window.
Promotion: You can also add a custom promotion to the order by selecting the “Add Promotion” link listed under the subtotal. There you will be able to apply a discount (fixed amount off or percentage off) and choose whether you want to offer free shipping.
After all the required details are filled in, the option to email the order to the customer will become available to select at the bottom right of the page.
Will written orders appear with my other orders?
Yes, all written orders will appear in the same place as your marketplace orders and be fulfilled the same way as well. Please note that you will only see your written order in your orders page once the order is approved. Once the order is confirmed, you will see a prompt at the top of the written order linking to the created order.

question: How can I add custom items to my order on Faire?
gold_answer: To add custom items to your order on Faire, you should click the ‘+ Custom Item’ link next to the product search field. After clicking this link, you will be able to name the item, set the price, and specify the quantity that will be added to the order. This feature is especially useful for items such as samples, testers, or any products that you have not yet listed on Faire.

gold_docs.page_content:
In order to use specific features of Faire Direct, you may be asked to upload data of others (such as your customers or leads). In addition to crafting personalized, quality content, consider the audience you are reaching out to, and make sure that the communications you’re sending are not unwanted or unwarranted. It’s essential that you are only reaching out to legitimate business email addresses that have given consent to be contacted by your brand.
Here are some helpful guidelines to follow:
Review lists before uploading to Faire or emailing a list of individuals:

Make sure that the communication is relevant to them (e.g., they are a retailer, they are still in business, you have an existing business relationship with them or have interacted with them before, or––in the case of new leads––you don’t have any reason to believe they wouldn’t want to hear from you).
Never upload purchased or scraped email lists as these tend to include email addresses designed to catch spam senders. This will negatively impact your campaign performance, and in some cases may result in temporary or permanent email privilege suspension. This is also strictly prohibited in regions that adhere to GDPR compliance, and is enforced by our email delivery service. If you are suspended or banned, it is at the discretion of our third-party email delivery service and not in Faire’s control.

Compare the list you are providing to Faire Direct against your own “unsubscribe” list to make sure the retailers you are reaching out to through Faire haven’t already asked you not to contact them.
Purge any irrelevant data (or unsubscribed email addresses) from the list before uploading to your Customers list.

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Follow these steps to add new customers to your account: From your Customers tab, click the “Add Customers” button in the top right corner and select “Upload CSV” from the dropdown.
      For a successful upload, make sure to include the fields formatted in the image below: Contact Name, Store Name, and Email Address. We recommend downloading the pre-formatted CSV template for the best results.Here’s an example of a great CSV upload file using the pre-formatted template. Notice that each column has the appropriate title in the first row (Contact Name, Store Name, Email Address).
            Once you upload your CSV file, you'll be notified on the screen if any rows need correcting or if we can't identify the column names. Then you're all set! Note: Our system will automatically filter out any duplicates in your file, so if you have already uploaded a customer contact in your portal, it will be filtered out of future uploads.  How to add my customers individually

question: How do I know if I should reach out to a retailer through Faire Direct?
gold_answer: You should reach out to a retailer through Faire Direct if the communication is relevant to them. This includes making sure that they are a retailer, they are still in business, and you have an existing business relationship with them or have interacted with them before. In the case of new leads, you should have no reason to believe they wouldn’t want to hear from you. Additionally, you should compare your list against your own "unsubscribe" list to ensure that the retailers you are contacting have not already asked you not to contact them. It's also important to purge any irrelevant data or unsubscribed email addresses from the list before uploading it to your Customers list on Faire Direct. Remember to only use legitimate business email addresses that have given consent to be contacted by your brand.

Title: How do I set up payouts to an Australian bank account?
Content:
At this time we are only able to facilitate one bank account per brand account. This means that all of your orders on the platform will be paid out in one currency to one bank account. Please do not link more than one bank account to Adyen.  How are my payouts converted?

metadata.subtitle: Can I have more than one bank account?
metadata.title: How do I set up payouts to an Australian bank account?

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
We facilitate all transactions with brands located in Australia through our Australian entity. Therefore, brands in these locations will receive payouts in AUD, to their Australian bank account.
We use Adyen, a third-party payment service provider, to facilitate order payouts in Australia. We encourage you to set up your bank account once you complete onboarding on Faire to ensure you have no issues receiving payouts. If you do not complete this setup after onboarding, we will prompt you to complete this process at the time of your first order.
Linking your bank account
To set your bank account up, go to your Account Settings page and navigate to the Payments & Taxes section. You can then click on the Complete Payout Information button to get started. You will be redirected to Adyen to complete your account setup. Please choose the country that your business and bank account are registered in.
Adyen will verify your information and once complete, all payouts will begin depositing into the bank account you choose to connect, based on your payout terms. To learn more about our different payout terms, visit How is my payout calculated?
There are a few different statuses you might see during your Adyen setup.
In Review: Adyen is reviewing your documentation. Once this review is complete, you will receive an email with the results.
Incomplete: Adyen needs additional information from you to verify your account. If you require additional troubleshooting help, please see here.
Suspended: Your setup was not completed within 6 weeks, and your account has been temporarily suspended. Please contact Support for assistance.
Verified: you are now verified on Adyen and can receive payouts from Faire.

question: What happens if I only provide USD pricing to the company?
gold_answer: If you only provide USD pricing to the company, your retailers will still see a converted price in their local currency. The company will update this converted price based on the daily exchange rate.

question: How does the company convert payments to Australian dollars for orders placed in other currencies?
gold_answer: The company converts payments to Australian dollars for orders placed in other currencies based on the exchange rate on the date the order was placed. If the seller has provided currency-specific pricing for their products, that local currency price is used, and the payment is then converted to AUD using the exchange rate from the order date. If only USD pricing is provided, the company will still show retailers a converted price in their local currency, which is updated based on the daily exchange rate.

gold_docs.page_content:
Hydrating : Hydrating hair care products are designed to provide moisture and nourishment to dry, brittle, or damaged hair
pH Balancing : pH balancing products are designed to balance the pH level of the scalp and hair
Purifying : Purifying hair care products are designed to remove buildup, impurities, and excess oil from the hair and scalp to promote a healthy and balanced environment for hair growth.
Shine Enhancing : Shine enhancing products are designed to add shine and luster to hair, making it look healthy and radiant
Thickening : Thickening hair products are hair care products that are designed to increase the thickness and volume of hair, by coating the hair shaft and adding body to fine or thin hair
Volumizing : Volumizing hair products are designed to add volume and fullness to hair, by lifting the hair at the roots and creating the appearance of thicker hair
Size
Descriptor of the size of the packaging the product comes in.
Gift Set : A set of beauty products that often serve as a gift option. These might be sold during holiday time and used as a way to bundle products in a similar collection.
Travel / Mini : A travel size item (less than 3.4 ounces) that can be taken on planes or in a carry-on or a miniature item that might be gifted as a stocking stuffer.
Refill Only : A refill of a product - This typically does not come in packaging meant for final use. For example, this could include a pouch with soap that is intended to be poured into a soap bottle sold separately.
Ingredient Preferences
Health and climate related ingredient preferences.

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Matte : A matte makeup finish refers to a makeup look that appears flat, without any shine or reflective qualities, creating a velvety and smooth appearance.
Natural : A natural makeup finish refers to a makeup look that appears minimal and effortless, emphasizing the natural beauty of the skin and features, rather than masking or altering them.
Satin : A satin makeup finish refers to a makeup look that appears smooth, soft, and slightly luminous, with a subtle sheen that creates a polished and refined appearance.
Sheer : A sheer makeup finish refers to a makeup look that appears light and transparent, allowing the natural skin tone and texture to show through, while providing a subtle hint of color and coverage.
Shimmer : A shimmer makeup finish refers to a makeup look that appears radiant and sparkling, with a luminous and multidimensional effect created by the use of products that contain fine particles of glitter or shimmer.
Occasion
The holiday this product is intended to be gifted during. Includes packaging that directly references or is distinctly related to that holiday theme.
Christmas
Mother's Day
Father's Day
Valentine's Day

question: What does it mean when a product is labeled as "Refill Only"?
gold_answer: When a product is labeled as "Refill Only," it means that the product is a refill of an existing item and typically does not come in packaging meant for final use. For example, this could be a pouch of soap that is intended to be poured into a soap bottle sold separately.

Sheer : A sheer makeup finish refers to a makeup look that appears light and transparent, allowing the natural skin tone and texture to show through, while providing a subtle hint of color and coverage.
Shimmer : A shimmer makeup finish refers to a makeup look that appears radiant and sparkling, with a luminous and multidimensional effect created by the use of products that contain fine particles of glitter or shimmer.
Occasion
The holiday this product is intended to be gifted during. Includes packaging that directly references or is distinctly related to that holiday theme.
Christmas
Mother's Day
Father's Day
Valentine's Day

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Descriptor of the size of the packaging the product comes in. 
Gift Set : A set of beauty products that often serve as a gift option. These might be sold during holiday time and used as a way to bundle products in a similar collection. 
Travel / Mini : A travel size item (less than 3.4 ounces) that can be taken on planes or in a carry-on or a miniature item that might be gifted as a stocking stuffer. 
Refill Only : A refill of a product - This typically does not come in packaging meant for final use. For example, this could include a pouch with soap that is intended to be poured into a soap bottle sold separately.  Ingredient Preferences

question: What does it mean when a hair care product is described as "pH balancing"?
gold_answer: When a hair care product is described as "pH balancing," it means that the product is designed to balance the pH level of the scalp and hair.

gold_docs.page_content:
Yes! You can create custom promo codes to share with your customers to use towards your shop on Faire! We’ve heard from brands that offering custom promo codes enables them to convert new leads, drive customer loyalty, and provide top quality customer service.
Some restrictions do apply:
Promo codes can only be set as % off discounts at this time.
Promo codes can’t be limited to a certain customer type (new, returning) or location, and can be used by any retailer that enters the code at checkout.
Promo code promotions can run for a maximum of 14 days at a time.
Once a promo code is active the promotion details can’t be edited.
Retailers can only use a promo code once.
Only one promo code can be added to an order.
Promo codes will stack with other shop-wide promotions, and product-specific promotions that you have running at the same time.
Promo code promotions can run for a maximum of 14 days at a time, which means that you may extend the promo code end date only up to 14 days. A promo code promotion can’t be ended early or deactivated after it is active.
How do I create a promo code?
You can create a promo code from 3 different areas in your Faire account; the Promotions page, the Customers page, and the Campaigns page.
To create a promo code from the Promotions page:
Click the Create promotion button in the top-right corner of the page, and select Promo code from the drop-down menu.
Enter the Promo code, Promotion dates, Promotion details
Click the Save promotion button in the bottom-right corner of the page

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
If your customs brokerage information is included on the commercial invoice, they will be contacted at the time of import to clear the package on your behalf.
If your customs brokerage information is not provided on the commercial invoice, you will be contacted directly by the carrier to clear the package.
If you do not have a customs broker and want to authorize carriers to clear customs on your behalf, you will need to draft a POA (Power of Attorney) letter, and share it with the carrier upon request. Please note, this applies to tightly controlled product categories.
Tightly regulated product categories in the UK
When importing into the UK, you are required to comply with import regulations as set out by the UK Government, including, but not limited to, regulations for controlled goods. Importing controlled goods into your country/region may require additional authorization or clearance. Below, we have listed some common controlled goods categories for which additional requirements may apply:
Controlled goods : products that require licenses or permits for import, or additional documentation from the importer.  There are special rules, and you may need to get licenses or certificates if you are importing any of the following: animal products, plants and plant products, high risk food, food supplements, cosmetics.
Dangerous goods (DG): Substances that when transported are a risk to health, safety, property or the environment. Certain dangerous goods that pose risks even when not being transported are known as hazardous materials.
Food products Food product means any substance, other than a substance used primarily for the purpose of imparting flavor, intended to be consumed by humans or animals. To learn more, visit the following UK government resources : Import goods into the UK, and Import, export and distribution of food

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
We understand that buying and importing products from international brands can be challenging, rules and documentation requirements vary, depending on:
Your country, its laws and regulations.
The products you are importing
The country of origin of these products
As a retailer on Faire, you are the importer of record, and are responsible for ensuring you have the right to resell the products you purchase on Faire, in compliance with UK law and regulation.
We want to help you feel confident buying from international brands.
This guide consists of tips and advice for UK retailers buying and importing international products into the UK.
Please note, this resource is non-exhaustive and purely indicative.
To learn about general international guidance (not UK specific), visit How to buy internationally on Faire
How to determine if you can buy, import and resell international products in the UK
To determine if the products you want to purchase from international brands can be imported, and resold in the UK, we recommend:
Consulting governmental websites to check if there are any restrictions or specific requirements for importing the products you wish to purchase internationally:
Look into any license requirements, or permit you may need as an importer when purchasing certain products. To learn more, visit Import goods into the UK
Looking into potential restrictions enforced by your country, based on the country of manufacturing/origin of the products.
Consulting legal counsel and/or a customs broker to determine your readiness to import given products from a given country.
Documentation and compliance requirements for the import of international products into the UK
Upon import of products, as the importer, you may be required to provide some information and/or documentation to support customs clearance of your order.
You will find non-exhaustive guidance below, to help understand what falls under your responsibility as the importer, if requested by UK customs :

Document type
Retailer responsibility
Brand responsibility
Documentation specific to your company (if applicable and required)
✔️

question: What is an EORI number and why is it important for businesses buying internationally?
gold_answer: An EORI number, which stands for "Economic Operators Registration and Identification" number, is a unique identifier used by businesses to identify themselves to customs authorities on customs declarations and other import documentation. It is important for businesses buying internationally because it is essential for the customs process, allowing businesses to import goods legally and ensuring that customs authorities can efficiently process the imports. Without an EORI number, businesses may face delays or issues when importing goods into the UK.

gold_docs.page_content: The “Economic Operators Registration and Identification” (EORI) number is a unique number used by businesses to identify themselves to customs authorities on customs declarations and other import documentation. Think of it as a customs registration number. Applying for an EORI number is free. Ensuring you are EORI registered falls under your responsibility as a business buying internationally. To learn more about how to apply for an EORI number, please visit How do I apply for an EORI

question: How can I apply for an EORI number?
gold_answer: To apply for an EORI number, you should visit the page titled "How do I apply for an EORI" for detailed instructions. Is it a preorder?

A preorder is an order placed for an item not yet in stock that will ship at a later date.

A ship-by date or date range is mandatory. To learn more, visit Preorders.

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
To complete Faire’s catalog template, follow the steps below.
Click Download Template under Step 1: Upload a catalog file.

Fill in the required fields in the template (and any of the optional fields). See below for a full list.
Upload the completed file in Step 1: Upload a catalog file.

Use the Notes section to leave special instructions for our team. For example, our default is to group products and their options together. If you prefer to keep them separate, please specify that here.
Share your product images in Step 2: Share product images.

If you’re sharing the images in the template, you have two options:

Paste public URL links of your images in the image columns.
Paste your image file names in the image columns and submit a folder or link with the corresponding images. You'll submit the image folder or link in the next step of onboarding. To learn more, visit How do I share my product images for onboarding?

Do not paste actual images into the template.


Images must be in .jpg or .png format. Recommended image size: 1050 x 1050 pixels


If you’re sharing the images in the template, you have two options:

Paste public URL links of your images in the image columns.
Paste your image file names in the image columns and submit a folder or link with the corresponding images. You'll submit the image folder or link in the next step of onboarding. To learn more, visit How do I share my product images for onboarding?

Do not paste actual images into the template.


If sharing links to a drive, such as Google Drive, Dropbox, or WeTransfer:

metadata.subtitle: Option 2: Complete Faire's catalog template
metadata.title: Uploading your product catalog

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Do not paste actual images into the template.


If sharing links to a drive, such as Google Drive, Dropbox, or WeTransfer:

Make sure permissions are set so that anyone with the link can view and download the files. To learn more, visit How do I share my product images for onboarding?.
Ensure your product images are labeled with the product name and/or SKU that is listed in your catalog.


Click Submit Files. Our team will build your shop and email you when it’s ready! Please note, it can take 5 to 10 business days for our team to build your page.
Required template fields:
For our team to build your page, every product in your catalog must have:
Product name

Character limit: 60


Product description

Character limit: 1000


Wholesale price

Wholesale price must be between 10% and 80% of the retail price and must be the same price listed on your other wholesale channels.
Please list prices exclusive of VAT and/or GST, as this is added automatically to applicable orders.


Retail price

Suggested retail price (MSRP)


Case quantity

The number of units of a single product option a retailer can add to their order at a time.


Minimum order quantity

The minimum total units of a single product option that a retailer must hit, in order to check out.
For example: Case Size = 6; MOQ = 6, 12, 18, etc.


Optional template fields:
Testers

Let us know if you would like to sell testers with your products and at what price.


Preorder availability

The options for fabric care instructions are:
- Machine Wash
- Hand Wash
- Dry Clean Only

gold_docs.page_content:
Health and climate related ingredient preferences. 
Chemical sunscreen : Chemical sunscreens typically include active ingredients such as oxybenzone, avobenzone, octisalate, octocrylene, homosalate, and octinoxate that absorb into your skin. These ingredients provide sun protection by absorbing UVA and UVB rays before they can reach your skin. Chemical sunscreens are distinct from mineral sunscreens. 
Dermatologist Approved : Refers to products that have been reviewed and recommended by a dermatologist. 
Fragrance-Free : Refers to products that do not contain added fragrances. 
Gluten-Free : Refers to products that do not contain gluten, a type of protein found in wheat, barley, and rye. 
Hypoallergenic : Hypoallergenic products are formulated to be less likely to cause an allergic reaction, particularly for individuals with sensitive skin. These products are typically free of common allergens such as fragrances, preservatives, and dyes that can irritate the skin. 
Mineral sunscreen : Mineral sunscreen is often formulated with mineral-based ingredients such as zinc oxide and titanium oxide. These sunscreens provide sun protection by creating a physical barrier on the skin to reflect UV radiation. Mineral sunscreens are distinct from chemical sunscreens. 
Non-Comedogenic : Non-comedogenic products are formulated to not clog pores, which can lead to the formation of blackheads and pimples. These products are typically oil-free and contain ingredients that are less likely to cause acne or skin irritation, making them suitable for individuals with acne-prone or sensitive skin.
