question: What are tariff codes and why are they important for cross-border commercial invoices?
gold_answer: Tariff codes, also known as Harmonized System (HS) codes, are an international customs classification system used by most trading nations around the world. They are important for cross-border commercial invoices because they are required on any such invoices and ensure that the correct import duties are applied to the shipped products. Accurate tariff codes help prevent customs issues by providing a universal language for the classification of goods, thereby facilitating international trade.

To learn how to edit this in your product page, visit How do I add or edit products?
What if customs agencies or carriers require additional information to clear my shipments?
If you ship products internationally, and additional information or documentation is required by the country of import for your products, you might be contacted by a customs agent, carrier, or your retailer to provide the necessary information to help clear customs.
Here are a few things to keep in mind :
You are the exporter. Ensuring your products can be exported, sold and imported for B2B purposes in other countries falls under your responsibility.
The retailer is the importer and is responsible for complying with all import rules and regulations when importing goods into their country.
The customs agent and/or carrier may reach out to you via phone, or via Faire support on an email thread if you are using Ship with Faire.
Faire cannot provide information or certificates for your products to be exported and imported smoothly.
Orders can typically be stalled at a border for a limited time, (this tends to vary between 3 and 5 days)
If you are unresponsive, or fail to provide the required information/documentation/certification, the customs agency may decide to abandon, destroy, or return the shipment to sender. This decision is outside of Faire’s control, and is informed by local regulations, depending on the product types and the ability of a carrier to proceed to Return to Sender.

gold_answer: To ensure that the correct country of origin is listed for each product on the commercial invoice, you should set the 'Made in country' on a product level, especially if you list products made in different countries. This will help surface the right country of origin for each product on the commercial invoice and prevent customs complications. For guidance on how to edit this in your product page, you can visit the provided link or section that explains 'How do I add or edit products?' in the company's support articles or documentation.

Austria
Belgium

Portugal

Norway
Spain
Sweden
Switzerland
The UK
(excluding Crown dependencies: Guernsey, Jersey, The Isle of Man, and the British Virgin Islands, as well as British Overseas Territories such as Gibraltar)
Additional requirements apply for UK retailers, to learn more click here.
We look forward to launching in additional countries soon.
Where do I find alcohol products?
You will find alcohol products under the category navigation for “Food & Drink”, with a new sub-category called “Wine, Beer and Spirits”.
What do I need to do before ordering?
You are responsible for following the entry requirements for alcohol in your country.Generally, importing alcohol from another country requires notifying customs ahead of time. For specific requirements for bringing alcohol into your country, please consult your tax advisor or customs broker.
Why can’t I see alcohol products?
We are currently understanding what is most valuable in this category for our retailers in Austria, Belgium, Denmark, France, Germany, Ireland, Italy, Luxembourg, Portugal, Netherlands, Norway, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland and the UK.
If you are located in a different country, at this time alcohol will not be available. We will continue to make improvements and look forward to expanding the sale of alcohol to other countries in the future.
Additional UK specific requirements

gold_docs.page_content:
Enter the first 8 digits of your UTR number in the field Registration Number
Upload an HMRC document from the last 12 months. Your name and UTR number should be on this document
Identity requirements
Adyen verifies a person’s identity before enabling payouts. The legal entity type of the account holder determines what information we need to collect.
Individual: Information about the person or sole proprietor
Business: Information about all shareholders or ultimate beneficial owners (UBO) who own 25% or more of the business. If no one owns 25% or more of the business, we need to receive information about a person authorized to sign up the company as an account holder.
For more help, visit Adyen’s help center.
Photo ID requirements
If you’re providing an image of an ID card or driver's license, you must upload separate images of the front and back of your identification. When you upload a photo ID to Adyen, it must meet the following requirements:
Valid (must not be expired)
In color (no black and white photos)
Visible MRZ (Machine Readable Zone) if available
File requirements:
Only JPEG, JPG, PNG, or PDF (max. 2 pages)
Minimum size: 1 KB for PDF, 100 KB for other formats
Maximum size: 10 MB
Additional information to note:
The date of birth must exactly match the date of birth on the document
The first name must match the first or middle name on the ID document
The last name must match the last last name on the identity document

question: What are the requirements for uploading a photo ID to Adyen?
gold_answer:
When uploading a photo ID to Adyen, the following requirements must be met:

1. The photo ID must be valid, meaning it must not be expired.
2. The image must be in color; black and white photos are not acceptable.
3. If the ID has a Machine Readable Zone (MRZ), it must be visible in the image.
4. The file format can be JPEG, JPG, PNG, or PDF (with a maximum of 2 pages).
5. The file size must be a minimum of 1 KB for PDFs and 100 KB for other formats.
6. The maximum file size allowed is 10 MB.

Additionally, the date of birth on the photo ID must exactly match the date of birth on the document provided, the first name on the ID must match the first or middle name on the document, and the last name must match the last last name on the identity document. Separate images of the front and back must be uploaded if you're providing an ID card or driver's license.

question: What information is needed for individual and business accounts in order to verify identity with Adyen?
gold_answer:
For individual accounts, Adyen requires information about the person or sole proprietor to verify their identity.

For business accounts, Adyen needs information about all shareholders or ultimate beneficial owners (UBO) who own 25% or more of the business. If no individual owns 25% or more of the business, then information is required about a person authorized to sign up the company as an account holder.

gold_docs.page_content:
Congratulations on your first order with Faire! Upon receiving an order, we request that you fill out your banking details for payouts as well as some important tax information.
Let us know where your brand is located. Please note: If you are located in any of the countries listed here you will not be required to to fill out a U.S. tax form.
Provide your legal brand name, this name should be associated with the TIN that you provide. You may use your business name if an EIN was provided, and your personal name if a SSN was provided. If you're not sure which to use, please consult a tax advisor.
Provide your tax classification and number. This can be either your EIN or SSN - just be sure that the TIN you report is associated with the legal brand name you provide. We will send you appropriate tax documentation, when eligible. For more info about 1099-K forms, please click here.
Error message: we provide real time tax information validation against the current IRS records to ensure the tax information you provided are accurate. If you get an error message stating your information is incorrect, please review your tax details and attempt to resubmit. If you’re certain your information is correct and continue to receive the error, please use the Contact Us link below.
If your brand is not based in the U.S., please continue to follow the prompts to provide additional information to ensure tax exemption on revenue from the U.S. This process is equivalent to filling out a W-8BEN-E form to confirm and certify your tax exemption in the U.S. Please fill out the form, certify, sign and submit.

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Finally, let us know how you'd like to receive your tax forms. Selecting ‘Electronically’ will allow you to download the copies from your Faire portal. If you choose ‘By Mail’, you will be sent a physical copy of your form to the address listed in your portal. Feel free to choose both!
How do I update my tax information?
You’re able to update your tax information from the Export & Taxes tab under Account Settings in your brand portal.
From here, you’re able to update the following information:
Legal Brand Name: Your legal brand name should be associated with the TIN that you provide. Generally speaking, you’ll use your business name if an EIN was provided, and your personal name if a SSN was provided.
Legal Address: This address will be printed on your tax form and it is where your form will be mailed, if you’ve selected mail delivery.
Tax Identification Number (TIN): This can be either your EIN or SSN - just be sure that the TIN you report is associated with the legal brand name you provide.
Delivery preferences: Selecting ‘Electronically’ will allow you to download your tax forms directly from your Faire portal. If you choose ‘By Mail’, you will be sent a physical copy of your form to the address listed in your portal. Feel free to choose both!
Why do we recommend going paperless?
You get your form as soon as we generate it. No delays. No headaches.
You have the freedom to access it whenever you want.
Save the trees!
How do updates to my tax information impact my current and future tax forms?

question: What tax information do I need to provide for my first order with Faire?
gold_answer:
For your first order with Faire, you need to provide the following tax information:

1. Your banking details for payouts.
2. The location of your brand. If your brand is located in one of the countries listed on their website, you will not be required to fill out a U.S. tax form.
3. Your legal brand name, which should be associated with the Tax Identification Number (TIN) you will provide. Use your business name if you are providing an Employer Identification Number (EIN), or your personal name if you are providing a Social Security Number (SSN).
4. Your tax classification and number, which can be either your EIN or SSN. Ensure that the TIN is associated with the legal brand name you provide.

Additionally, if your brand is not based in the U.S., you will need to follow the prompts to provide information to ensure tax exemption on revenue from the U.S., which is equivalent to filling out a W-8BEN-E form to certify your tax exemption.

gold_docs.page_content:
Congratulations on your first order with Faire! Upon receiving an order, we request that you fill out your banking details for payouts as well as some important tax information.
Let us know where your brand is located. Please note: If you are located in any of the countries listed here you will not be required to to fill out a U.S. tax form.
Provide your legal brand name, this name should be associated with the TIN that you provide. You may use your business name if an EIN was provided, and your personal name if a SSN was provided. If you're not sure which to use, please consult a tax advisor.
Provide your tax classification and number. This can be either your EIN or SSN - just be sure that the TIN you report is associated with the legal brand name you provide. We will send you appropriate tax documentation, when eligible. For more info about 1099-K forms, please click here.
Error message: we provide real time tax information validation against the current IRS records to ensure the tax information you provided are accurate. If you get an error message stating your information is incorrect, please review your tax details and attempt to resubmit. If you’re certain your information is correct and continue to receive the error, please use the Contact Us link below.
If your brand is not based in the U.S., please continue to follow the prompts to provide additional information to ensure tax exemption on revenue from the U.S. This process is equivalent to filling out a W-8BEN-E form to confirm and certify your tax exemption in the U.S. Please fill out the form, certify, sign and submit.

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Finally, let us know how you'd like to receive your tax forms. Selecting ‘Electronically’ will allow you to download the copies from your Faire portal. If you choose ‘By Mail’, you will be sent a physical copy of your form to the address listed in your portal. Feel free to choose both!
How do I update my tax information?
You’re able to update your tax information from the Export & Taxes tab under Account Settings in your brand portal.
From here, you’re able to update the following information:
Legal Brand Name: Your legal brand name should be associated with the TIN that you provide. Generally speaking, you’ll use your business name if an EIN was provided, and your personal name if a SSN was provided.
Legal Address: This address will be printed on your tax form and it is where your form will be mailed, if you’ve selected mail delivery.
Tax Identification Number (TIN): This can be either your EIN or SSN - just be sure that the TIN you report is associated with the legal brand name you provide.
Delivery preferences: Selecting ‘Electronically’ will allow you to download your tax forms directly from your Faire portal. If you choose ‘By Mail’, you will be sent a physical copy of your form to the address listed in your portal. Feel free to choose both!
Why do we recommend going paperless?
You get your form as soon as we generate it. No delays. No headaches.
You have the freedom to access it whenever you want.
Save the trees!
How do updates to my tax information impact my current and future tax forms?

How do updates to my tax information impact my current and future tax forms?
If updates are made after January 31st, 2022, they will be applied to all future tax forms only. If you need to update tax information for earlier years, please Contact Faire Support.

gold_answer: If you receive an error message stating your tax information is incorrect, you should first review your tax details to ensure they are accurate and attempt to resubmit them. If you are certain your information is correct and you continue to receive the error, you should use the Contact Us link to get assistance.

metadata.title: Buying and importing into the EU

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
We understand that buying and importing products from international brands can be challenging, rules and documentation requirements vary, depending on:
Your country, its laws and regulations
The products you are importing
The country of origin of these products
As a retailer on Faire, you are the importer of record, and are responsible for ensuring you have the right to resell the products you purchase on Faire, in compliance with EU and EU country specific laws and regulation.
We want to help you feel confident buying from international brands.
This guide consists of tips and advice for EU retailers buying and importing international products into the European Union.
Please note, this resource is non-exhaustive and purely indicative.
To learn about general international guidance (not EU specific), visit How to buy internationally on Faire
How to determine if you can buy, import and resell international products in the EU
To determine if the products you want to purchase from international brands can be imported, and resold in the EU, we recommend:
Consulting governmental websites to check if there are any restrictions or specific requirements for importing the products you wish to purchase internationally.
Look into any license requirements, or permit you may need as an importer when purchasing certain products. To learn more, visit Guide for import of goods
Looking into potential restrictions enforced by your country, based on the country of manufacturing/origin of the products.
Consulting legal counsel and/or a customs broker to determine your readiness to import given products from a given country.
Documentation and compliance requirements for the import of international products into the EU
Upon import of products, as the importer, you may be required to provide some information and/or documentation to support customs clearance of your order.
You will find non-exhaustive guidance below, to help understand what falls under your responsibility as the importer, if requested by an EU country’s customs agency :

Document type
Retailer responsibility
Brand responsibility
Documentation specific to your company (if applicable and required)
✔️

question: What is the process for retailers to reclaim import VAT in France?
gold_answer: Based on the document provided, retailers from non-EU Member States are required to register for French VAT to self-account for the import VAT arising on the supply. However, once registered, the document states that retailers will not be able to reclaim this import VAT if they wish to continue to apply the de minimis small business threshold, where they make supplies within France without VAT. Therefore, the document implies that in order to reclaim import VAT, a retailer would have to not apply the de minimis small business threshold. For more specific information on the VAT implications and the process for reclaiming import VAT, the document recommends consulting your tax advisor.

question: What is the de minimis small business threshold and how does it relate to VAT in France?
gold_answer: The de minimis small business threshold refers to a specific threshold under which small businesses can make supplies within a country like France without having to charge VAT (Value Added Tax). This threshold allows smaller businesses to operate with simpler tax requirements. However, according to the document, if retailers from outside the EU (non-EU Member State) decide to register for French VAT to self-account for import VAT, they would not be able to reclaim this import VAT if they choose to continue applying this de minimis threshold. In other words, once they register for VAT in France to deal with imports, they cannot benefit from the de minimis threshold and must account for VAT on all their supplies within France.

metadata.title: Getting started as a Canadian retailer

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Welcome to Faire! Here are some important aspects of the experience to keep in mind as you get started on Faire.
Eligibility
Please sign up for a free retailer account here. Retailers must purchase with the intent to resell at MSRP and must operate their own commercial brick and mortar store, unique online store, or consistent pop-up shop.Please be prepared to share the following information: First and Last Name, Store Type, Email Address, Store Name, Years in Business, Annual Sales, business registration info like GST/HST/BN number, etc. Our Accounts team will reach out for any clarifications needed!Brands can elect to restrict certain provinces on Faire depending on their business model. We also offer brands an opt-out program called Faire Protection to protect their stockist regions by postal code. Should you be unable to purchase from a desired brand, it could be due to one of these reasons.
Navigating the marketplace
Learning to navigate the Faire marketplace will help you find brands that are the best fit for you and your customers. You can view brands from each category by selecting the category tab from the top of your account. Once you have chosen a category, you can continue to filter the results until you find what you are looking for. We encourage you to filter by brands that Ship from Canada or are Made in Canada to support your local brand communities.
Currency
New retailers joining Faire will be charged in CAD. If you were previously paying your invoices in USD, your account will be converted to CAD currency in the near future. When your account is converted, you will see all of your invoices in CAD. Any invoices that were paid in USD will also show as CAD. We will show the conversion rate used on those orders to help reconcile your invoices.

question: What kind of products does the company recommend Canadian retailers to support?
gold_answer: The company recommends Canadian retailers to support products that are from Canada or are Made in Canada, in order to support local brand communities.

gold_docs.page_content:
Faire provides two types of invoices to European and Australian brands, order invoices and commission invoices. You can find both of these invoices on the fulfillment page for each order.
What are order invoices?
Faire generates order invoices on behalf of European and Australian brands when they receive an order via the Faire platform. Faire does not take legal title of the goods purchased on the platform, therefore the order invoices are issued in the name of, and on behalf of, the brand. ​​
Additionally, some countries have specific, local, invoicing requirements. When this is the case, Faire standard invoices should not be considered for tax purposes. If you need additional documentation or are in doubt about your VAT/GST and invoicing obligations, please refer to your tax or business consultant.
Order invoices will be issued for any order placed after October 25, 2021. Orders placed before this date will not have order invoices attached to them. Brands and retailers will both receive a copy of the order invoice for their records.
Your invoice will not be finalized until the order has been shipped.
What are commission invoices?
A commission invoice is an invoice issued by Faire in its own name, to the brand. European brands will receive a commission invoice when a retailer places an order.
This invoice includes the total commission on the order, applicable payment processing fees, and any VAT/GST due.
Why are select invoices in USD?

Source: https://www.faire.com/support/articles/4408351766171

metadata.subtitle: Email Marketing campaign limits during Faire Markets
metadata.title: Creating a campaign

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
In order to preserve the experience of retailers, our system limits the amount of marketing campaign emails that retailers can receive in a day. Here are the details of our emailing system for faire.com domains: Each retailer can receive up to 2 campaign emails from brands on Faire across a 24 hour period Each brand can email a retailer once every 24 hours

Ex: If you haven't emailed your retailer in the past 24 hours and the retailer hasn't been emailed by 2 other brands in the past 24 hours, your email will be sent!

 If your retailer recipient has already reached their email limit, any campaign you try to send them that day will say "unsent" and the email will not send to the recipient. Please also keep in mind that if a retailer reports a campaign as spam, bounced, or unsubscribed from your marketing list, they will not receive your future campaigns. Read more about our Spam and Bounce requirements here. Note that you do have the option to send campaigns from your business email address domain instead of the faire.com domain, which means you will not be subject to the limits above that result in unsent emails. However, please note that brands may notice a drop in campaign open rate after switching, depending on how strong of a reputation you've already built with your email domain.   Email Marketing campaign limits during Faire Markets

question: How can I send campaigns from my business email address on Faire?
gold_answer: To send campaigns from your business email address on Faire, you need to connect your email address to your Faire account. You can do this by going to your Account Settings page and locating the “Connected Accounts” section. Once there, follow the prompts to set it up. After confirmation, the connected email address will be used for future email campaigns on Faire. Faire uses Postmark, a third-party email service, to enable this feature.

question: How do I connect my email address to my Faire account for email campaigns?
gold_answer: To connect your email address to your Faire account for email campaigns, go to your Account Settings page and look for the "Connected Accounts" section. From there, follow the prompts to set up the connection. Faire uses Postmark, a third-party email service, to facilitate this process. Once confirmed, the email address you connect will be used for future email campaigns on Faire.

gold_docs.page_content:
Our team selects brands to be featured on Faire’s social and content channels based on platform engagement, which may include (but is not limited to) the following factors:
Actively using Faire’s tools including Faire Direct
Responding to retailer inquiries and fulfilling a high percentage of orders received
Using conversion boosting features such as collections
Updating product catalogs on a regular basis
Featuring high-quality photography content
In terms of Faire’s email promotions, we think of them as an extension of the Faire.com experience. So the same factors you consider to boost your visibility on Faire.com and outlined above will also help increase the odds your brand is featured in our marketing.
To learn more about what our design team looks for in featured photography content, visit our Product photography guidelines
To learn more about promoting your line using Faire’s marketing tools, visit Creating a campaign

question: What factors does Faire consider when selecting brands to be featured on their social and content channels?
gold_answer:
Faire considers several factors when selecting brands to be featured on their social and content channels, including:

1. Actively using Faire’s tools, including Faire Direct.
2. Responding to retailer inquiries promptly and fulfilling a high percentage of orders received.
3. Using conversion boosting features such as collections.
4. Regularly updating product catalogs.
5. Featuring high-quality photography content.

question: How can I increase the odds of my brand being featured in Faire's marketing efforts?
gold_answer:
To increase the odds of your brand being featured in Faire's marketing efforts, you should focus on the following actions:

1. Actively use Faire’s tools, including Faire Direct.
2. Respond promptly to retailer inquiries and ensure a high percentage of orders received are fulfilled.
3. Utilize conversion boosting features, such as creating collections.
4. Regularly update your product catalogs.
5. Provide high-quality photography content.

Additionally, consider that the factors that boost your visibility on Faire.com are the same ones that can help increase the likelihood of being featured in Faire’s email promotions and other marketing channels. For detailed guidance on photography content, you can visit Faire’s Product photography guidelines, and for information on how to promote your line using Faire’s marketing tools, you should visit Creating a campaign.

Title: Understanding Search and Ranking on Faire
Content:
No, not directly; however, backorders may indirectly impact your ranking if they lead to negative retailer reviews or lower product conversion rates. We encourage brands to keep their inventory up-to-date to prevent backorders.  How does fulfillment timing impact ranking?

question: How does the return rate of products affect their ranking in search results on Faire?
gold_answer: The return rate of products is one of over 100 factors considered in ranking search results on Faire. While Faire does take the historical return rate into account in their ranking system, having a few returns will not significantly impact a product's overall ranking.

question: How does Faire determine the ranking of search results?
gold_answer: Faire determines the ranking of search results by considering over 100 factors in their ranking system. While historical return rate is one of these factors, it is not the sole determinant of a product's ranking in search results. This implies that a variety of criteria are used to rank products, ensuring that a few returns do not significantly impact the overall product ranking.

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
A preorder is an order placed for a style before it has been produced, with the understanding that it will be shipped later. Preorders are placed on collections that are offered during a defined buying period, and ship months after the order date. Often, preorders have to hit order minimums for factories to go into production.You can set product style listings as preorders within the Product Editor, Bulk Uploader, and Bulk Editor in your Brand Portal. Product styles that don't fall under the preorder selling model outlined above shouldn't be listed as preorders on Faire. Backorders and made-to-order aren't preorders.   Backorders are created when an in-stock style is temporarily marked as out-of-stock on an order. For more information on backorders, visit Setting out-of-stock or discontinues items
   Made-to-order orders are received and then produced, often in small batches or one-off production and year-round, with a lead time of anything from a few days to several weeks.  How do I set up a preorder item?

question: How can I add preorder products in bulk to my shop?
gold_answer: You can add preorder products in bulk to your shop by using the Bulk Upload tool in your portal. To do this, navigate to the Products > Bulk Upload tab in your portal, and then select the Download button where it says "Only adding new preorders?" under Step 1. Make sure to fill out the necessary sections in the downloaded document.

gold_docs.page_content:
Diet 

Alcohol-free : Does not contain alcohol

Dairy-free : Does not contain dairy (ex. milk, yogurt, cheese)

Gluten-free : Does not contain gluten (typically found in beer, breads, pastas, cakes, cereals)

Grain-free : Does not contain grains

Halal : Halal food is that which adheres to Islamic form of slaughtering (involves killing through a cut to the jugular vein, carotid artery and windpipe). Animals must be alive and healthy at the time of slaughter and all blood is drained from the carcass.

Ketogenic 

Kosher - Meat and milk products are not mixed together, animal products from non-kosher food animals not included, and kosher meat is from animals that are properly slaughtered. Kosher animals are those with cloven (split) hooves who chew their cud (cows, sheep, goats)

legumes : (peanuts, beans, lentils, tofu), refined sugar, processed foods, soda & sweetened beverages, refined vegetable oils, salt, artificial sweeteners
Low fat
Low sodium
Low sugar

Nut-free : Does not contain nuts

Organic : Food that is certified to have grown on soil that had no prohibited substances applied for three years prior to harvest

Paleo : Consists chiefly of meat, fish, vegetables, and fruit, and excludes dairy or grain products and processed food, such as cereal grains,

Sodium-free : Does not contain sodium

Soy-free : Does not contain soy

Sugar-free : Does not contain sugar

Paleo : Consists chiefly of meat, fish, vegetables, and fruit, and excludes dairy or grain products and processed food, such as cereal grains,

Sodium-free : Does not contain sodium

Soy-free : Does not contain soy

Sugar-free : Does not contain sugar

question: What is the definition of a "Kosher" food product?
gold_answer:
A "Kosher" food product is one that meets the following criteria:
- Meat and milk products are not mixed together.
- Animal products from non-kosher food animals are not included.
- Kosher meat comes from animals that are properly slaughtered according to Jewish dietary laws. These animals must have cloven (split) hooves and chew their cud, such as cows, sheep, and goats.

question: What does it mean if a food product is labeled as "gluten-free"?
gold_answer: If a food product is labeled as "gluten-free," it means that the product does not contain gluten, which is typically found in beer, breads, pastas, cakes, and cereals.

gold_docs.page_content:
To meet the Perfect Order Rate criteria, brands must fulfill at least 70% of their orders perfectly. An order will be considered a 'perfect order' if all of the following conditions are met:
The order is shipped within 3 calendar days of your lead time

This timeframe is calculated from the date the order is sent to you, to the date the order closes as Shipped in the system, compared to your shop’s lead time on the date the order was placed.
The entered estimated ship date that the brand adds to accept the order, is not considered in this calculation, and will not affect this calculation negatively or positively.


The order contains no backordered, out-of-stock, or discontinued products
The order is not canceled for a reason within the brand's control
If you change your lead time during the qualification quarter it will not affect the “perfect” status of orders you’ve already fulfilled. The new lead time will only be applied to new orders.

question: How is the timeframe for shipping an order calculated for the Perfect Order Rate criteria?
gold_answer: The timeframe for shipping an order for the Perfect Order Rate criteria is calculated from the date the order is sent to the brand to the date the order's status changes to Shipped in the system, compared to the shop’s lead time on the date the order was placed. The entered estimated ship date that the brand adds when accepting the order is not taken into account in this calculation and does not influence the calculation either negatively or positively.

gold_docs.page_content:
International shipments can be costly. Here are some important key factors and information to consider when shipping your products internationally:
Faire does not support pallet shipping through Ship with Faire

If your products are heavy and/or bulky, selling internationally will automatically result in higher shipping costs. We recommend lowering your order minimum for intercontinental orders. This will help balance the product value / shipping cost ratio. 
We have noticed brands selling heavy and bulky products that have a low to medium price point focus their targeting on more local markets, as the shipping costs associated with selling this type of product internationally does not always allow for margin.
When using Ship with Faire, Faire will be the account holder in relation to the carrier, but you are still the exporter of record. The guidelines and responsibilities detailed in this article still apply.

metadata.subtitle: Managing shipping options and costs
metadata.title: Selling and importing your products into the US

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
If you ship products internationally, and additional information or documentation is required by the country of import for your products, you might be contacted by a customs agent, carrier, or your retailer to provide the necessary information to help clear customs. Here are a few things to keep in mind :  You are the exporter. Ensuring your products can be exported, sold and imported for B2B purposes in other countries falls under your responsibility.
 The retailer is the importer and is responsible for complying with all import rules and regulations when importing goods into their country. The customs agent and/or carrier may reach out to you via phone, or via Faire support on an email thread if you are using Ship with Faire.  Faire cannot provide information or certificates for your products to be exported and imported smoothly. Orders can typically be stalled at a border for a limited time, (this tends to vary between 3 and 5 days) If you are unresponsive, or fail to provide the required information/documentation/certification, the customs agency may decide to abandon, destroy, or return the shipment to sender. This decision is outside of Faire’s control, and is informed by local regulations, depending on the product types and the ability of a carrier to proceed to Return to Sender.  To prevent these situations from arising, we recommend you follow the guidelines outlined in How to determine if your products can be imported and sold in the US, and adjust your selling territories in your shop settings accordingly to your readiness to export.   Shipping methods

Title:  Selling and importing your products into the US
Content:
If you ship products internationally, and additional information or documentation is required by the country of import for your products, you might be contacted by a customs agent, carrier, or your retailer to provide the necessary information to help clear customs. Here are a few things to keep in mind :  You are the exporter. Ensuring your products can be exported, sold and imported for B2B purposes in other countries falls under your responsibility.
 The retailer is the importer and is responsible for complying with all import rules and regulations when importing goods into their country. The customs agent and/or carrier may reach out to you via phone, or via Faire support on an email thread if you are using Ship with Faire.  Faire cannot provide information or certificates for your products to be exported and imported smoothly. Orders can typically be stalled at a border for a limited time, (this tends to vary between 3 and 5 days) If you are unresponsive, or fail to provide the required information/documentation/certification, the customs agency may decide to abandon, destroy, or return the shipment to sender. This decision is outside of Faire’s control, and is informed by local regulations, depending on the product types and the ability of a carrier to proceed to Return to Sender.  To prevent these situations from arising, we recommend you follow the guidelines outlined in How to determine if your products can be imported and sold in the US, and adjust your selling territories in your shop settings accordingly to your readiness to export.   Shipping methods

question: How can I balance the product value and shipping cost ratio when selling heavy and bulky products internationally?
gold_answer: To balance the product value and shipping cost ratio when selling heavy and bulky products internationally, Faire recommends lowering your order minimum for intercontinental orders. This approach can help make the overall cost more appealing to international customers, despite the higher shipping costs associated with heavy and bulky items.

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
If your order is canceled, or you return an entire order, your Faire Protection will end automatically. You can renew it by placing another order with the brand.
Please note: Faire Protection only applies to orders placed on Faire. We cannot guarantee exclusivity in zip codes beyond purchases placed on our site.
Why are retailers from the same zip/postal code able to place orders with my brand?
While Faire Protection allows retailers to lock in exclusivity in their zip/postal code with your brand, there may be times when another retailer will be able to order from you as well. Retailers that have a relationship with a brand from before Faire are still allowed to order with that brand. This could happen if, for example, the retailer referred the brand through our referral program, or the retailer joined Faire with an invitation from the brand, through Faire Direct.
Have questions? Feel free to contact us using the form below!

metadata.title: What is Faire Protection?

question: What is Faire Protection and how does it work?
gold_answer: Faire Protection is a program that brands on the Faire platform are automatically enrolled in, unless they choose to opt-out. The program grants a 90-day exclusivity period to the first retailer who places an order with a brand. This exclusivity pertains to the zip or postal code where the retailer's shop is located. The 90-day period of exclusivity begins from the moment the order is placed by the retailer. However, the countdown of the 90 days starts once the order is confirmed. During this time, no other retailer in the same zip or postal code can place an order with that brand through Faire, providing the original retailer with a temporary exclusive selling advantage in their local area.

metadata.subtitle: Do I need to register my business for VAT?
metadata.title: How does VAT work for Non-E.U. European orders?

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Domestic European shipments:
For any products brands are shipping from within a specific European country to a retailer in that country, Faire will charge the retailer the standard country VAT at checkout for the transaction. This will then be automatically remitted to the brand in their order payout.
Please note: In any case where a brand is shipping goods to retailers domestically, the brand will be required to enter their VAT registration information into their account before they are able to fulfill European orders. You may also add your VAT information in your Account Settings at any time.
International shipments:
For any products a brand ships from outside their European country, VAT charges will not be included at checkout for the retailer. Retailers will be responsible for paying VAT at the border when collecting the goods in addition to any duty. Retailers will be notified of this requirement during checkout.
In these cases, VAT charges will not be remitted to the brand regardless of whether or not the brand is VAT registered. Since VAT is applied to orders based on the ship from address (ie. where the order is fulfilled and shipped to retailers) this will also ensure the retailer is not double charged for taxes.
For more information on VAT implications for your business please consult your tax advisor.

metadata.subtitle: How does VAT work for Non-E.U. European orders?
metadata.title: How does VAT work for Non-E.U. European orders?

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
VAT (value added tax) is a tax that European retailers are required to pay for all purchases for their store. Faire will facilitate this charge and its remittance to brands under certain circumstances, as explained below.
Please note: VAT laws differ for business to business (B2B) and business to consumer (B2C) relationships. All transactions on Faire are B2B transactions. If you have any questions about how to facilitate direct to consumer orders not on Faire, we suggest contacting an advisor to assist with those transactions or the marketplace you are conducting business through.
Do I need to register my business for VAT?
Brands outside of the European country they are transacting with are required to obtain VAT registration for B2B transactions if at least one of the following criteria is met:
Brand has business entity in the European country they are selling to
Brand has fulfillment logistics within the European country they are selling to (ie. warehouse or fulfillment center where you will ship orders from)
Brand plans to ship products to themselves within the European country before fulfilling to their European retailers
If none of the above criteria is met, you do not need to be VAT registered for B2B transactions in that specific country. If you are in Europe, please consult your tax advisor for VAT implications for your business.
How does VAT apply to my orders?
VAT will be applied to your orders based on where the brand is shipping the product from at the point of sale. Please see below to learn more about how Faire will manage domestic and international shipments.
Domestic European shipments:

question: Do brands outside of the European country they are selling to need to register for VAT for B2B transactions?
gold_answer:
Yes, brands outside of the European country they are selling to need to register for VAT for B2B transactions if at least one of the following criteria is met:

1. The brand has a business entity in the European country they are selling to.
2. The brand has fulfillment logistics within the European country they are selling to (i.e., a warehouse or fulfillment center where they will ship orders from).
3. The brand plans to ship products to themselves within the European country before fulfilling to customers.

question: What are the criteria for brands to obtain VAT registration for Non-E.U. European orders?
gold_answer:
According to the document, brands outside of the European country they are transacting with are required to obtain VAT registration for B2B transactions if at least one of the following criteria is met:

1. Brand has a business entity in the European country they are selling to.

gold_docs.page_content:
If your return is being shipped in multiple boxes, please reach out to our team by clicking Contact Us below and our team can provide additional shipping labels.
Returning from the US or Canada
If you're based in the US or Canada, returned items are sent to our warehouse, where they’re thoroughly inspected before being resold at a discounted price on Faire.
Returning from Europe or Australia
If you’re based in Europe or Australia, you are still eligible for free returns on opening orders, but the return process may be different based on your country. Details on this process are explained as you submit a return on Faire.
Submitting a return
If an order is eligible for a free return:
Hover over your Account icon and select Orders & Reviews
Find the order with the items that you want to return, and then select Return Items. You’ll only see this option if your order is eligible to return
Select Start Return
Select the quantity of each item that you want to return and confirm the return total
Select Continue
Shipping a return
To help us process your return:
Carefully inspect and package each return to prevent items from being damaged in transit.
Make sure the items you return are in the same, like-new condition that you received them. If you feel like you have received incorrect or damaged items, please don’t return them. Instead, report them as damaged or missing.
Include the same items and quantities you indicated when submitting the return.
Package individual returns separately, each with its own return label provided by Faire.
Ship returns back by the Ship Return By date on each return label.

metadata.subtitle: How do I submit a return?
metadata.title: How do I submit a return?

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Package individual returns separately, each with its own return label provided by Faire.
Ship returns back by the Ship Return By date on each return label.
If any items that you return are missing or in a condition that prevents us from selling them, you’ll be charged for those items. We’re unable to send back any damaged items that have been returned.
How to submit a return:
Specify your reason for returning the items
Select all of the boxes that apply for your return
Fill out your feedback for the brand
Select your return shipping method
For U.S. retailers, you will automatically have a pickup date set. If this date doesn't work for you, not to worry, you can set your desired date using the calendar dropdown. Returns will be shipped to Faire in the U.S.
For U.K. retailers, you will only have the option to drop off at a FedEx depot. Returns will be shipped to Faire in the U.K.
Once you’ve selected your shipping method, select Continue
Acknowledge & agree to our return policy and select Submit Return.
Your return shipping label will be emailed, but you'll also have the option to print it right away from the return confirmation page.
Please gently package your returns into a sturdy box and prepare it for pickup or drop off. If you did not opt into a pickup please be sure to drop off and ship back the items by the Ship Return By date noted on your return label.
Return metrics
If you've created at least five returns in the last nine months, you may see a dashboard with return metrics during this process.

question: How do I submit a return if I am based in Europe or Australia?
gold_answer:
If you are based in Europe or Australia, you are eligible for free returns on opening orders, but the return process may vary depending on your country. To submit a return from Europe or Australia, you'll need to follow the process explained as you go through the return submission on Faire. Here's a general outline of steps based on the information provided:

1. Hover over your Account icon and select Orders & Reviews.
2. Find the order with the items that you want to return, and then select Return Items. (You will only see this option if your order is eligible for a return.)
3. Select Start Return.
4. Select the quantity of each item that you want to return and confirm the return total.
5. Select Continue.

Details specific to the return process for Europe or Australia will be provided during these steps on Faire's platform.

question: What documents are required for shipping alcohol products from EU to non-EU countries?
gold_answer: For shipping alcohol products from EU to non-EU countries, the Single Administrative Document (SAD) is required. This document acts as a customs declaration and provides proof that the alcohol products are being exported. Brands are responsible for preparing the SAD and including it with the shipment of alcohol products. Additionally, a commercial invoice is needed for shipments between the UK and the EU, or the UK and non-EU countries. Brands need to create their own commercial invoice as Faire does not provide them for alcohol shipments.

metadata.subtitle: How do I share my referral link?
metadata.title: Can I refer brands to Faire?

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Absolutely! If you know of any brands that you’d like to shop on our platform, you can refer them through our referral program—if they join Faire, you may be eligible for a referral bonus.
How do I submit a referral?
To submit a brand referral, go to your Refer Brands page and enter the brand’s email address or website. After you submit the referral, the brand will get an invitation email with your referral link.
How do I track my referrals?
After your first referral is submitted, you’ll see a section on the page where you can track all of your pending referrals. Referred brands will be organized into the Invited, Needs Info, Expiring Soon, Joined, and Waitlisted tabs.
Invited: If a brand you referred appears under this tab, that means we are waiting for the brand to apply to sell on Faire.
Needs info: Any referrals that appear in this tab have not been invited to join Faire yet, because we are missing some information. You can update the missing information for these brands right from this page (for example, add a new valid email address or website).
Expiring soon: Upon referring a brand, all brands will have 12 months to activate their shop on Faire before their referral invitation expires. Any referrals expiring within the next 90 days will appear under this tab. If a referral should expire, you are always able to refer them again.
Joined: Any referrals who join Faire and activate their shop will appear under this tab. You’re welcome to start shopping with any of these brands!

question: Will I receive credit for every brand I refer to Faire?
gold_answer: Yes, you will receive credit for every brand you refer to Faire. However, to receive the credit reward, if you place an order with the brand you referred, the order subtotal must be equal to or greater than the credit amount. You can see the Refer Brands page in your Faire portal for more details on how much credit you are eligible to earn.

gold_docs.page_content:
To prevent these situations from arising, we recommend you follow the guidelines outlined in How to determine if your products can be sold in the UK, and adjust your selling territories in your shop settings accordingly to your readiness to export.
Shipping methods
When shipping an order to the UK, depending on your location and shipping method(s) available, you will have access to:
Ship with Faire
Ship with Faire is currently available to brands in select countries, to learn more visit Ship with Faire
Ship on Your Own
Ship on your Own is not available to all brands
Here are additional resources you can consult to answer shipping related questions:
Ship with Faire Insurance
How do I create a commercial invoice?
How are shipping cost estimates calculated?
Managing shipping options and costs
International shipments can be costly. Here are some important key factors and information to consider when shipping your products internationally:
Faire does not support pallet shipping through Ship with Faire
If your products are heavy and/or bulky, selling internationally will automatically result in higher shipping costs. We recommend lowering your order minimum for intercontinental orders. This will help balance the product value / shipping cost ratio.
We have noticed brands selling heavy and bulky products that have a low to medium price point focus their targeting on more local markets, as the shipping costs associated with selling this type of product internationally does not always allow for margin.
When using Ship with Faire, Faire will be the account holder in relation to the carrier, but you are still the exporter of record. The guidelines and responsibilities detailed in this article still apply.

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
How to determine if your products can be imported and sold in the UK
To determine if your products can be imported sold in the UK, we recommend:
Consulting legal counsel and/or a customs broker to determine your readiness to export products to a given country.
To find out about country specific regulation for tightly controlled categories, consult legal counsel or a customs broker.
Visiting governmental websites and consulting product specific requirements for importing your products into the UK, visit : Check how to import or export goods
As a reminder, your sales territories can be adjusted in your shop settings, to learn more visit Can I control the locations where my shop is live?
Ensuring your products packaging and labelling comply with the destination country requirements. To can check the latest packaging and labelling requirements for importing, visit : Marking, labelling and marketing standards for imports and exports
Visiting carrier websites that have helpful and up-to-date Import/Export Country or Territory Regulations guidelines.
Highly regulated product categories in the UK
Some product categories are tightly regulated in the UK, and may require additional documentation for customs purposes.
The most common categories we have noticed are:
Food and drinks, Food supplements:  to learn more, visit the Rules and regulations for importing food for human consumption to Great Britain (GB).
Products containing animal substances:  to learn more, look for information in the UK government’s import export guide
Cosmetics and skin products : To import cosmetics into the UK, you may register your products with the UK OPSS portal, to learn more, visit guidance on the Office for Product Safety and Standards process
Textile products and clothing:  to learn more, look for information in the UK government’s import export guide

How do I create a commercial invoice?
How are shipping cost estimates calculated?
Managing shipping options and costs
International shipments can be costly. Here are some important key factors and information to consider when shipping your products internationally:
Faire does not support pallet shipping through Ship with Faire
If your products are heavy and/or bulky, selling internationally will automatically result in higher shipping costs. We recommend lowering your order minimum for intercontinental orders. This will help balance the product value / shipping cost ratio.
We have noticed brands selling heavy and bulky products that have a low to medium price point focus their targeting on more local markets, as the shipping costs associated with selling this type of product internationally does not always allow for margin.
When using Ship with Faire, Faire will be the account holder in relation to the carrier, but you are still the exporter of record. The guidelines and responsibilities detailed in this article still apply.

metadata.subtitle: Selling and importing your products into the UK
metadata.title: Selling and importing your products into the UK

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
How to determine if your products can be imported and sold in the UK
To determine if your products can be imported sold in the UK, we recommend:
Consulting legal counsel and/or a customs broker to determine your readiness to export products to a given country.
To find out about country specific regulation for tightly controlled categories, consult legal counsel or a customs broker.
Visiting governmental websites and consulting product specific requirements for importing your products into the UK, visit : Check how to import or export goods
As a reminder, your sales territories can be adjusted in your shop settings, to learn more visit Can I control the locations where my shop is live?
Ensuring your products packaging and labelling comply with the destination country requirements. To can check the latest packaging and labelling requirements for importing, visit : Marking, labelling and marketing standards for imports and exports
Visiting carrier websites that have helpful and up-to-date Import/Export Country or Territory Regulations guidelines.
Highly regulated product categories in the UK
Some product categories are tightly regulated in the UK, and may require additional documentation for customs purposes.
The most common categories we have noticed are:
Food and drinks, Food supplements:  to learn more, visit the Rules and regulations for importing food for human consumption to Great Britain (GB).
Products containing animal substances:  to learn more, look for information in the UK government’s import export guide
Cosmetics and skin products : To import cosmetics into the UK, you may register your products with the UK OPSS portal, to learn more, visit guidance on the Office for Product Safety and Standards process
Textile products and clothing:  to learn more, look for information in the UK government’s import export guide

Fragrance Family
Perfume-specific fragrance family.
Citrus : The citrus fragrance family is characterized by fresh, zesty, and bright scents that are reminiscent of citrus fruits such as lemons, oranges, grapefruits, and bergamots.
Earthy & Woody : Earthy & Woody fragrances are characterized by their warm, rich, and natural aromas that evoke the smells of the forest, the earth, and the outdoors. Common notes found in earthy and woody fragrances include cedarwood, sandalwood, patchouli, vetiver, oakmoss, and musk, as well as spices and herbs such as cinnamon, cloves, and sage.
Floral : The floral fragrance family is characterized by floral and botanical notes, which evoke the smells of various flowers such as rose, jasmine, lily, and violet.
Fresh : The fresh fragrance family is characterized by clean, crisp, and invigorating qualities, which evoke the smell of fresh air, water, and nature. Common notes found in fresh fragrances include lemon, lime, bergamot, grapefruit, mint, lavender, and marine notes, as well as green and earthy notes.

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Non-GMO : Non-GMO products are products that are free from genetically modified organisms (GMOs), which are living organisms whose genetic material has been altered in a way that does not occur naturally through mating or natural recombination.
Oil-Free : Oil-free products do not contain any oils or oil-based ingredients. These products are often designed for individuals with oily or acne-prone skin, as oils can contribute to the formation of blackheads and pimples. Oil-free products may contain alternative ingredients that provide moisture or hydration without adding oil, such as water-based ingredients or humectants.
Paraben-Free : Paraben-free products do not contain parabens, a type of preservative that is commonly used in cosmetics to prevent the growth of bacteria and mold.
Phthalate-Free : Phthalate-free products do not contain phthalates, a group of chemicals that are used as plasticizers and fragrance fixatives in many consumer products.
SPF : SPF (Sun Protection Factor) products are cosmetic or personal care products that are formulated to help protect the skin from the harmful effects of the sun's UV radiation.
Sulfate-Free : Sulfate-free products do not contain sulfates, which are a group of surfactants commonly used in many cleaning and foaming products, such as shampoos, body washes, and toothpaste. Sulfates can be harsh and drying, particularly for individuals with sensitive or dry skin. These products are often marketed as gentle and suitable for individuals with sensitive skin or certain hair types.

A prepack is a fixed bundle in a set size run.
A prepack ratio is mandatory (ex: S-M-L;2-2-2, S-M-L-XL;1-2-2-1). To learn more, visit How to create a prepack.
Is it an open pack?
Open sizing is a per style minimum order quantity that allows retailers to choose how many units of each size they want to purchase. To learn more, visit How to create an open pack.
Is it a preorder?
A preorder is an order placed for an item not yet in stock that will ship at a later date.
A ship-by date or date range is mandatory. To learn more, visit Preorders.

metadata.subtitle: Uploading your product catalog
metadata.title: Uploading your product catalog

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
This article is for brands that request Faire’s help building their shop at onboarding. (To request Faire's help, navigate to the Products tab of your brand portal, click the Add Products button at the top right of the page, then select the Upload a spreadsheet or export option.)
We encourage you to use our Faire catalog template or a catalog export from Shopify, Etsy, WooCommerce, Prestashop, or Wix. A comprehensive and clear catalog will ensure that your page is built to your expectations and will avoid any potential delays in the onboarding process. Find instructions for all options below.
Please note that we will only be able to build your shop if all mandatory information is provided:
Product name
Product description
Wholesale price
Retail price
Case quantity and minimum order quantity
Images (links or JPG or PNG files if you are planning to share an image folder)
Product option details (if applicable)
Option 1: Upload a CSV export
Please be sure to add wholesale pricing to the file or include wholesale pricing instructions in your notes to the team. (Ex: "Wholesale prices are 50% of retail prices.")
Shopify (Help Center)
Sign in to your Shopify account.
From your Shopify admin, go to Products > All products.
Click Export.
From the dialog box, choose the products you want to export.
Select CSV or Excel file type.

question: Can I place an order for an item that is not yet in stock and have it shipped at a later date?
gold_answer: Yes, you can place a preorder for an item not yet in stock, and it will ship at a later date. A ship-by date or date range is mandatory for preorders. To learn more, you can visit the section about Preorders in the provided documentation.

question: What is a prepack ratio and is it mandatory to include in the product catalog?
gold_answer: A prepack ratio is mandatory and refers to a fixed bundle in a set size run. It indicates the number of units of each size that are included in the prepack. An example of a prepack ratio provided in the document is S-M-L;2-2-2 or S-M-L-XL;1-2-2-1, signifying how many of each size (Small, Medium, Large, Extra Large) are contained in the bundle. It is necessary to include this information in the product catalog. To learn more about creating a prepack, one can visit the "How to create a prepack" section mentioned in the documentation.

metadata.title: How often can I update content?

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Cover + Profile Image
You can easily upload both images yourself, as often as you like, in your portal by going to Marketplace > Shop Page. There you will have the ability to add your desired image, which will be updated instantly.
To change your cover image, select the “Edit image” option. To change your profile image, hover over the profile image and you will be prompted to upload a new one. You can then view how the image looks by clicking the “View Shop” button.
When submitting your new cover photo, please use a high-res image and reference the following article: Cover image guidelines
Please keep in mind that your cover image must follow these required guidelines:
No logos or text
No photo collages
No products with inappropriate language
No nudity
Our design team conducts regular audits of images uploaded, and those that do not follow these guidelines will be removed from your brand page and a new image will need to be uploaded.
Feature image
If you’d like to request a new feature image, you can do so in your portal by going to Marketplace > Shop Page.
Please note, your feature image must:
Be high-resolution (minimum 500 x 500 pixels)
Be a lifestyle shot of a product in use (i.e. a cheese knife with cheese on a cutting board)
Not include any words, watermarks, or logos
For more details, see our article here: Feature image guidelines

gold_docs.page_content:
How do I get paid out?
Faire offers two different payout options:
Adyen payouts
ACH payouts
Your payout option will be determined by where you are located.
Adyen Payouts
Brand payouts on Faire will require you to provide a U.S.-based routing number and account number so that funds can be transferred via ACH deposit according to your payout terms. Faire also uses Adyen in select countries, to allow brands to connect their local bank account to their Faire account.
If you are based in Europe, please see our article European Brand Payouts to determine if Adyen is available in your country. If your country is not listed in this article, you can continue with the steps listed under ACH Payouts below.
Brands based in Australia are required to set up payouts through Adyen to be paid in AUD funds. You can read more about Australian payouts in this article.
ACH Payouts
If your country is not eligible for Adyen payouts, you will be paid in USD funds via an ACH deposit. You may use the provider of your choosing to obtain a U.S. routing number and account number. We recommend using OFX. Once you sign up, you will be able to obtain a U.S. routing number and account number through their service. If you are not interested in setting up an account with OFX, you may also look into other similar services or set up a U.S.-based bank account if you have a U.S. entity.

metadata.title: How much does it cost to sell on Faire if I’m based outside of North America?

hard_neg_docs.page_content: The standard commission rate for reorders orders from the Faire marketplace is 15%. When a customer first discovers you on Faire’s marketplace, we charge brands outside of North America a one-time referral fee of 10%, on top of the standard 15% commission rate. This means that the opening order rate of 25% only applies to the first order from a new customer—future reorders will be at the 15% rate. An order is considered a reorder

question: How can I get paid if I'm based outside of North America?
gold_answer:
If you are based outside of North America, you can get paid through either Adyen payouts or ACH payouts, depending on your location.

- **Adyen Payouts**: If you are in Europe, you should check the article "European Brand Payouts" to see if Adyen is available in your country. If it is available, you can connect your local bank account to your Faire account through Adyen. If you are based in Australia, you are required to set up payouts through Adyen to be paid in AUD funds.

- **ACH Payouts**: If your country is not eligible for Adyen payouts, you will be paid in USD funds via an ACH deposit. To do this, you need to obtain a U.S. routing number and account number, either by using a service provider like OFX or by looking into similar services. Alternatively, if you have a U.S. entity, you can set up a U.S.-based bank account to receive payments.

gold_docs.page_content:
How do I get paid out?
Faire offers two different payout options:
Adyen payouts
ACH payouts
Your payout option will be determined by where you are located.
Adyen Payouts
Brand payouts on Faire will require you to provide a U.S.-based routing number and account number so that funds can be transferred via ACH deposit according to your payout terms. Faire also uses Adyen in select countries, to allow brands to connect their local bank account to their Faire account.
If you are based in Europe, please see our article European Brand Payouts to determine if Adyen is available in your country. If your country is not listed in this article, you can continue with the steps listed under ACH Payouts below.
Brands based in Australia are required to set up payouts through Adyen to be paid in AUD funds. You can read more about Australian payouts in this article.
ACH Payouts
If your country is not eligible for Adyen payouts, you will be paid in USD funds via an ACH deposit. You may use the provider of your choosing to obtain a U.S. routing number and account number. We recommend using OFX. Once you sign up, you will be able to obtain a U.S. routing number and account number through their service. If you are not interested in setting up an account with OFX, you may also look into other similar services or set up a U.S.-based bank account if you have a U.S. entity.

metadata.title: How much does it cost to sell on Faire if I’m based outside of North America?

hard_neg_docs.page_content: The standard commission rate for reorders orders from the Faire marketplace is 15%. When a customer first discovers you on Faire’s marketplace, we charge brands outside of North America a one-time referral fee of 10%, on top of the standard 15% commission rate. This means that the opening order rate of 25% only applies to the first order from a new customer—future reorders will be at the 15% rate. An order is considered a reorder

metadata.subtitle: When and how is this promotion ending?
metadata.title: Latest update to the Free Shipping and Import Duties promotion for EU orders placed by US retailers

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Over the past year, we’ve been running a limited-time free shipping and import duties promotion on all European brands (EU and UK) to help make it easier for you to stock your store with European products.
As of September 26th, we shared that this promotion only applied to reorders only and would run through the end of 2022. At this time, the final date for reorder shipping coverage within this promotion is January 4, 2023 at 11:59pm PST.
When and how is this promotion ending?
The reorder shipping and duties promotion will keep applying for European brands you’ve previously ordered from (prior to September 26th), until January 4th 2023 at 11:59pm PST.For first orders with European brands, you’ll see your estimated shipping and any applicable duties costs at checkout.
Please note, as per our previous update, if you had a canceled order from a European brand, they will not count as a brand you’ve previously ordered from, and the reorder promotion will not apply.
How can I continue receiving shipping incentives from European brands ?
We are rolling out a program for our European brands, which will grant free shipping on select orders to Insiders. Being an Insider will grant you free shipping on select domestic orders, as well as select European orders. To learn more about the Insider program, visit How does Insider work for US retailers?

Source: https://www.faire.com/support/articles/8374082483227

question: How does the partnership program help European brands get discovered by US Insider retailers and encourage them to place orders?
gold_answer: The partnership program helps European brands get discovered by US Insider retailers and encourages them to place orders by offering free shipping and import duties. The program covers 50% of the total shipping costs and handles the rest of the reimbursable shipping costs, as well as 100% of the import duties on eligible orders on behalf of the retailers. This reduces the financial burden on retailers when ordering from European brands, making it more appealing for them to confidently place orders with these brands.

question: What is the Insider Free Shipping Partnership Program for European brands and what does it offer?
gold_answer: The Insider Free Shipping Partnership Program for European brands is a program that helps European brands get discovered by US Insider retailers. It offers to cover 50% of the total shipping costs, with the remaining reimbursable shipping costs handled by the program. Additionally, the program covers 100% of the import duties on eligible orders on behalf of the retailers. The goal of the program is to encourage US Insider retailers to confidently place orders with European brands by offering free shipping and import duties.

metadata.subtitle: Commercial invoice
metadata.title: Shipping an order

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Once you've accepted an order, you’ll need to fill out the order’s shipping details. When fulfilling the order, depending on your location and shipping method(s) available, you will be prompted to select your shipping method.
Ship with Faire You pay $0 shipping costs upfront and receive low carrier rates. Faire covers the cost, which is then added to the retailer's invoice for orders where the retailer is responsible for covering shipping costs (this excludes free shipping promotions). Please note that Ship with Faire is currently available to brands in select countries, to learn more, Learn More
Ship on your own  This method allows you to use your own carrier to ship orders, and we’ll reimburse the shipping cost on your payout up to an approved amount for those orders. You’ll enter the shipping cost and tracking number on the order page once it's available. Your shipping costs  (note that the reimbursement total may be capped) will be reimbursed by Faire on your payout, and be added to the retailer's invoice for orders where the retailer is responsible for covering shipping costs (this excludes free shipping promotions). Learn More
To ship your order:
Enter the date you anticipate being able to ship out the order.
Confirm your Ship From Address if you haven’t entered it on a previous order. You only have to enter this one time— it will autofill for future orders.
Depending on your location and shipping method(s) available, choose Ship with Faire or Ship on your own.

question: What should I do if the products I am shipping require longer tariff codes?
gold_answer: If the products you are shipping require longer tariff codes than the 6 digits supported by the Faire generated commercial invoice, it is recommended that you create your own commercial invoice to accommodate the longer tariff codes.

For every international order, Faire generates a standard commercial invoice, populated with the product information in your account. hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Once you've accepted an order, you’ll need to fill out the order’s shipping details. When fulfilling the order, depending on your location and shipping method(s) available, you will be prompted to select your shipping method.
Ship with Faire You pay $0 shipping costs upfront and receive low carrier rates. Faire covers the cost, which is then added to the retailer's invoice for orders where the retailer is responsible for covering shipping costs (this excludes free shipping promotions). Please note that Ship with Faire is currently available to brands in select countries, to learn more, Learn More
Ship on your own  This method allows you to use your own carrier to ship orders, and we’ll reimburse the shipping cost on your payout up to an approved amount for those orders. You’ll enter the shipping cost and tracking number on the order page once it's available. Your shipping costs  (note that the reimbursement total may be capped) will be reimbursed by Faire on your payout, and be added to the retailer's invoice for orders where the retailer is responsible for covering shipping costs (this excludes free shipping promotions). Learn More
To ship your order:
Enter the date you anticipate being able to ship out the order.
Confirm your Ship From Address if you haven’t entered it on a previous order. You only have to enter this one time— it will autofill for future orders.
Depending on your location and shipping method(s) available, choose Ship with Faire or Ship on your own.

gold_docs.page_content:
Alcohol is now available on Faire if you are a retailer based in one of the following countries:
Austria
Belgium
Denmark
France
Germany
Ireland
Italy
Luxembourg
Portugal
Netherlands
Norway
Spain
Sweden
Switzerland
The UK
(excluding Crown dependencies: Guernsey, Jersey, The Isle of Man, and the British Virgin Islands, as well as British Overseas Territories such as Gibraltar)
Additional requirements apply for UK retailers, to learn more click here.
We look forward to launching in additional countries soon.
Where do I find alcohol products?
You will find alcohol products under the category navigation for “Food & Drink”, with a new sub-category called “Wine, Beer and Spirits”.
What do I need to do before ordering?
You are responsible for following the entry requirements for alcohol in your country.Generally, importing alcohol from another country requires notifying customs ahead of time. For specific requirements for bringing alcohol into your country, please consult your tax advisor or customs broker.
Why can’t I see alcohol products?
We are currently understanding what is most valuable in this category for our retailers in Austria, Belgium, Denmark, France, Germany, Ireland, Italy, Luxembourg, Portugal, Netherlands, Norway, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland and the UK.
If you are located in a different country, at this time alcohol will not be available. We will continue to make improvements and look forward to expanding the sale of alcohol to other countries in the future.
Additional UK specific requirements
