question: Can I buy alcohol products on Faire if I am based in the United Kingdom?
gold_answer: Yes, you can buy alcohol products on Faire if you are based in the United Kingdom, but additional requirements apply for UK retailers. To learn more about these additional requirements, you are directed to click a link provided in the original document for further information. However, it's important to note that the availability excludes Crown dependencies such as Guernsey, Jersey, The Isle of Man, and the British Virgin Islands, as well as British Overseas Territories such as Gibraltar.

gold_docs.page_content:
Once you are on the new order page, you can write an order that will be sent to the retailer for approval. Start by completing the following sections:  
Customer details: If the customer details have not been pre-populated, search for the customer using their store name, first or last name or email address of the retailer. If there is no result found for the retailer you are wanting to write an order for, click 'Add New Customer’ to fill in their details.
   
Order details: Once you’ve added the customer details, you can build out the order. If you would like to add an item that is listed on Faire, begin typing the SKU or name of the product in the search field and click to add it to the order. Once the product is added, you will be able to adjust the quantity however you’d like—you can even break case packs!


Custom item: There is also the option to add items that are custom, or not on Faire, such as displays. To add a custom item, click the ‘+ Custom Item’ link next to the product search field. You will then be able to name the item and set the price and quantity that will be added to the order. This is useful for samples, testers or any products you have not listed on Faire.

question: How can I add custom items to an order that are not listed on Faire?
gold_answer: To add custom items to an order that are not listed on Faire, you should click the ‘+ Custom Item’ link next to the product search field. Once you click this link, you will be able to name the item, set the price, and specify the quantity that will be added to the order. This feature is useful for including items such as samples, testers, or any products that you have not listed on Faire.

gold_docs.page_content:
Document type
Faire provided
Brand provided

 Faire does not provide documentation specific to your products, your company, manufacturing practices or information. This type of documentation has to be provided by yourself as the exporter of record.    For every international order, Faire generates a commercial invoice, populated with the product information in your account.  Please note, depending on the products, additional fields might be required on the commercial invoice; or longer tariff codes (visit Updating your product information for international sales) in this case, we recommend you create your own commercial invoice. metadata.subtitle: Documentation for international shipments
metadata.title: A guide to selling internationally on Faire

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
As the exporter of record, any brand selling on Faire is responsible for complying with all laws, rules, and regulations in all countries/regions they choose to sell their products to on the platform. This includes but is not limited to: product safety, labelling requirements, testing, warnings, copyright, import/export regulations, and other consumer protection law requirements. To determine if your products can be sold in other countries, we recommend: Consulting legal counsel and/or a customs broker to determine your readiness to export products to a given country. Visiting governmental websites for each country you sell your products to on Faire. As a reminder, your sales territories can be adjusted in your shop settings, to learn more visit Can I control the locations where my shop is live?
 Looking into potential restrictions enforced by the country you want to sell to, based on the country of manufacturing of your products. (Certain countries have additional documentation requirements for import, depending on the country of manufacture of goods) To learn more about shipping to a specific country or region, consult the different resources in Country and region specific information.
 Visiting carrier websites that have helpful and up-to-date Import/Export Country or Territory Regulations guidelines.   Country and region specific information

Title: A guide to selling internationally on Faire
Content:
As the exporter of record, any brand selling on Faire is responsible for complying with all laws, rules, and regulations in all countries/regions they choose to sell their products to on the platform. This includes but is not limited to: product safety, labelling requirements, testing, warnings, copyright, import/export regulations, and other consumer protection law requirements. To determine if your products can be sold in other countries, we recommend: Consulting legal counsel and/or a customs broker to determine your readiness to export products to a given country. Visiting governmental websites for each country you sell your products to on Faire. As a reminder, your sales territories can be adjusted in your shop settings, to learn more visit Can I control the locations where my shop is live?
 Looking into potential restrictions enforced by the country you want to sell to, based on the country of manufacturing of your products. (Certain countries have additional documentation requirements for import, depending on the country of manufacture of goods) To learn more about shipping to a specific country or region, consult the different resources in Country and region specific information.
 Visiting carrier websites that have helpful and up-to-date Import/Export Country or Territory Regulations guidelines.   Country and region specific information

metadata.title: How does VAT work for E.U. orders?

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
*You are responsible for determining if you need to be VAT registered in each country you sell your products. Please consult your tax advisor for VAT implications for your business.
How does VAT apply to my orders?
VAT will be applied to your orders based on where you (the brand) are shipping the products from at the point of sale. There are three different types of orders you may receive on Faire:
Domestic orders: Supply of goods from a brand in one E.U. member state to a retailer in the same E.U. member state. See example:
Brand ships goods from the Netherlands to a retailer in the Netherlands
Intra-Community Supply: Supply of goods by a brand from one E.U. Member State to a VAT registered retailer in another E.U. member state. For a full list of E.U. member states, you may reference this article on the European Union’s official website. See example:
Brand ships goods from Italy to a retailer in Netherlands
International order: Supply of goods from a brand outside of the E.U. to a retailer in an E.U. Member State. See examples:
Brand ships goods from U.S. to a retailer in the Netherlands
Brand ships goods from India to a retailer in the Netherlands
Brand ships goods from U.K. to a retailer in the Netherlands (U.K. is no longer an E.U. member state due to Brexit)
Please see below to learn more about how Faire will manage these different shipments. We also recommend checking your “Ship From” address before fulfilling orders. You can review this on each order details page and adjust accordingly.
hard_neg_docs.fmt_content:
Source: https://www.faire.com/support/articles/360057747911

VAT will be applied to your orders based on where you (the brand) are shipping the products from at the point of sale. There are three different types of orders you may receive on Faire:

metadata.subtitle: How does VAT work for E.U. orders?
metadata.title: How does VAT work for E.U. orders?

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Please see below to learn more about how Faire will manage these different shipments. We also recommend checking your “Ship From” address before fulfilling orders. You can review this on each order details page and adjust accordingly.
Please note: If you are fulfilling orders from the E.U. to a non-E.U. retailer, Faire will not collect VAT. These retailers will be charged customs and duty at the border.
Domestic shipments:
For any products that brands are shipping domestically, as long as the brand is VAT registered, Faire will collect VAT from the retailer at checkout and then remit this VAT payment to the brand as part of their order payout. The standard VAT rate of the retailer’s country will be added to the invoice.
If the brand, however, is located in another E.U. country but shipping the products from the same country as the retailer, Faire will check to see if the retailer’s country allows for reverse charge. If the retailer’s country allows for the reverse charge mechanism, Faire will not collect any VAT on the order and indicate on the invoice that no VAT was collected due to reverse charge. It will then be the brand and retailer’s responsibility to complete the reverse charge on their VAT invoice.If the retailer’s country does not allow for the reverse charge mechanism, Faire will collect VAT at checkout and remit this VAT to the brand as part of their order payout.

question: What are the criteria for a brand to obtain VAT registration in E.U. countries for B2B transactions?
gold_answer:
A brand is required to obtain VAT registration in E.U. countries for B2B transactions if at least one of the following criteria is met:

1. The brand has a business entity in the E.U. member country.
2. The brand has fulfillment logistics within an E.U. member country, such as a warehouse or fulfillment center from which they will ship orders.
3. The brand plans to ship products to themselves within the E.U. before fulfilling orders to E.U. retailers.

metadata.title: Shipping an order

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Once you've accepted an order, you’ll need to fill out the order’s shipping details. When fulfilling the order, depending on your location and shipping method(s) available, you will be prompted to select your shipping method.
Ship with Faire You pay $0 shipping costs upfront and receive low carrier rates. Faire covers the cost, which is then added to the retailer's invoice for orders where the retailer is responsible for covering shipping costs (this excludes free shipping promotions). Please note that Ship with Faire is currently available to brands in select countries, to learn more, Learn More
Ship on your own  This method allows you to use your own carrier to ship orders, and we’ll reimburse the shipping cost on your payout up to an approved amount for those orders. You’ll enter the shipping cost and tracking number on the order page once it's available. Your shipping costs  (note that the reimbursement total may be capped) will be reimbursed by Faire on your payout, and be added to the retailer's invoice for orders where the retailer is responsible for covering shipping costs (this excludes free shipping promotions). Learn More
To ship your order:
Enter the date you anticipate being able to ship out the order.
Confirm your Ship From Address if you haven’t entered it on a previous order. You only have to enter this one time— it will autofill for future orders.
Depending on your location and shipping method(s) available, choose Ship with Faire or Ship on your own.

question: How do I print packing slips for multiple orders?
gold_answer:
To print packing slips for multiple orders, follow these steps:

1. Go to the Orders section.
2. Select the orders for which you would like to print packing slips.
3. Select "Print Packing Slips" to open the packing slips in a new tab.
4. Choose the option to Print or Save as PDF.

If you choose to save the packing slips as a PDF, they will be compiled into a single PDF file. However, each packing slip will be formatted to print on an individual sheet of paper.

question: How can I save the packing slips as a PDF file?
gold_answer:
To save the packing slips as a PDF file, follow these steps:

1. Go to Orders and select the orders for which you would like to print packing slips.
2. Select "Print Packing Slips" to open the packing slips in a new tab.
3. Select "Save as PDF."

Once you save the packing slips as a PDF, they’ll appear in a single PDF file, with each packing slip ready to print on an individual sheet of paper.

How do updates to my tax information impact my current and future tax forms?
If updates are made after January 31st, 2022, they will be applied to all future tax forms only. If you need to update tax information for earlier years, please Contact Faire Support.
Thank you for your cooperation on this required documentation. For any Privacy questions, please see our privacy policy here.

metadata.title: Setting up tax information

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Finally, let us know how you'd like to receive your tax forms. Selecting ‘Electronically’ will allow you to download the copies from your Faire portal. If you choose ‘By Mail’, you will be sent a physical copy of your form to the address listed in your portal. Feel free to choose both!
How do I update my tax information?
You’re able to update your tax information from the Export & Taxes tab under Account Settings in your brand portal.
From here, you’re able to update the following information:
Legal Brand Name: Your legal brand name should be associated with the TIN that you provide. Generally speaking, you’ll use your business name if an EIN was provided, and your personal name if a SSN was provided.
Legal Address: This address will be printed on your tax form and it is where your form will be mailed, if you’ve selected mail delivery.
Tax Identification Number (TIN): This can be either your EIN or SSN - just be sure that the TIN you report is associated with the legal brand name you provide.
Delivery preferences: Selecting ‘Electronically’ will allow you to download your tax forms directly from your Faire portal. If you choose ‘By Mail’, you will be sent a physical copy of your form to the address listed in your portal. Feel free to choose both!
Why do we recommend going paperless?
You get your form as soon as we generate it. No delays. No headaches.
You have the freedom to access it whenever you want.
Save the trees!
How do updates to my tax information impact my current and future tax forms?

You’re able to update your tax information from the Export & Taxes tab under Account Settings in your brand portal.
From here, you’re able to update the following information:
Legal Brand Name: Your legal brand name should be associated with the TIN that you provide. Generally speaking, you’ll use your business name if an EIN was provided, and your personal name if a SSN was provided.
Legal Address: This address will be printed on your tax form and it is where your form will be mailed, if you’ve selected mail delivery.
Tax Identification Number (TIN): This can be either your EIN or SSN - just be sure that the TIN you report is associated with the legal brand name you provide.
Delivery preferences: Selecting ‘Electronically’ will allow you to download your tax forms directly from your Faire portal. If you choose ‘By Mail’, you will be sent a physical copy of your form to the address listed in your portal. Feel free to choose both!
Why do we recommend going paperless?
You get your form as soon as we generate it. No delays. No headaches.
You have the freedom to access it whenever you want.
Save the trees!
How do updates to my tax information impact my current and future tax forms?

gold_docs.page_content:
Return rate: Most of the retailers are happy with what they receive and don’t return your products
Order cancellations: You fulfill order requests timely and rarely cancel a few from time to time
Order fulfillment timing: You often get orders fulfilled quickly with just the occasional delay
This being said, we understand that the occasional bad review, order cancellation, or product return is going to happen, and is a normal part of doing business, so a few negative actions have very little impact on your ranking. For these actions, we’re weighting ranking based on broad patterns over weeks and months, not on individual actions.
How can I improve my ranking?
Here are some tips on how you can improve your product ranking on Faire. You'll notice that most of these tips are focused around increasing your product sell through and conversion rate. This is because how your products perform on Faire is the most important factor in determining your product ranking. Please keep this in mind while you explore these tips!
Opportunities to improve your product and brand ranking
Use concise and detailed product titles and descriptions as well as tag accurate product types that describe your products. Include any unique characteristics about the product.
For example, French Vanilla Votive Candles is a better title than Vanilla Candles
Provide a detailed description of the product that includes all of the relevant information that you think a retailer would want to know before purchasing. Include key descriptive words and characteristics that you would like to highlight.
Maintain high-quality pictures that are high resolution and accurately depict your products. This will lead to higher conversion rates, which ultimately contributes to higher ranking.
Optimize your pricing and run specials to drive more interest to your products.
Maintain low minimums, bearing in mind two factors:

metadata.title: Understanding Search and Ranking on Faire

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Optimize your pricing and run specials to drive more interest to your products.
Maintain low minimums, bearing in mind two factors:
- Your profit margin
- The shipping costs your retailers may get charged
Retailers will often filter search results by minimum prices, we recommend keeping minimums at $200 or lower for your local customers to ensure your products get the most visibility.
For international customers, we recommend setting minimums considering factors such as shipping distance and shipping cost to ensure the best value and experience for retailers.
You can set specific order minimums for different countries, by ticking Set specific minimums for countries in your shop settings.
Adopt Faire Direct tools by utilizing the widget on your website or by sharing your link with existing retail partners. This can increase your sales and conversion on Faire, which can boost your ranking.
Ensure that your complete catalog of products is listed on Faire. This contributes to a positive retailer experience and can increase your conversion, which can boost your ranking.
Offer high-quality customer service to your Faire retailers by: getting back to customer inquiries quickly in the Faire Messenger, keeping lead times and delivery times down, working with retailers to resolve negative reviews, keeping order cancellations down, and delivering quality products that arrive as expected.
Do returns impact my ranking?

question: How does Faire determine the ranking of products on their platform?
gold_answer: Faire determines the ranking of products on their platform based on how the products perform on the site, with a focus on product sell-through and conversion rate. They look at broad patterns over time, including return rate, order cancellations, and order fulfillment timing. A few negative actions, like bad reviews, order cancellations, or product returns, have very little impact on ranking as long as they are not part of a consistent pattern. Instead, Faire weights ranking based on overall trends observed over weeks and months.

question: What are some tips for improving product ranking on Faire?
gold_answer:
To improve your product ranking on Faire, you can consider the following tips:

1. Use concise and detailed product titles and descriptions, ensuring that you tag accurate product types that describe your products well. It is beneficial to include any unique characteristics about the product. For instance, "French Vanilla Votive Candles" is a more effective title than just "Vanilla Candles."

2. Provide a detailed product description that includes all relevant information a retailer might want to know before making a purchase. Make sure to incorporate key descriptive words and characteristics that you want to emphasize.

3. Maintain high-quality pictures that are high resolution and accurately depict your products. Good quality images can lead to higher conversion rates, which in turn contributes to a higher ranking.

4. Optimize your pricing and consider running specials to generate more interest in your products.

5. Keep minimum order quantities low, taking into account the balance between accessibility to retailers and maintaining your profitability.

It's important to note that these tips are aimed at increasing product sell-through and conversion rate, as these performance metrics are crucial in determining your product ranking on Faire.

metadata.subtitle: Where do I add a promo code to my order?
metadata.title: How do I apply a promo code to my order?

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Some brands can create custom promo codes that they can personally share with their retailers to apply to their order with that brand on Faire. Each promo code can be used one time, on a single order.
Only one promo code can be applied to an order at a time. However, promo codes can stack with other shop-wide promotions, product-specific promotions that the brand is running at the same time, and any Faire-funded promotions that your order qualifies for.
Promo codes are a beta feature. This functionality isn’t currently available to all of our brands. We look forward to bringing this feature to more of our brands very soon.
Where do I add a promo code to my order?
Brand promo codes can be applied at checkout from desktop or the Faire mobile app. To add a promo code to your order, enter the promo code in the form field titled Promo code below the Order summary, and then click Apply.
If the promo code is applied successfully, you will see the promo code discount listed in the Order summary as well as added below the Promo code form field.
To remove the applied promo code, click Remove to the right of the promo code listed below the Promo code form field.

From desktop:
Why wasn’t the promo code applied to my order?
When a promo code is unable to be applied to your order, you will see an error message explaining the reason why the code is invalid.

Brand promo codes can be applied at checkout from desktop or the Faire mobile app. To add a promo code to your order, enter the promo code in the form field titled Promo code below the Order summary, and then click Apply.
If the promo code is applied successfully, you will see the promo code discount listed in the Order summary as well as added below the Promo code form field.
To remove the applied promo code, click Remove to the right of the promo code listed below the Promo code form field.

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
tariff code finder if you ship from the US
tariff code finder if you ship from the EU
tariff code finder if you ship from the UK
Please note: The Faire generated commercial invoice only supports 6 digit tariff codes, if the products you are shipping require longer tariff codes, we recommend you create your own commercial invoice to ensure import duties are applied correctly for your retailer.
If the Faire generated Commercial invoice is suitable for your products and your shipment:
Click on the Print Commercial Invoice to print three (3) copies of the commercial invoice. Provide a signature on each copy you print.
#1 copy goes inside the package
#2 copy goes on the outside contained within the airbill pouch with the shipping label
#3 copy is provided to the carrier directly
Please note: Retailers may also reach out to provide their brokerage information for importing. If a retailer provides this, please include this on the commercial invoice as well. The carrier will reach out to the parties listed on the commercial invoice if any information is missing upon import.
Package Insurance
If you’re using the ship on your own option, please note that you’re responsible for filing an insurance claim with the carrier for any issues that occur in transit. This includes any damages an item incurs in transit and any lost or stolen packages.

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Under Shipping Info, click Edit and enter the correct information
If more than (1) tracking number has been added, the ability to delete and edit the info for each package becomes available
Splitting an order
If the order is going in separate shipments, for example shipping from two different locations or with two different carriers, you should split the order so that the tracking information correctly updates and products aren’t mistakenly reported as missing. Learn more about splitting orders.
Commercial invoices
Orders shipping internationally will require a commercial invoice upon import. For every international order, Faire generates a commercial invoice, populated with the product information in your account. (This includes HS or tariff codes, weight, value of the goods, country of origin and other details.)
Please note, depending on the products you are shipping and the requirements specific to the country, or product type, additional fields might be required on the commercial invoice; or longer tariff codes in this case, we recommend you create your own commercial invoice, and request a template from the carrier you are shipping with.
Harmonized system (HS) codes (or tariffs) are an international customs classification system used by most trading nations throughout the world. Tariff codes will be required on any cross-border commercial invoices. These are universal codes, you can use any tariff code finder.
We have listed a few international tariff code finders below:
tariff code finder if you ship from the US
tariff code finder if you ship from the EU
tariff code finder if you ship from the UK

question: How can I ensure that the tracking information for my order is accurate and that products are not reported as missing?
gold_answer: To ensure that the tracking information for your order is accurate and that products are not reported as missing, you should split the order if it is going in separate shipments, such as when shipping from two different locations or with two different carriers. This will allow the tracking information to correctly update for each shipment.

gold_docs.page_content:
For any invoices that were paid prior to July 2022, the original USD invoices will now show as CAD in your portal. Since they were charged in USD, you will see the USD value in the “Charges” section of your invoice, but the rest of the invoice will show CAD. 


Please note that individual banks and/or credit card companies may charge their own conversion fees or utilize a different exchange rate, so there may be a discrepancy between the amount that was charged to your account and what you see on your invoice.

metadata.subtitle: What about invoices that were paid in USD?
metadata.title: Changes to Canadian retailer currency

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
When we first launched in Canada, due to product limitation, we were only able to charge retailers in USD. This meant that all Canadian retailers who joined before July 2022 would see an estimated CAD value, but were ultimately charged in USD. As of October 6, 2022, we are now able to support Canadian retailers in their local currency, CAD.
How do I know if I’m impacted?
If you joined Faire after July 2022, you will be charged in CAD. If you already had an account, and placed and paid for an order on Faire before July 2022, your account would have been in USD, and will now be changed to CAD.
What is changing?
With this update, you will see the following changes:
All prices will be shown in CAD
Your bank account will be charged the CAD value shown in your portal
You will no longer be able to toggle between USD and CAD pricing
Your net terms, credit, any promotions, etc. will all be shown in CAD moving forward
What about invoices that were paid in USD?
For any invoices that were paid prior to July 2022, the original USD invoices will now show as CAD in your portal. Since they were charged in USD, you will see the USD value in the “Charges” section of your invoice, but the rest of the invoice will show CAD.
Please note that individual banks and/or credit card companies may charge their own conversion fees or utilize a different exchange rate, so there may be a discrepancy between the amount that was charged to your account and what you see on your invoice.

question: Why does my invoice show CAD instead of USD?
gold_answer: Your invoice shows CAD instead of USD because, for any invoices that were paid prior to July 2022, the original USD invoices will now be displayed as CAD in your portal. This change reflects the currency display on your invoice; however, if they were charged in USD, that value will still be visible in the “Charges” section of the invoice.

gold_docs.page_content:
For additional UK specific requirements, click here.
What retailers can I sell alcohol to?
Retailers in the countries listed above can buy your alcohol products. Any retailer who does not have a store in the eligible countries will not be able to purchase alcohol on Faire
We recommend you verify any alcohol order that you receive, to confirm the retailer is located in the eligible countries listed above.
How do excise duties work on Faire?
Alcohol products are subject to excise duties. Faire only supports the sale of duty paid alcohol products on the platform. This means that the price of the product must include any applicable excise duties, and you are responsible for listing the product with the correct price on the platform.
When a retailer in another country purchases alcohol products from you on Faire, they will be responsible for paying any excise duties to the customs authorities in their country.
Faire is not responsible for covering excise duties for either the brand or the retailer in any transaction for alcohol products.
Where can retailers view my alcohol products?
Retailers are able to see your alcohol products under Food & Drink category: Wine, Beer and Spirits. Within that category there are the following sub-categories: Wine & Champagne, Beer & Cider, Spirits, Pre-Mixed Alcoholic Drinks, and Non-Alcoholic & Low Alcohol Drinks.
How do I package and ship alcohol?

gold_docs.fmt_content:
Source: https://www.faire.com/support/articles/6669438351131
Title: Selling alcohol on Faire
Content:
For additional UK specific requirements, click here.
What retailers can I sell alcohol to?
Retailers in the countries listed above can buy your alcohol products. Any retailer who does not have a store in the eligible countries will not be able to purchase alcohol on Faire
We recommend you verify any alcohol order that you receive, to confirm the retailer is located in the eligible countries listed above.
How do excise duties work on Faire?
Alcohol products are subject to excise duties. Faire only supports the sale of duty paid alcohol products on the platform. This means that the price of the product must include any applicable excise duties, and you are responsible for listing the product with the correct price on the platform.
When a retailer in another country purchases alcohol products from you on Faire, they will be responsible for paying any excise duties to the customs authorities in their country.
Faire is not responsible for covering excise duties for either the brand or the retailer in any transaction for alcohol products.
Where can retailers view my alcohol products?
Retailers are able to see your alcohol products under Food & Drink category: Wine, Beer and Spirits. Within that category there are the following sub-categories: Wine & Champagne, Beer & Cider, Spirits, Pre-Mixed Alcoholic Drinks, and Non-Alcoholic & Low Alcohol Drinks.
How do I package and ship alcohol?
To learn more about packaging and shipping alcohol products, visit Shipping alcohol products with Faire
What documentation do I need to include when selling alcohol products on Faire?

question: Can retailers from any country purchase alcohol on Faire?
gold_answer: No, retailers from any country cannot purchase alcohol on Faire. Alcohol products can only be bought by retailers in the eligible countries listed above. Any retailer who does not have a store in the eligible countries will not be able to purchase alcohol on Faire.

gold_docs.page_content:
If you’re new to Faire, you'll need to submit your catalog by Friday, July 7th, to be sure that your shop can be created in time for the market event.
If you are new to Faire and would like to be included in the Market directory when it launches to retailers, you will need to have your catalog submitted by Friday, June 16th. That way, your shop can be built and available for you to set a market promotion by Tuesday, June 27th.
Add videos to your shop
Sharing your story, close-ups of your product line, or merchandising how-tos offers retailers a closer look into your brand. You can tell your story through embedding custom videos right onto your brand or product page! Your video content will be visible to all logged-in Faire retailers on demand. To learn more about adding videos to your shop, visit How to add a video to my shop.
Update your cover image
Your cover photo is the main image featured at the top of your brand’s shop page. Give your shop a fresh look for Faire Winter Market by updating your shop's cover image. To learn more about how to update your shop's cover image, visit How to update my cover image.

metadata.subtitle: How do I create a market promotion?
metadata.title: Faire Market Guide

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
You can see plenty of tips for how to set up your market for success in the Faire Market Event Guide after you’ve set your market promotion! Some additional tips are outlined below.
Update your product catalog

Add new products as soon as they’re released and make sure your entire product catalog is currently listed with up-to-date pricing. Brands who add new products are ranked 20% higher in the marketplace.

Write clear and detailed product names and descriptions to make your products stand out. Always include 250-300 characters per product description with bullet points and proper formatting. Adding more information about your products can help retailers feel more confident about placing an order, such as attribute tags that allow you to highlight key features of your products. To learn more about optimizing your product catalog, visit How to make your products stand out

gold_docs.page_content:
To check if your products are categorized as dangerous goods, we recommend referring to the shipping carrier classification.
If your products are classified as dangerous goods, use Ship on your own.


 Please note, this list is non-exhaustive and purely indicative. Faire takes no responsibility in updating these websites, the resources linked are governmental pages only. If your products fall under these categories, be aware they may be subject to additional controls, or require more specific information fields on the commercial invoice to ensure smooth import into the UK. If required fields are missing in the Faire generated commercial invoice, or your products require additional tariff code digits (see Updating your product information) we recommend you create your own commercial invoice and provide any additional information, certification, documentation required by the country you are shipping to.  Updating your product information

metadata.subtitle: Highly regulated product categories in the UK
metadata.title: Selling and importing your products into the UK

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Some product categories are tightly regulated in the UK, and may require additional documentation for customs purposes.  The most common categories we have noticed are: 
Food and drinks, Food supplements:  to learn more, visit the Rules and regulations for importing food for human consumption to Great Britain (GB). 
Products containing animal substances:  to learn more, look for information in the UK government’s import export guide 
 
Cosmetics and skin products : To import cosmetics into the UK, you may register your products with the UK OPSS portal, to learn more, visit guidance on the Office for Product Safety and Standards process 
 
Textile products and clothing:  to learn more, look for information in the UK government’s import export guide 
 
Plant and seed products:  to learn more, visit the UK Plant Health Information Portal
 
Pet products : to learn more, look for information in the UK government’s import export guide 
 
Gemstones, stones and jewellery:  to learn more, look for information in the UK government’s import export guide 
 
Toys : to learn more, visit Statutory guidance and Toys (Safety) Regulations
 
Dangerous goods : (Dangerous goods, abbreviated DG, are substances that when transported are a risk to health, safety, property or the environment. Certain dangerous goods that pose risks even when not being transported are known as hazardous materials.)

To check if your products are categorized as dangerous goods, we recommend referring to the shipping carrier classification.
If your products are classified as dangerous goods, use Ship on your own.

As a brand, if you are shipping within Europe, this includes : From an EU country to the UK You may be required by customs to provide your EORI number. This requirement is not systematic, we recommend having your EORI handy in case it is requested by customs to clear your shipments.  
To learn how to obtain an EORI number, visit:   
Economic Operators Registration and Identification number (EORI) if you are based in the EU.  What if customs agencies or carriers require additional information to clear my shipments?

question: What should I do if my products require additional tariff code digits or specific information fields on the commercial invoice for import into the UK?
gold_answer: If your products require additional tariff code digits or specific information fields on the commercial invoice for import into the UK, you should create your own commercial invoice and provide any additional information, certification, documentation required by the country you are shipping to.

Catalog Settings
Are you a visual learner? Check out this walkthrough on how product syncing works
This tab will allow you make changes on a product level.
Bulk Changes
You can bulk assign product types to products instead of going into each product and changing it on a product level. To do this, select the product type you want assigned from the dropdown, and ensure the products are selected that you’d like to update. The ‘bulk actions’ dropdown also give you the option to ‘select all’ products if applicable.
You can also bulk activate/deactivate products from this section. To do this, ensure the products are selected that you’d like to update. The ‘bulk actions’ dropdown also give you the option to ‘select all’ products if applicable. Once you’ve made your selection, from the ‘bulk actions’ tab, you can select the product.
Product Level Changes
In this section, you can make changes in bulk to products, or make changes on a product level.
To do this, click ‘Additional Product Options’ next to the product you’d like to make changes to.
Additional Product Settings:
Product Type on Faire
Backorder Date on Faire
Preorderable Item
Deadline to place preorder
Keep Product Available after preorder deadline
Expected Shipment start date
Expected Shipment end date
Override Global Settings - If this option is set to "Yes", product sync will use these product specific values instead of the global settings.
Case Size - if different from global setting
Wholesale % - if different from global setting

question: How can I make changes to individual products and set specific values for product type, backorder date, preorder settings, shipment dates, case size, and wholesale percentage in Prestashop?
gold_answer:
To make changes to individual products and set specific values for product type, backorder date, preorder settings, shipment dates, case size, and wholesale percentage in Prestashop, you can follow these steps:

1. Go to the Catalog Settings of your Prestashop Integration with Faire.
2. Locate the product you want to make changes to.
3. Click on ‘Additional Product Options’ next to the relevant product.
4. In the Additional Product Settings section, you can now set or change the following parameters for the individual product:
   - Product Type on Faire
   - Backorder Date on Faire
   - Preorderable Item
   - Deadline to place preorder
   - Keep Product Available after preorder deadline
   - Expected Shipment start date
   - Expected Shipment end date
5. If you want these settings to override the global settings for this product, make sure the option "Override Global Settings" is set to "Yes".
6. You can also specify a different Case Size and Wholesale % for the product, if these are intended to be different from the global setting.

Remember to save your changes after you've made the adjustments to the individual product settings.

question: How can I make bulk changes to the product types and activation status of my products in Prestashop?
gold_answer:
To make bulk changes to the product types and activation status of your products in Prestashop, follow these steps:

1. To bulk assign product types to products:
   - Select the product type you want to assign from the dropdown menu.
   - Ensure the products you want to update are selected.
   - If you want to apply the change to all products, use the ‘bulk actions’ dropdown to ‘select all’ products if applicable.

2. To bulk activate/deactivate products:
   - Ensure the products you want to update are selected.
   - If you want to apply the change to all products, use the ‘bulk actions’ dropdown to ‘select all’ products if applicable.
   - Once you’ve made your selection, from the ‘bulk actions’ tab, you can select the action to activate or deactivate the product(s).

These bulk changes can be made from the Catalog Settings tab which allows you to make changes on a product level.

gold_docs.page_content:
76 existing retailers reordered during the qualification quarter out of a total 486 existing retailers for your brand = 15.6% Reorder Rate.
We don’t share a retailer’s full ordering history on Faire with brands, due to our privacy policy, so this calculation will provide an estimate of existing retailers eligible for your Top Shop Reorder Rate, but it does not include which of those retailers are also active (placed an order with any brand on Faire within the last 1 year from the start of the current qualification quarter). Your total number of existing active retailers that your Reorder Rate is calculated from, will never be greater than your total of existing retailers, which this calculation helps you find an estimate for.
Perfect Order Rate
To meet the Perfect Order Rate criteria, brands must fulfill at least 70% of their orders perfectly. An order will be considered a 'perfect order' if all of the following conditions are met:
The order is shipped within 3 calendar days of your lead time
This timeframe is calculated from the date the order is sent to you, to the date the order closes as Shipped in the system, compared to your shop’s lead time on the date the order was placed.
The entered estimated ship date that the brand adds to accept the order, is not considered in this calculation, and will not affect this calculation negatively or positively.
The order contains no backordered, out-of-stock, or discontinued products
The order is not canceled for a reason within the brand's control
If you change your lead time during the qualification quarter it will not affect the “perfect” status of orders you’ve already fulfilled. The new lead time will only be applied to new orders.

question: What is the calculation used to determine the "Reorder Rate" for existing retailers on Faire?
gold_answer: The "Reorder Rate" for existing retailers on Faire is determined by calculating the percentage of existing retailers that reordered during the qualification quarter. Specifically, the Reorder Rate is calculated by dividing the number of existing retailers who reordered during the qualification quarter by the total number of existing retailers for your brand, and then multiplying by 100 to get a percentage. For example, in the provided content, 76 existing retailers reordered out of a total of 486 existing retailers, which is calculated as (76/486) * 100, resulting in a Reorder Rate of 15.6%.

We don’t share a retailer’s full ordering history on Faire with brands, due to our privacy policy, so this calculation will provide an estimate of existing retailers eligible for your Top Shop Reorder Rate, but it does not include which of those retailers are also active (placed an order with any brand on Faire within the last 1 year from the start of the current qualification quarter). Your total number of existing active retailers that your Reorder Rate is calculated from, will never be greater than your total of existing retailers, which this calculation helps you find an estimate for.
Perfect Order Rate

The order is shipped within 3 calendar days of your lead time
This timeframe is calculated from the date the order is sent to you, to the date the order closes as Shipped in the system, compared to your shop’s lead time on the date the order was placed.
The entered estimated ship date that the brand adds to accept the order, is not considered in this calculation, and will not affect this calculation negatively or positively.

The order is not canceled for a reason within the brand's control
If you change your lead time during the qualification quarter it will not affect the “perfect” status of orders you’ve already fulfilled. The new lead time will only be applied to new orders.

question: What are the criteria for an order to be considered a "perfect order" on Faire?
gold_answer:
An order will be considered a "perfect order" on Faire if all of the following conditions are met:

1. The order is shipped within 3 calendar days of the brand's lead time. This is calculated from the date the order is sent to the brand to the date the order is marked as Shipped in the system, compared to the shop's lead time on the date the order was placed.
2. The entered estimated ship date that the brand adds to accept the order is not considered in this calculation, and it does not affect the calculation either negatively or positively.
3. The order contains no backordered, out-of-stock, or discontinued products.
4. The order is not canceled for a reason within the brand's control.

Additionally, it is noted that if a brand changes its lead time during the qualification quarter, it will not affect the “perfect” status of orders that have already been fulfilled. The new lead time will only be applied to new orders. To meet the Perfect Order Rate criteria, brands must fulfill at least 70% of their orders perfectly according to these conditions.

gold_docs.page_content:
You can see a full calculation of your payout under your Orders tab by clicking on the order's detail page. Scroll to the "You got paid!" section and select "View Payout Summary." There you will find a detailed breakdown of the payout.
This section will include any additions to your payout such as shipping fees, handling fees or tax, as well as any deductions, including processing fees, promotions or commission. You will also be able to export a Payouts CSV on the Orders tab as well.
Please note: If you have shipped your order using the Ship on Your Own option the shipping cost will be separated into two lines. The first will show what the retailer paid in shipping and the second will show the additional amount that you were reimbursed by Faire. These two numbers combined will equal the total shipping cost that you paid.

Please note: If you have shipped your order using the Ship on Your Own option the shipping cost will be separated into two lines. The first will show what the retailer paid in shipping and the second will show the additional amount that you were reimbursed by Faire. These two numbers combined will equal the total shipping cost that you paid.

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Set up your shop page
Upload shop images
A feature image showcases your brand in the marketplace and in marketing emails, follow our Feature image guidelines.
A profile image represents you or your brand—this will be used as your image when messaging with retailers, as well as on your shop page. Ideal size: 1080 x 1080 pixels.
A cover image appears on your shop page, follow our cover image guidelines.
Introduce yourself
Share your brand story to add a personal touch to your shop.
Add your brand values
Provide your brand values to share with the Faire community.
Add your catalog
To get started, click Add your product catalog in the Shop Assistant toolbar on the right side of your brand portal. It’s important to submit your entire catalog because you will be featured in our New Arrivals category for your first two weeks—more products added means more visibility to potential customers.
You have three options to add your catalog:
Onboard with Shopify
Add products manually
Get Faire to help by uploading a spreadsheet or export. If you use Shopify, Etsy, WooCommerce, Prestashop, or Wix, a direct .CSV download is the best way to share your catalog. Make sure to include all columns including images.

metadata.title: Why am I getting an error when using Ship with Faire?

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Please check that the recipient postal code is valid
The retailer’s postal code may have an error in it. Sometimes this can be a typo, or there is a space where there shouldn’t be. Please correct the error and try to fulfil the order again.
Carrier is not available to ship to post office (PO) boxes
The retailer’s address contains a post office (PO) box, but the carrier is unable to ship to this type of address. Please contact the retailer to provide a different address, or select a different carrier.
Carrier isn’t available for this address
If you see this error, this means that the carrier is unable to service the retailer’s address. This can happen if the retailer is located in a rural area, or an area that the carrier is unable to service. Please go ahead and use another carrier or use Ship on your Own.
If you are still seeing an error, please reach out to our team using the Contact Us link at the bottom of our help center.

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Thanks for partnering with Faire to ship your order! We’re happy to provide shipping labels on your behalf through Ship with Faire. When we create the label for your order, we check the information provided for each package, as well as the information on the product listing itself.
Each carrier has maximum package dimensions. Please keep this in mind when selecting your package size for your orders.
FedEx packages cannot exceed 150 lbs, additional package size limits can be found here.
UPS packages cannot exceed 150 lbs, additional package size limits can be found here.
DHL packages cannot exceed 70kg/154 lbs, or the following maximum dimensions 120 x 80 x 80 cm (L x W x H). Additional package size limits can be found here.
All products in the order must have the following:
Product weight listed per unit, rather than per pack or per case
Tariff code listed in the HS6 format (1234.56)
“Made in” country selected in the dropdown menu
You can review this on your Products tab in your portal. After confirming that these are accurate, please refresh your browser and attempt to fulfil the order again. If you’re still having  trouble printing a label, please see below for some common errors.
Your package dimensions exceed the maximum length of 274 cm
The dimensions of your package exceed the maximum dimensions for UPS. Please split this into multiple packages or try another carrier.
Your package weight must be greater than 0
The weight entered on your package details must be greater than 0. Please enter the weight of all items in the order, plus packaging to proceed.
Your package can’t contain more than 123 items

question: What should I do if I am getting an error when using Ship with Faire?
gold_answer: If you are getting an error when using Ship with Faire, you should make sure that the weight entered on your package details is greater than 0. You must enter the weight of all items in the order, including the packaging, to proceed. Additionally, ensure that your package does not contain more than 123 items.

gold_docs.page_content:
If your preorder product comes in multiple variations (i.e. color, pattern, etc.), you can choose to have the availability be the same across variations or assign different ship dates to each variation.
To keep availability the same across all variations: Make sure the Same across sizes and colors toggle in the top right-hand corner is on. This toggle is on by default.
To offer different ship dates across variations: Turn the Same across sizes and colors toggle off, and add the ship date for each variation.
Why am I getting an error message?
Error: Product preorder details cannot be changed due to unconfirmed invoice #XXXX
This means you have a pending invoice that includes this product. Please go to Orders > Invoicing tab and search for the invoice number. Products included on an unconfirmed invoice cannot be updated. To get the invoice confirmed, send a reminder for the invoice or reach out to the retailer directly for more information. If you do not need this invoice, you can select delete. This will allow you to change the product availability.
Error: Cannot backorder a preorderable product/ Product that is pre-orderable cannot be back-ordered
This means your product option was marked as unavailable, which prompted it to go out of stock. To set the product option as a preorder, you will need to first mark the product as in stock by clicking Mark as In Stock. This will allow you to list the product option as a preorder.
Can I limit who can purchase my preorders?

Title: Apparel Preorders 
Content:
If your preorder product comes in multiple variations (i.e. color, pattern, etc.), you can choose to have the availability be the same across variations or assign different ship dates to each variation.
To keep availability the same across all variations: Make sure the Same across sizes and colors toggle in the top right-hand corner is on. This toggle is on by default.
To offer different ship dates across variations: Turn the Same across sizes and colors toggle off, and add the ship date for each variation.
Why am I getting an error message?
Error: Product preorder details cannot be changed due to unconfirmed invoice #XXXX
This means you have a pending invoice that includes this product. Please go to Orders > Invoicing tab and search for the invoice number. Products included on an unconfirmed invoice cannot be updated. To get the invoice confirmed, send a reminder for the invoice or reach out to the retailer directly for more information. If you do not need this invoice, you can select delete. This will allow you to change the product availability.
Error: Cannot backorder a preorderable product/ Product that is pre-orderable cannot be back-ordered
This means your product option was marked as unavailable, which prompted it to go out of stock. To set the product option as a preorder, you will need to first mark the product as in stock by clicking Mark as In Stock. This will allow you to list the product option as a preorder.
Can I limit who can purchase my preorders?

Once you’ve added all the products to the order, you will be able to Save Draft. You can then email the invoice to the retailer by selecting Email Invoice.
For more information on how to write orders and preorders through Faire, visit How to write your invoices through Faire.
When will I be paid for preorders?
Payouts work the same as regular payouts. You will be paid with your normal terms of payout based on the day of shipment. Meaning you will be paid out either on ACH Next Day or ACH Net 30 payout terms based on the payout terms you have selected. For more details visit What are my options for payouts?

question: What should I do if I receive an error message stating that the product preorder details cannot be changed due to an unconfirmed invoice?
gold_answer:
If you receive an error message stating that the product preorder details cannot be changed due to an unconfirmed invoice, you should follow these steps:

1. Go to the Orders section and then to the Invoicing tab.
2. Search for the invoice number mentioned in the error message.
3. Products included on an unconfirmed invoice cannot be updated. Therefore, to resolve this issue, you can:
   - Send a reminder for the invoice to get it confirmed, or
   - Reach out to the retailer directly to inquire and encourage them to confirm the invoice.
4. If the invoice is not needed, you have the option to select delete for the invoice, which will then allow you to change the product availability.

By taking these actions, you should be able to resolve the issue and proceed with updating the preorder details of the product.

gold_docs.page_content:
If your preorder product comes in multiple variations (i.e. color, pattern, etc.), you can choose to have the availability be the same across variations or assign different ship dates to each variation.
To keep availability the same across all variations: Make sure the Same across sizes and colors toggle in the top right-hand corner is on. This toggle is on by default.
To offer different ship dates across variations: Turn the Same across sizes and colors toggle off, and add the ship date for each variation.
Why am I getting an error message?
Error: Product preorder details cannot be changed due to unconfirmed invoice #XXXX
This means you have a pending invoice that includes this product. Please go to Orders > Invoicing tab and search for the invoice number. Products included on an unconfirmed invoice cannot be updated. To get the invoice confirmed, send a reminder for the invoice or reach out to the retailer directly for more information. If you do not need this invoice, you can select delete. This will allow you to change the product availability.
Error: Cannot backorder a preorderable product/ Product that is pre-orderable cannot be back-ordered
This means your product option was marked as unavailable, which prompted it to go out of stock. To set the product option as a preorder, you will need to first mark the product as in stock by clicking Mark as In Stock. This will allow you to list the product option as a preorder.
Can I limit who can purchase my preorders?

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Once you’ve added all the products to the order, you will be able to Save Draft. You can then email the invoice to the retailer by selecting Email Invoice.
For more information on how to write orders and preorders through Faire, visit How to write your invoices through Faire.
When will I be paid for preorders?
Payouts work the same as regular payouts. You will be paid with your normal terms of payout based on the day of shipment. Meaning you will be paid out either on ACH Next Day or ACH Net 30 payout terms based on the payout terms you have selected. For more details visit What are my options for payouts?

question: How can I offer different ship dates for different variations of a preorder product?
gold_answer: To offer different ship dates for different variations of a preorder product, you need to turn the "Same across sizes and colors" toggle off, and then add the ship date for each variation individually.

gold_docs.page_content:
250 cream pages
150 gsm paper
Lay-flat binding
Ribbon bookmark
Interior back pocket
Product photography
A picture is worth 1,000 words, especially for retailers looking to buy exciting new products. Use multiple high-quality, high-resolution, centered pictures with a white background to make your product stand out and accurately depict your products. This will lead to higher conversion rates, which ultimately contribute to higher ranking.
Upload at least 2 professional photos
High-resolution: at least 1825x1825 pixels
Square images: if your images aren’t already square, you can edit them in the image uploader to avoid harsh borders
Apparel brands may find that rectangular images work better to fully display their products
For more in-depth details, review our Product Photography Guidelines
Beautiful examples:
Product types and categories
How you categorize your products will determine where they appear when retailers search or browse on Faire. We have created site categories that help retailers easily discover the kind of products that they’re looking for. In order to accurately categorize your items, each product must have a “product type” that you designate.
Choose the most accurate product type, which ensures your products are mapped to their relevant subcategory(s) on the site
Note that products without a designated product type will not appear in your brand shop or in search results.
Learn more about Product Types and Categories to determine the best fit for maximum visibility.
Prohibited products

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
Note that products without a designated product type will not appear in your brand shop or in search results.
Learn more about Product Types and Categories to determine the best fit for maximum visibility.
Prohibited products
Sometimes, products can stand out for the wrong reasons. Faire prohibits certain products and regularly monitors the marketplace for violations, which can result in product removal. Find a full list of prohibited products in our Product Guidelines.
Putting your entire catalog on Faire means that retailers don’t have to shop in multiple places, so full catalogs and new product additions drive meaningfully higher sales. In fact, brands with more products have up to 2x higher sales than other brands, simply because retailers have more options to choose from in one place.
Below are a couple of ways to add products to your shop and complete your catalog:
Go to the Product tab in your brand portal. From there, you can upload products all at once by using the Bulk Upload feature or upload products individually
Have your own catalog file? Submit a request through the Products tab in your brand portal and our team will add your products for you
Conclusion
Now that you know what makes a great product listing, go ahead and give them a refresh to do your products justice. Not sure how to start? Get a detailed walkthrough on how to add new products or edit your existing ones, see the Help Center article here: How do I add or edit products?

Edit your existing products: Products > Bulk Upload > Download where it says Adding or editing existing products? Whether you're using our template or a file of your own to edit products, please note that the following information is required: Product identifier (ex. SKU number, product name, product token) New values

If updating a value (ex. wholesale pricing) make sure the new values are included in a column in your catalog. If you are using our template, you can make the changes directly in the file.

  Submitting product images

metadata.title: Submit a request to add or edit products

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
In the next step, you’ll be prompted to select your sharing preference for uploading images. Attach a zip file, provide the Dropbox, Google Drive, or WeTransfer link, or allow us to use photos from your website. This step is also optional, so feel free to skip it if your request does not involve images. Once this step is complete, click Next.
In the last step, you will need to provide instructions to our team. Please provide clear and detailed instructions to ensure your request is properly completed!
Once you’ve added your instructions, click Submit to submit your request. Once your request is submitted, it may take our team up to 5 business days to update your catalog. You'll receive an email once the team is finished with your request.
Need changes to be made sooner? Use our, Bulk Editor, Bulk Uploader or the Product Editor!

question: How can I edit my existing products on Faire?
gold_answer:
To edit your existing products on Faire, follow these steps:

1. Go to the 'Products' section.
2. Click on 'Bulk Upload'.
3. Download the file where it says "Adding or editing existing products?"

When editing your products, you need to include the following required information:

- Product identifier (for example, SKU number, product name, or product token)
- New values for any updates you are making (such as wholesale pricing)

If you are updating a value, ensure that the new values are included in a column in your catalog. If you are using Faire's template, you can directly make the changes in the file provided. Once you have made your changes, you can upload the file to update your product information.

question: What documentation and information do I need to provide for importing products into Australia?
gold_answer:
When importing products into Australia, you need to provide the following documentation and information:

1. Documentation specific to your company, if applicable and required.
2. A license or permit to import specific controlled products.
3. Proof of right to resell the products.
4. Tax-related identification for your company, such as an Australian Business Number (ABN).
5. Importing registration number, which could be your ABN.
6. Completion and signature of any forms required for import, if applicable.
7. A Power of Attorney (POA) letter and Customs broker information, if applicable.
8. A packing slip for the shipment.
9. A commercial invoice detailing the transaction.
10. Documentation or information specific to manufacturing practices, if applicable.
11. Product-specific documentation, if applicable and required for the particular type of goods you are importing.

question: How is the commission calculated when there is a brand promotion and a discount applied?
gold_answer:
When there is a brand promotion and a discount applied, the commission is calculated based on the discounted total rather than the pre-discount subtotal. According to the provided document, here's the process:

1. Apply the brand promotion to the subtotal to get the discounted total.
2. Calculate the commission based on a percentage of the discounted total.

For example, if the subtotal is $100 and there's a 10% brand promotion, the calculation would be as follows:

- Subtotal: $100
- Brand promotion: 10% off
- Discounted total: $100 - (10% of $100) = $100 - $10 = $90

Then, the commission is calculated on this discounted total:

- Commission on opening order: 25% of $90 = $22.50
- Commission on reorder: 15% of $90 = $13.50

So, depending on whether it's an opening order or a reorder, the commission percentage applied will differ, but it's always taken from the discounted total.

question: How is the discount applied to the order total?
gold_answer:
The discount is applied to the order total by calculating a percentage off the subtotal of the order. Here's the step-by-step process as outlined in the provided documentation:

1. Start with the subtotal of the order.
2. Apply the brand promotion percentage to the subtotal to calculate the discount amount.
3. Subtract the discount amount from the subtotal to get the discounted total.
4. If there is a credit, subtract the credit from the discounted total to get the order total.

For example, if you have a $200 order with a 10% promotion, the discount calculation would be as follows:

- $200 order x 10% = $20 discount
- $200 - $20 discount = $180 discounted total
- If there is a $100 credit applied as well, then $180 - $100 credit = $80 order total

So, the order total after the discount and any credits would be $80.

question: How can I add a preorder product to my order?
gold_answer: To add a preorder product to your order, you should go to the bottom of the Item Details section. Use the search bar to type in the name of the preorder product you would like to add, then select the product. Remember that you cannot mix non-preorder listings and preorder listings in the same order due to different ship dates. After making your edits, click on Update to save your changes. You may also leave an optional note for the retailer before selecting Submit. Once you submit, your retailer will be notified via email of the changes you've made.

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
To read more about importing food from the EU, visit Importing food and drink from the EU to Great Britain
Animal products An animal product is any material derived from the body of an animal, products containing animal substances. We recommend referencing the following UK government resources :
Import goods into the UK:
Import of products, animals, food and feed system (IPAFFS)
Importing Food, drink and composite products
For leather products (made of animal hide or skin), the UK has laws against leather products made of animals on the endangered species list. You can check if an animal is endangered by contacting the Animal and Plant Health Agency Centre for International Trade.
Cosmetics and skin products : any substance or mixture intended to be placed in contact with the external parts of the human body. Please visit the UK Government guidance around Making cosmetic products available to consumers in Great Britain and Office for Product
Safety & Standards guidance. We recommend communicating with the brands you purchase from to ensure they have taken the necessary steps for you to resell their products on the UK market.
Plant and seed products. To learn more, visit Importing plants and plant products
Metal, Gemstones, and Jewelry products. As a general resource, you can visit : Import goods into the UK to check requirements for specific products.
Kids and baby products. As a general resource, you can visit : Import goods into the UK to check requirements for specific products.
Toys. Please consult the Toys (Safety) Regulations, more specifically section #7 : Obligations of importers. This resource explains that as the importer, you need to ensure the brand / supplier has followed the necessary steps for you to introduce toy products to the UK market.

gold_docs.page_content:
It’s free to join Faire, and your costs for each order consist of commission and a payment processing fee. You’ll only pay commission when we connect you with a new retailer through our marketplace.
How much do I pay on orders from my Faire Direct customers?
You'll pay 0% commission on Faire Direct orders from customers you bring to Faire. Send existing or prospective customers your personalized Faire Direct link, and if they shop using your link, you'll pay 0% commission on their orders.They’ll be able to enjoy the benefits of shopping on Faire, like 60-day payment terms for eligible retailers and free returns on first orders. If your customer is new to Faire, they'll also get a sign-up incentive and free shipping with you for one year.
For more information on Faire Direct, check out this guide: What is Faire Direct?
How much do I pay for orders I get through the marketplace?
The standard commission rate for orders from the Faire marketplace is 15%.
When a customer first discovers you on Faire’s marketplace, we charge a one-time new customer fee of $10, on top of the standard commission rate. The $10 new customer fee only applies to the first order from a new customer—future reorders will be at the standard 15% rate.
The commission rate applied to any replacement order will be the same rate applied to the original order. However, we will only charge the new customer fee once, and we will not apply it to replacement orders or split orders.
What’s included in the commission fee and new customer fee?

Source: https://www.faire.com/support/articles/360015893392

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
As a Canadian brand, you will be paid in USD funds via an ACH deposit. You may use the provider of your choosing to obtain a U.S. routing number and account number. We recommend using OFX. Once you sign up, you will be able to obtain a U.S. routing number and account number through their service. If you are not interested in setting up an account with OFX, you may also look into other similar services or set up a U.S.-based bank account if you have a U.S. entity.
Our pricing in North America changed July 5, 2023. You can read more about what changed on our blog. Are you a brand based outside of North America? If so, read about the cost to sell on Faire outside of North America here.

question: How much does it cost to join Faire and what are the costs for each order?
gold_answer: It is free to join Faire. The costs for each order consist of a commission and a payment processing fee. You'll only pay commission when Faire connects you with a new retailer through their marketplace. The standard commission rate for orders from the Faire marketplace is 15%. Additionally, when a customer first discovers you on Faire’s marketplace, there is a one-time new customer fee of $10 on top of the standard commission rate for their first order. Future reorders from that customer will be at the standard 15% rate without the new customer fee.

question: How much commission do I have to pay for orders from Faire's marketplace and is there any additional fee for new customers?
gold_answer: For orders from Faire's marketplace, you will pay a standard commission rate of 15%. Additionally, there is a one-time new customer fee of $10 for the first order from a new customer who discovers you on Faire’s marketplace. This new customer fee is only charged once and does not apply to future reorders or replacement orders from that customer. Future reorders from that customer will only have the standard 15% commission rate.

gold_docs.page_content:
Gluten-free : Does not contain gluten (typically found in beer, breads, pastas, cakes, cereals)
Grain-free : Does not contain grains
Halal : Halal food is that which adheres to Islamic form of slaughtering (involves killing through a cut to the jugular vein, carotid artery and windpipe). Animals must be alive and healthy at the time of slaughter and all blood is drained from the carcass.
Ketogenic
Kosher - Meat and milk products are not mixed together, animal products from non-kosher food animals not included, and kosher meat is from animals that are properly slaughtered. Kosher animals are those with cloven (split) hooves who chew their cud (cows, sheep, goats)
legumes : (peanuts, beans, lentils, tofu), refined sugar, processed foods, soda & sweetened beverages, refined vegetable oils, salt, artificial sweeteners
Low fat
Low sodium
Low sugar
Nut-free : Does not contain nuts
Organic : Food that is certified to have grown on soil that had no prohibited substances applied for three years prior to harvest
Paleo : Consists chiefly of meat, fish, vegetables, and fruit, and excludes dairy or grain products and processed food, such as cereal grains,
Sodium-free : Does not contain sodium
Soy-free : Does not contain soy
Sugar-free : Does not contain sugar
Vegan : Excludes all meat and animal products (meat, poultry, fish, seafood, dairy and eggs)
Vegetarian : Excludes meat, poultry, ﬁsh and seafood
Whole foods

question: What does it mean if a food product is labeled as "Halal"?
gold_answer: If a food product is labeled as "Halal," it means that the food adheres to Islamic law, particularly in the way the animals are slaughtered. The slaughtering process involves killing through a cut to the jugular vein, carotid artery, and windpipe. The animals must be alive and healthy at the time of slaughter, and all blood is drained from the carcass.

Soy-free : Does not contain soy
Sugar-free : Does not contain sugar
Vegan : Excludes all meat and animal products (meat, poultry, fish, seafood, dairy and eggs)

Whole foods

Title: Food and drink product attribute tags
Content:
Gluten-free : Does not contain gluten (typically found in beer, breads, pastas, cakes, cereals)
Grain-free : Does not contain grains
Halal : Halal food is that which adheres to Islamic form of slaughtering (involves killing through a cut to the jugular vein, carotid artery and windpipe). Animals must be alive and healthy at the time of slaughter and all blood is drained from the carcass.
Ketogenic
Kosher - Meat and milk products are not mixed together, animal products from non-kosher food animals not included, and kosher meat is from animals that are properly slaughtered. Kosher animals are those with cloven (split) hooves who chew their cud (cows, sheep, goats)
legumes : (peanuts, beans, lentils, tofu), refined sugar, processed foods, soda & sweetened beverages, refined vegetable oils, salt, artificial sweeteners
Low fat
Low sodium
Low sugar
Nut-free : Does not contain nuts
Organic : Food that is certified to have grown on soil that had no prohibited substances applied for three years prior to harvest

gold_docs.page_content: If you fail to comply with local regulations when selling products in Germany, consequences governed by the German authorities may apply, including fines up to 200,000 €.  If you don’t register in the LUCID Packaging Register, we may limit your ability to sell to retailers in Germany.  Can I confirm if my products are currently available to German retailers?
gold_docs.fmt_content:
Source: https://www.faire.com/support/articles/7175461122715
Title: How to comply with the German Packaging Act
Content:
If you fail to comply with local regulations when selling products in Germany, consequences governed by the German authorities may apply, including fines up to 200,000 €.  If you don’t register in the LUCID Packaging Register, we may limit your ability to sell to retailers in Germany.  Can I confirm if my products are currently available to German retailers?

metadata.subtitle: What happens if I don’t register?
metadata.title: How to comply with the German Packaging Act

hard_neg_docs.page_content:
By default, brands will be available for sale in all locations where Faire is live. If you have not specifically blocked sales to Europe or Germany, your products are available for German retailers to order.
You’re responsible for complying with all laws, rules, and regulations in all countries/regions that you sell to. This includes but is not limited to: product safety, labeling requirements, testing, warnings, copyright, import/export regulations, and other consumer protection law requirements.
If you’re unable to comply with local regulations, please ensure that you have set your country restrictions appropriately. Learn more by visiting Can I control the locations where my shop is live?
Please note, this information is for educational purposes only and is not legal advice. It is not intended to create a lawyer-client relationship. Please consult a licensed attorney for specific legal assistance.

gold_answer: Yes, you need to register in the LUCID Packaging Register to sell to retailers in Germany. If you don’t register, your ability to sell to retailers in Germany may be limited by the company.
